column4: Lovely friendly staff...good selection of food. ..free transfer bus into the main town. ..not close to any shops etc.....be careful of hagglers when you get to town. ..they try to say that they work for the hotel and have seen you there. .I would definitely stay here again

column3:
Wow again!!just fabulous
Once again this hotel is fabulous food truck guys lovely ismail and aziz best ever
Food fa
column4: Well here again in this amazing hotel, Everything as usual, brilliant, all the staff are a credit to the hotel, especially hansa, kalhid, and zachariah , they are amazing guys , the shows are really good bar staff, restaurant, cleaners all ,do a fantastic job, the hotel is spotless, food so good, loving it Again !!! Dont want to leave

I have enjoyed this trip! Special thanks to Emma and MOMO who made the experience even better for me ;) Highly recommend! I like the food and the view of the property is amazing and every night there is entertainment for us all.

I spent a wonderful week in this hotel at the end of December and the beginning of January. The facilities in the hotel are very good, the staff are friendly, the food is varied and of very good quality. The entertainment programs were very good, the team of entertainers being made up of true professionals. The New Year's Eve was fantastic: the entertainment program was very good, the food was exceptional, and the atmosphere created was a dream.

I had a wonderful time here, the hotel was gorgeous aand very clean. The food was great and there plenty of variety. The staff were very helpful. There were plenty of activities to do and they were all extremely fun

The experience here was absolutely amazing. From the moment we got there, the staff were very welcoming. Checking in was straightforward and done whilst they served us some very lovely Moroccan tea. The grounds are just phenomenal! The staff at Iberostar are a HUGE asset to this organisation. They had such a large variety of food to choose from. The activities were fantastic, the children thoroughly enjoyed themselves. The only things perhaps they need to work on is their email and telephone communication. We tried to organise an event prior to going to the hotel and getting through to someone either via email or telephone was a nightmare. No response! Having said that, I thoroughly recommend this hotel and will have absolutely no issues returning!

Everything really nice! I would highly recommend and come back. Everything really nice and great service. The Animation group are so friendly and I want to thank specially Lacoste for the friendly help and service. See you next time!

Its happened that i visited this hotel for the first time , even tho im from morocco but its a total new experience food and rooms , respectful staff , big shot out to the entertainment team , lacost and mehdi … definitely coming back,

We had a great time in this holiday at iberostar Marrakech, thanks to the entertainment team first specialy khalil , mehdi and abdel, great shows and fun times .... the food and rooms are good and clean, highly recomanded

Me and my partner visited in December and it was a pleasant stay, the staff really make you feel welcome, the entertainment team are great, always remember your name and always say hello, the room was great and spacious and was always cleaned to a high standard, there is plenty to do with various activities through the day and different competitions. The food was okay for all inclusive standards, only thing I would say is not enough meat options on the cookers expect a lot of fish and occasionally chicken, there is a restaurant where you have to book to get a dining experience but for me it wasn’t that great, I’d rather eat in the inclusive restaurant. We have booked again to visit next year and we’re already looking forward to it, I can’t thank the staff enough for making us…

column3: An honest in-depth review- please read if considering this hotel
column4: My husband and I are Iberostar club members and have visited multiple other Iberostar hotels in Mexico, DR, and Portugal, all with good experiences. I have also visited over 30 countries and traveled to many types of hotels. We stayed at this hotel to explore Marrakech and also have a relaxing stay, but had a very negative experience beyond what I expected. First of all, I would like to be fair and mention that I think this hotel in general just is not the best for young couples like ourselves. The guests mostly consist of French families, and the hotel caterers for them- there are multiple activities for children and there were very few adults traveling without children. They have a trapeze class which is very unique and three different pools. Regardless I would not come back…

i eally like the hotel's view its so cute and aesthetic. Also i like the food especially cakes. The staff they are amazing without forget the best thing in hotel entertenment all team they are friendly

Beautiful place, amazing staff, they really look after you make you feel welcome! Clean & well maintained resort and rooms, beds made, clean towels and room cleaned daily, outstanding food quality, beautifully presented & lots to choose from, there is something for every taste, you are never hungry! We have had an absolutely amazing time! Would highly recommend 10/10!! Thank you! Xxx

Excellent hotel...i had a very unique experience in this amazing hotel...stuff very nice,, especially Katy...i advice every one to visit this gorgeous hotel ❤❤...if you are seeking a magnificent holiday i advise you to visit this hotel

Very nice hotel with very friendly and professional staff, nothing is too much for them . Food is very good, a lot of variety , lot of heathy options, show cooking as well. There are heathy options for the drinks as well. Evening entertainment was good.Hotel is built on nice grounds and it is well maintained. Free shuttle bus into town. I will give everything apart from the rooms 5 out of 5. Rooms are spacious and well maintained but it is on its way to been dated. Overall if I was to go back to Marrakesh I will look no further .

In fifty years of serious traveling, to all parts of the world, it has come to my attention that the main difference between hotels, comes down to the friendliness and efficiency of the staff. The Iberostar Club Palmerie Hotel does not disappoint. From the General Manager on down, everyone has one goal in mind, and that is to provide a first class experience for their guests. A customer service team that is the equal of any luxury hotel. Upon arrival, we were met by the Bellman who secured our luggage, ushered us into the lobby and provided a refreshing drink. Check in was accomplished in under 5 minutes by Mr. Muhammad Ali and the front desk staff. Throughout our stay he went out of his way to ensure our every need was met, and our room selection satisfactory. Muhammad…

Great hotel and great people. Hotel staff hardworking and it is spotless. Thank you Emma (entertainment team) and ishmail bar waiter for being so helpful and friendly. Osman on reception was extremely helpful and his English was great. We were lucky enough to be there when World Cup first round was on ….great atmosphere…. Loads to do and weather December mid 20s only had a bit of rain at night. We had room 2031 which was on ground floor and was very comfortable enormous bed Regret not doing the trapeze but deffo try it next time. Thanks for a great holiday

3 times here now and it never changes everything is as brilliant as before because it is the staff friendly people who will try to make your Holliday never walk by without saying hello food available 12 hours so you can eat and drink when you want will be back asap super place

We have just returned from a holiday here at this hotel. I can honestly say the hotel is a fantastic place to stay. The staff are so incredibly friendly and absolutely nothing is too much trouble It’s a very well run hotel, immaculately kept and absolutely spotlessly clean, the food is truly amazing, such a choice of dishes, everything made from the freshest of ingredients and always something for all tastes The gardens are beautiful and really well tended, a few seats dotted around would be really nice for people wishing to have a quiet moment amongst the trees and birdlife? The pools are heated, which is great at this time of year. We particularly enjoyed the adult only pool which was really tranquil, yet having its own bar. We loved this place so much we are thinking…

Amazing family holiday the stay has been fantastic entertainment team Emma looked after us every day and took care of all our needs she even teached us some Arabic phrases. This hotel is amazing and caters for all ages , the food is fantastic, great choice every night !

I have stayed at other Iberostar hotels in the Caribbean and have never been disappointed. This was no different. Staff are fantastic, go out of their way to please and make your stay special. They really make you feel like you are on a luxury holiday. Food was brilliant, always something different and the quality was fantastic. Yes the scrambled egg wasn’t piping hot but it was more than edible and there is microwaves if you need it hotter. Lots of choices for all meals, and with different bars offering snacks between the main meal times, you are never going to go hungry. Main pool area music was a bit intrusive but not offensive and the zen pool area was great, never had a problem getting a sun bed, some people were reserving them with towels but it wasn’t necessary at this…

I’m leaving this hotel shortly after five days. I’ll do some good and bad points. Good: the food is excellent, extensive and well cooked and presented. I’d say it’s faultless apart from one thing (see bad section). The animals: I chose this hotel because I read on TA there were cats here and I love animals. I brought them some treats from home but then read the welcome sheet from the hotel which said not to feed them. If guests don’t feed them who looks after them? They are lovely so I ignored the request and fed them daily. There are peahens and geese too. Loved them all. I’d return just for them. The staff: nearly all were smiling, helpful all the time. The pools: They are heated. Not to be hot or warm but to a temperature that is perfect. Generally I hate pools as think…

Initially I’m struggling to understand so many of the negative points raised here about this hotel. Whilst I appreciate a lot of a stay can be portioned down to fortunate timing we had an exceptional week. The food in the main buffet surpasses any expectations I could have had when booking. Variety of food from traditional moroccan, to well made Pizza and fries if you so desire. Bbq and hot plate cookery was always a treat, where often there’s fish being made at lunch. Dessert pastries are exceptional at both lunch and dinner. Admittedly the buffet restaurant exceeded the “table service” restaurant which you visit once during your stay, this night was in fact the low light of the trip. Not down to the food, but the staff were often inattentive - perhaps we had a bad night.…

column3: Great Staff great food lovely pool
column4: When we first arrived we were not 100% sure we had made the right decision. Everything was very french orientated but within a day the staff had made us feel so welcome, La Cost, Emma, Omi, Periss, Achaf and Momo, Abdul and all the other staff whos names I don't know, made us feel so welcome. The food was great, pool was lovely, the staff could not do enough for us. The bar staff, cleaners, caterers nothing was too much to ask.

This hotel is down as a fourstar and certainly lives up too its ratings This is a big complex with lovely gardens and 3 swimming pools there were always plenty of sunbeds at any time of day ,each pool has a bar beside it which serves soft and alcoholic drinks coffees teas the drinks were good quality beer wines cocktails etc There is plenty ro do through the day tennis courts bouls archery volleyball keep fit etc and an organised programme of activities The food in the restaurants was very good with fresh meats and fish being cooked to order a mixture of morrocan and western dishes lovely breads salads etc it does get a little repetive over 14 days but you can't expect anything else the control of the hyigne was good and we had no upset tummies etc All the staff are very…

I write this review, sitting by the pool on our last full day ! I’m here with my husband- we left the kids at home for our first trip in 7 years child free - we wanted winter sun and a good quality all inclusive hotel and we definitely got both! The weather for the end of November is amazing - cool in the morning and evening - 11-5 pm glorious and about 23-26 degrees. My husband is a travel consultant and with his job we have travelled the world staying in many 4-5 and 5 star plus hotels , so it’s from that experience I write this review . Firstly I have to address the review that said they waited 4 hours to get through customs- it took us 20 mins…. There is a form that needs to be completed - we got this online and filled in before we left , if you don’t have this it will…

column3: Great hotel but could improve a few small things.
column4: Have just returned yesterday from my third visit to the Iberostar Club Palmeraie and look forward to visiting again next March. The weather in early November and in March is excellent, especially for us from a north of Europr. Mostly what I have to say about the hotel is EXCELLENT. It is as clean as whistle; the staff are friendly and efficient; the gardens are lovely and very extensive; two pools are superb plus there's a dedicated kids pool. Food was buffet style and there were changes every day; the Moroccan food offering was excellent but most of the buffet was international and extensive. I do have two down-sides but not enough to put me off returning. 1. The main dining room lacks character....badly. It is very brightly lit and is a bit "canteen-ish". It needs better ,…

The staff make this hotel what it it is. Always smiling always willing to help or advise so thank you from the reception staff to the restaurant staff to the pool staff to the bar staff etc. You are a credit to the hotel. We loved the extensive grounds with 3 great pools, extensive sports facilities and food and bar stations. The main restaurants were good a little more food signage and hotter food might be suggested but the quality was great. Entertainment was pretty much the same team each night with different themes, it was very professional maybe a little variation needed. The guitarist one night in the restaurant was simply outstanding they should use him more. Lots of tours to go on and we did the City and Atlas Mountain both very good. My wife and i have to…

column3: Our second visit in 2022 and still highly recommended .We will be back soon!
column4: This is the second time we have visited this hotel. We highly recommend it. From our greeting in reception from lovely Nabil, who was still smiling despite being very busy at that time, to the professionalism and efficiency of manager Mohammed this really wonderful hotel. The food is amazing, my husband eats like a king for the week and is then very miserable when he comes home to normal food! The staff clearing the tables are fantastic It genuinely feels like a restaurant which can be challenging catering for high numbers. When I booked I did not have a choice of rooms. I emailed and we were changed to a garden view room as when we visited the first time we found that the double pool view room was too noisy for us (without young children) and the garden view rooms are…

WOW. WOW. WOW. What can I say about Iberostar Club Palmeraie only we will be back. All the positives. Food great. Drinks very good. Pools lovely. Really clean. So much to do. Brilliant shuttle bus service. Evening shows outstanding. Day time activities non stop if u want to do them. Gardens immaculate. Rooms cleaned daily. A VERY BIG THANK YOU TO 4 SPECIAL MEMBERS OF STAFF who went out of there way and beyond. New friendships made. ADIL. ACHRAF. LACOSTE and EMMA. 4 very special people so friendly, helpful and happy. We will being going back. Highly recommend. ♥️ Just one negative i wish all the food was labelled so we now what we are eating instead of having to ask and not getting a very good answer from the chefs and waiters. The food is so good jthat is just the only…

Very friendly staff, clean rooms, good bed, and decent breakfast. Everything was OK, but the food served in the buffet was a bit tasteless, and a lot of the food had a Moroccan "stable" smell. After all, certainly a good option for families with children. A free shuttle bus to Medina is a big plus!

This hotel is fantastic and made even better by the amazing and plentiful staff! It is spotlessly clean and well maintained. The entertainment and sports facilities keep everyone busy. A special mention for Periss, Momo and Lacoste for their fun energy with all the sports activities and Sara on the front desk. But all staff were polite and helpful throughout the resort. we will be back. Highly recommend.

column3: A relaxing stay and would return. Few improvements would help
column4: Overall we had a great stay and would return again. We were met by welcoming staff and shown to connecting rooms as requested. The adult only pool was extremely relaxing and comfortable with plenty of space to relax. Lots of entertainment and the archery instructor was sassy and fun while helping us. We liked him a lot! Food was all fresh and tasty, albeit sometimes a little cold. Bars were well stocked and there was an enthusiastic evening entertainment team. While a little outside the city it was easy to travel when needed. However, also offered an oasis of calm for a very relaxed trip. Cabs always outside. Very cheap late checkout also available which was very welcome. Few areas of improvement: 1) Doors to the room and connecting doors aren’t soundproof at all and so…

The hotel is lovely. The grounds are so well maintained, the pools and facilities are great. The drinks are perfect, with lovely coffee, G&Ts, great cocktails (espresso martinis, mojitos or even Abdou's specials). There are even peacocks strolling around the grounds. Food was brilliant, with plenty of choice. There is a section for pizzas and pastas, for people who want some home comforts. They do different specials each day ranging from savoury crepes to kebabs. There is also a BBQ outside which changed each day. The staff are brilliant, from the waiters and bar staff to the spa staff. Plus Hassan as a golf instructor and you can't praise the entertainment staff enough - Emma, Lacoste, Perris and Oumi. They do whatever they can to make your holiday extra special. We…

column3: good experience, can improve in some areas
column4: I have visited all 3 spanish branded All inclusive resorts in Marrakech, this is the better one, here is why - staff is excellent, friendly, experienced and genuinely helpful - Food: pretty diversified, missing some healthy options that can be labeled, deserts quality is poorest among the 3 resorts, the afternoon snacks were limited and of no diversity, i'd rank them below par compared to others - Kids Club: staff and outside activity are good enough, kids like them. the kids club needs some on premise upgrade with kids games... - shows and entertainment : best of all 3 resorts by far. missing some sports tournament to create some camaraderie and challenges - rooms: old and need revamp, the noise in corridors is extremely problematic because corridor noise echoes and you hear…

Just returned from Marrakech, Hotel was great - I think the reviews are unfair - the hotel is an older hotel, but our room an surrounding areas were always very clean. Pools were great - the Zen pool is very quiet but the main pool was lively but not too loud. Morocco's 2nd language is French and this is spoken mostly but most of the staff can speak English and are very helpful - Shout out to Lacoste who was great fun - all the activity staff work really hard. The food is OK - much like most All Inclusive buffets - always something to choose from - my one complaint is that the food needs to be labelled better, my son is allergic to nuts and we were unsure a) what we were eating and b) what contained nuts - this needs to improve. We had a great week - weather was glorious -…

We have just come back from a week at the Iberostar Palmeraie with my family, we were 7, including one grandchild of 9. The hotel is the ideal place for this sort of holiday, but also for a quiet break as a couple. The two heated pools, one quiet and one with entertainment, mainly for French people who like that sort of thing are excellent. I cannot prise the staff enough, Sara and Mohammed Ali in the lobby, Rachida and Bouchra in the dinning room, Samir at the pool, and many more. All so kind and helpful. My son had an accident and needed hospital treatment and they were amazing. The all inclusive is really all inclusive, the food in the restaurant is superb, the choice endless, with grilled meats, salads, vegetables all of excellent quality, and the desserts are scrumptious.…

column3: Fantastic group visit to Iberostar Marrakech
column4: A group of 14 of us stayed here in November 2022 and all thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Food was excellent - always fresh with plenty of variety. Bar staff were attentive. Ents staff consistently went out of their way to keep us entertained. Special thank yous to the guys running the waterpolo and aqua aerobics and Emma for being so welcoming to us all. Management were visible and really maintained high standards. Paella cooking course was much appreciated. Dancers were hard-working and very talented. Highly recommended!

Stayed here in October half term. Lovely clean hotel and excellent staff. We didn’t do our homework and unfortunately the hotel was packed with French and the hotel catered entirely for the French. The entertainment was not great and the hotels very remote not that there’s bars restaurants etc to go to, it’s a very different holiday experience. The food was ok, fresh but very boring. If you are thinking about going to Morocco be prepared for a 2 to 3 hour wait to get through their customs and immigration control. Absolutely diabolical with border staff really not bothered and basically wasting everyone’s time watching you tube clips and having a laugh with the other staff. There’s also a hour to get through the customs on departure also!! Personally I won’t return to Morocco.

Fantastic stay at the Iberostar! Staff fantastic - always had a smile and would help you with anything. Food very well presented and good quality although would like to see some labels on the food in the buffet for allergy reasons. Hotel is spotless, the grounds are absolutely immaculate, rooms cleaned to a very high standard. Pool areas lovely and enjoyed the house wine and beer, also the fizzy drinks were very good. I cannot complain for the price at all! It may be a bit out of the city centre but I found Palmeraie to be much more relaxing then the city, we went to the YSL museum in a taxi for less then £25 return and the Souks near the main square for £30. Very good weather in last week of October aswell 35 degrees most days.

I don't do hotel reviews on TripAdvisor but felt it necessary to do this and I will be very honest. The hotel management have done a great job with this place. It is a lovely resort and the staff are a credit to this place. They work so hard and ensure that guests are happy. They are very friendly and not in your face. The food was very nice, fresh, tasty and varied everyday. The entertainment team are amazing. The grounds are immaculately clean and makes you want to walk round all the time. The facilities are great too and activities always going on at different times of the day. The cocktail party was lovely. I could go on and on but I just want to say a big thank you to all the staff here for making my stay a memorable one. And not forgetting Rachida in the restaurant who…

What an amazing holiday in a fab hotel made more fabulous by all the staff that work so hard to make every guest feel like a member of their own family during their stay. The reception staff, waiters, bar staff, animation team, Kappa Club team, housekeeping team, gardeners, concierge, spa staff, pool lifeguards. . . everyone made my stay one to remember and everyone I spoke to said the same. Thank you! I have booked to come again very soon x

Very relaxing stay! We especially enjoyed dining outdoors under the olive trees in the evenings. The food is outstanding and there’s a huge choice. All the restaurant staff are particularly friendly and were happy to assist with our daughter's nut allergy. We thoroughly enjoyed our massage in the Spa. The adults-only Zen pool and bar is a haven of tranquility. The hotel is a set in several acres of gardens which are surprisingly green and attractive. Comfortable rooms with lovely garden views, and the surprise flowers on the bed were a nice touch. The gym is much larger than we expected and very well equipped with new machines. The free bus into the city (30 mins) was really great. Our favourite cocktails included San Franciscos and Mojitos, and the beer and wine are pretty…

This was my first visit to Marrakech and it did not disappoint. The hotel was stunning. The grounds are immaculate and the staff work herd every day to keep it this way. There some resident cats and kittens and they are very clean, well looked after and friendly. Everyone loved them. The rooms were great. Spacious and clean. Housekeeping went in every day and sometimes left rose petal designs on the bed. Nice touch. The shower was always hot and had good pressure. There were a few mosquitos when we arrived but we asked reception if someone could spray the rooms, which they did straight away. We only went to the aduts only pool but it was great. So relaxing and always plenty of beds. It has a little bar at the end where you can get all kinds of drinks. The buffet restaurant was…

What a surprise gem,our stay was excellent with goal of winter sun and no stress and iberotsr staff delivered, from Youssef at the poolside bar, Merium was a delight in the restaurant and Abdou every evening keeping us toped up with mojotos. Momo was everywhere keeping us well entertained with such a happy personality. Led by Mehdi the evening entertainments were great fun. The gardens were also kept perfect with a continuous army of gardeners, well done! The spa was exceptional and great value. Only one more thing to say we will be back thank you for a lovely holiday.

Wow what can I say about this hotel, apart from we had a amazing time. Our welcome from Mohammad really set the tone of the hotel and the right first impression, he was very welcoming and informative. The hotel and grounds were lovely, very well kept and soooooooo clean. The food was very good and so fresh and the restaurant staff were so friendly and helpful. All working very very hard. The room itself was very clean and fresh and plenty big enough for our family. Again the house keeping staff worked so hard. A special thanks to the general manager, guest relations manger and the nurse on site who gave 5* service when our little 1 year old boy was poorly, we can’t thank you enough. Keep up the good work everyone, we will definitely be returning

My husband, 16 year old daughter and I stayed a week here and had a great time. After the "luxury" of our Ryanair flight we had a simple transfer and a lovely welcome to the hotel. Staff sat us down, gave us a drink of fresh juice and our all inclusive bands. We were sent off to the restaurant so we could have lunch before it closed and returned to find ourselves all checked in. Rooms - OK, nothing spectacular but cleaned everyday to a high standard. Water pressure wasn't great! Food - reasonable. We are something different most days. It's not the hottest but there is a microwave which we used. The foot truck burgers were great! Pools - we only used the Zen pool. It was lovely and quiet. Cold going in but refreshing. Didn't need to put towels down unless you want a…

column3: Return visit, now with gluten and lactose intolerance
column4: Delighted to say thanks to the excellent management the hotel has been maintained to an excellent standard .sadly i now have both a gluten and lactose intolerance .there is such a wide variety of food available i never had a problem .the staff will seek out alternative milk for you etc but to be honest i found i was happy eating new selections .if one is desperate for an exact food the shuttle drops you just outside an carrefrour which-stocked my favourite milk etc .i was delighted with the variety of fresh-salads available .my husband who eats very differently was also delighted with the choice . The rooms are cleaned in depth every day by very cheerful cleaning staff.the wait staff are delightful but non intrusive .somehow i was bitten by something strange (i know of no one…

column3: Didn’t even last 12 hours, hell on earth! Avoid unless you like cold food, flat drinks, hard beds, bricks as pillows.
column4: To say this hotel was a disappointment is an understatement. We arrived last night having booked in good faith via BA Holidays, after reading all the ‘wonderful’ reviews on trip advisor, and simply cannot now understand how the hotel can attract so many five star reviews when it falls so short on every level. To summarise: In no way whatsoever is this place ‘4 Star’ Receptions smells of bleach All other communal areas smell of smoke Decor generally very old and tatty No staff on hand outside to welcome you / help you with bags when you finally arrive (location is in the middle of nowhere) Staff are only polite if you tip them, our ‘bellboy’ insisted on bringing our bags up to the room in the very old lift, and had obviously just been out for a cigarette as reeked of smoke. I…

We arrived on 07.05.2022 for a 14 day holiday. After a short taxi transfer from the airport we were the only people checking in. Although check-in wasn’t until 15.00 they managed to get our room ready by 13.00. We were given our room number and set off to find it. Our luggage arrived shortly after. The room was a good size with a bathroom and a very small balcony with a table and chairs overlooking the gardens. The beds were very comfortable and the air conditioning coped very well with temperatures hitting 40 degrees. The cleaner did a fantastic job all through our stay and even left towels and toilet rolls outside the room if we were having a break from the sun. There was plenty of wardrobe space to hang all of our clothes which can normally be a problem. The only thing…

Welcome : A party of 13 of us arrived at the hotel and were warmly welcomed with a drink. We were seated in reception while the staff did the necessities to have us checked in. There was a misunderstanding the hotel vouchers and it ended up taking a long time to sort out but once sorted, the manager did all he could to make our stay seamless. Buffet restaurant : The chef does a good job of being creative with the dishes. There’s award something for everyone from salads, fish, chicken and red meat dishes as wall as the tagine of course. Moroccan restaurant: Spa : We had a range of massages and hammam treatments and although we weren’t blown away as they lack the finesse, we were all happy with the treatments.

To be honest we picked this hotel because it was in the Iberostar group and we've had many happy holidays in Cuba and Crete so we knew what to expect with the quality of food and accommodation generally. The icing on the cake was the daily Golf lesson with Hassan - all part of the Animation programme. This was excellent. We had one to one attention and it certainly has made us think more about our game. We are both fairly new to the game but have tried to keep up a weekly 9 hole practice. When we attempt a shot we say "Hassan will be watching" or "Hassan will be proud" when it goes well. Only slight criticism is the lack of labelling of food or a general menu which could be put on the entrances to the restaurant. This would be particularly useful around the show cooking. …

Where to start with this one…. Check in was simple and staff were helpful informed me my poolside room would be ready in one hour, gave me the wrist bands to get food/drink use facilities etc and all seemed great. Poolside seemed fun and the animation team were friendly and helpful, the trapeze is brilliant and my daughter loved it instantly, nice addition. The gardens are very well kept and everything on the outside of the building is great. Except the food truck, the quality of food I couldn’t comment on as after watching the flies crawl over it all I decided to swerve it. Drinks were poor, but there are other better bars so no big deal. First impressions were excellant. From there it all went downhill….. pool side room was a nightmare, if I strained my neck and…

Was pleasantly surprised how good this place was. The staff are super friendly. The grounds are lovely very well kept. Very clean . Food was good . I’d definitely go back and met people who have been back many times

The hotel staff were friendly but the buffet food was luke warm, would wait for more food to be freshly cooked and the Moroccan restaurant was not worth it. One waiter who did not speak english and was not traditional food. There were a lot of french staying there that smoked (a lot) even whilst we were eating. Not pleasant and the compare spoke mostly in french. We had a nice relaxing time around the Zen pool but a five days was enough. The rooms were clean but fairly basic (not enough hangers)

The hotel is excellant ! The food is very good , the staff is friendly and know how to make you feel good. I want to thank katy for making us spending a holiday full of fun and laught ! I will visit this hotel again for sure with my friends and family !

This is a really mixed review. I don’t think this hotel is worth the money. The food was terrible and I ended up with campylobacter and have been sick for 2 weeks! The activities are amazing though , I loved the Archery, Trapeze and spin. The entertainment team are mostly really nice, especially Abdo, Morad, Achraf and Hocine and they really want you to have a good time. The waiters are also lovely. They had a good couple of entertainment evenings and the white party was the best..Morad in the fire show was amazing. The director of the hotel was very welcoming but the reception staff were just rude. The room was nice and very big but not the cleanest. If I could just go back for the activities pool and people I would but not worth the food poisoning!!

We once again had an excellent stay for the 8th time, first I would like to thank all the staff of the hotel without exception for their excellent service, generosity and their permanent smile, it must be said that from year to year the hotel always keeps its elite place for us, in terms of hygiene service listening sympathy you are at the top, but I would like to particularly thank again Mr. oualid the hotel manager for his dedication and professionalism, the beautiful sarah and mohamed ali for their hospitality, helpfulness and sense of listening, thank you for always being there, I also thank our dear zakaria at the reservations department for his kindness and his professionalism and warm welcome, I wish you a good continuation I have not seen better than you I assure you,…

My stay in iberostar was excellent!! The food is soooo delicious. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The entertainment is amazing ( abdel ,ssamadi ,abdou ,katy,bakadi piris ,achraf) Every night a new show. The staff is very nice!! I highly recommend this hotel!!!

column3: Great for a short 3-4 stay to relax
column4: The hotel facilities and staff where were very friendly and helpful, but tipping and thanking definitely helped better service. Lots of activities to keep you busy. The selection of food in the buffet was very good but some was cold. The traditional morrocian restaurant you get one night of your stay was very slow service and basic at best. Alot of people smoke and have no concideration for people that don't especially around the pool and outdoor eating areas. The bar selection is good and the drinks are nice but all bars close at 12am with no option of a late drink as town is 25 minutes in a taxi

Absolutely brilliant. Facilities, staff and rooms all fantastic. Staff were so happy to help those who needed it and I saw them rushing to help anyone who wanted anything. We were very pleased with the attention given by the general manager who was always out and about making sure everything was up to standard. Food was very good and even when busy queues were minimal. The outside seating was a lovely escape from the noise of the communal eating hall. Waiter service was excellent for drinks etc and once our order was ‘known’ we were often brought drinks by regular waiters from different stations (6 beers for 2 of us!) Will definitely return!

column3: Do yourself a favour and stay in a riad. Avoid this place at all costs.
column4: After a day of staying at this resort i was really wondering how this place has so many 5 stars reviews and it seemed weird that everyone mentions the names of particular staff members, when people usually write reviews they usually just write staff were great not particular names, right? But I ended up finding out on the second day that staff come around and ask you to write a review and say to mention there name on it, you even get credits for writing a positive review. Bribing some may call this? We have been in Marrakesh for a week before coming here and our riad before here had way better service and was so much cleaner, nicer and more authentic then this place. From the start this place was a let down: The reception staff on check in, ran quickly through the paperwork…

column3: A great place to stay for a week in the sun.
column4: Arrived and greeted with a nice drink and early check in which set the standard for a good holiday. The room was spacious, comfy, good AC, tv with a range of channels and a nice bathroom. Whilst relatively small, the balcony offered a nice view into the gardens and the sunset could be seen behind the buildings. 3 good pools with plenty of beds, no early rush and plenty of options. Food was a good standard but repetitive, although they did offer theme nights which was nice. However we personally felt that breakfast wasn't the best, but did enjoy the pastries.

I was convinced by previous reviews stating great staff and lovely food when booking and wasn’t disappointed! Good sized clean and comfortable rooms, although we didn’t get any toiletries until half way through our holiday. Probably the friendliest team of staff I’ve ever come across - from management, bar staff, reception and cleaners, everyone we met was cheery and friendly. There is constant cleaning, maintenance and gardening going on but it’s not intrusive on your holiday the gardens are amazing. Food selection is varied & delicious - lots of stations every meal time where they are freshly cooking food for you; some things are the same each day, but there are also new things to try for variety - including roast beef on Sunday! Entertainment is there if you want it - we…

Very good hotel, everything from the staff to the beds and pillows were spot on. Enough sunbeds for everyone. Food very good, they try and cater for many different nationalities. 2 very minor points, salt and pepper should be out in buffet restaurant for every serving and could do with some small drinks tables up on stage area as nowhere to put glasses. Other than that really enjoyed it and will be back.

column3: Just do it and go and enjoy the experience of this hotel and Marrakech
column4: Having reviewed many of the reviews of the hotel and Marrakech prior to going, I was a little unsure of what to expect. Don't read any of them expect this one and the positive ones. Having spent a week at the Iberostar I couldn't recommend this hotel enough. Arrived earlier than the check in time due to the time of the flight, welcomed with a drink and an expected time of when the room would be ready (1 hour). Able to use all the facilities and start the holiday straight away whilst we waited for the room. In essence I have read reviews stating that the French guests are favoured above the English or other nationalities, I can assure you this is not the case. All the staff treated everyone equally and with a smile. Reviews about the lack of variety of food, don’t worry about…

This holiday to Marrakesh has been absolutely wonderful. From the minute you arrive, the staff are so friendly and do everything for you. The view from our room wasn't the best and so we asked if there were any other available rooms, and without any fuss or hassle, we were upgraded. The staff at Iberostar are amazing. They work so hard and nothing is ever too much to ask. They always serve you with a smile and are so very attentive. Everybody from the cleaners, the ground keepers, the food truck staff, the entertainment team, the restaurant staff - I really can't fault them! The gardens, pool areas and rooms are immaculate and cleaned every day. The maids put out fresh towels each day. The restaurant is wonderful and accommodates for all types of eaters. Plenty of food to…

column3: Found a second place in this Resort
column4: what a wonder of space we found here. I already say that I recommend it and that I will definitely return to this country and it will be in this resort that I will stay. We arrived long before check-in time, around 9:30 am and the first concern they had with me and the family and we were 9 people, was immediately and before anything else, they sent us to breakfast so that we could eat something, extraordinary Mohamed (maletero). the Staff is awesome, they make us feel really special and very well treated, from Zacharias at the reception, to Yussef and Mohamed at the bar, but who we really became friends with was Ashram and Elhocine, from the pool towels. Very friendly and smiling guys, in general, like all the hotel staff. The facilities are excellent, with comfortable rooms,…

Of the many resorts I've been to, this was without a doubt where I felt the best! the staff is absolutely fantastic (thanks Achraf and company) . We arrived long before we could check in, tired from the trip and without eating. Without asking for anything, we were immediately told that we would have breakfast while the rooms were prepared. We realized right there that the stage was going to go well! Super clean and well maintained hotel. The food is good and there is a lot of variety and the hotel takes care of having a grill with different meats every day. It's really good. Super nice and well maintained spaces. Three pools, one more confusing and always partying, one for children and then the Zen one that was the most used for us and where we can relax with lots of mojitos!…

Really cannot fault this hotel. Our family holiday was everything we wanted! Room for 3 of us was maybe smaller than we expected but really clean and totally functional! The lady who cleaned it daily was just lovely! Around the pool (activity pool) we could not fault Ismail...he bought drinks, was happy, chatted and was a true credit to the hotel... The activity schedule was full on! We didn't use it much but there really was something for everyone! At night the show time was always there but again we chose to get then sit Olin the outside bar area...Mohammed and Samir were fantastic!! Food was always lovely ..fresh and nasty! Would totally recommend....there was nothing not to love!!!!

Hotel with very large and well-maintained outdoor areas, with several sports areas. Two big pools. Good restaurants. Nicely decorated rooms. Very friendly and attentive staff. Need to improve on hotel rules

column3: Great hotel and staff is very attentive!
column4: Stayed at the Iberostar for 4 nights with my sister and friend! Was a lovely getaway, the hotel had many activities for us to take part in, the evening entertainment was superb and lots of fun! the staff was very attentive, they was very kind and went above and beyond to ensure we had a great stay here at the Iberostar! The location of the hotel was close to town so we made use of the free shuttle service – will be returning!

My boyfriend and I have just returned for a week visit and our overall experience was ok. I do not recommend this hotel to younger couples who want a proper dining and night life experience. We did try the on site restaurant one night and were left unimpressed, the food was not nice and made me feel unwell. Overall, the food was ok and the hotel was quite clean it just wasn’t the experience I was hoping. However, if you were visiting with a family with young child this place is perfect for you.

Just returned from 8 days at this hotel . It was spotlessly clean , cleanest rooms I’ve ever stayed in, shampoo, conditioner & hand gels all provided plus big nice pool towels , plenty of sun beds so no need to get up at the crack of dawn and race to get one which is nice . Food & drinks were lovely and plentiful , the staff very friendly and helpful. Maoud, Ismail and.the rest of the gang from the entertainments team were so friendly and always made a point of coming over to say hello and knew everyones names . The waiters and infact all the staff work so hard with smiles on their faces all day long. Lots to do for the kids in the day . Only thing I would say is the entertainment in the evening could have been a bit better as lots of dancing shows and not much else so…

We've just spent a relaxing ten days here, leaving Thursday. The hotel is smashing, the food great, the staff sincere and hard-working, the accommodation clean and modern. Oh, and the other guests were a considerate mix of French, Italian and Spanish with a sprinkle of Brits . Will definitely return. Makes the Caribbean look a bit try-hard.

From start to finish we had an amazing week here. The accommodation was very nice and the maids were superb. The complex is top notch and the staff really can't do enough for you. The food was wonderful if you try it. Why would you come to Morocco and eat pizza and chips? Not many Brits which was a bonus although the people we met were lovely. Lots to do if you wish or just chill with a strong cocktail! We visited the Medina x3. Great experience and the people were friendly. Expect to be invited into every shop but it was fun and if you don't want just be polite. Medina at night is a must. Don't be scared its wonderful. Just keep your wits about you. I could go on forever. Marrakech is a great place and the hotel comes highly recommended. Would love to return one day. By the…

My stay was fantastic, the people are warm and friendly. I loved the animation, full of energy and good mood. everyone is lovely and it was a great pleasure to meet them. I have to highlight in particular katy and mouad who are wonderful. thank you very much and hope to see you again soon. ❤️

Great experience, the hotel is very large with 3 pools. It is kept clean and tidy by the hardworking hotel staff. The food was lovely and plentiful with lots of choices even for fussy eaters. There is a grilled bbq every evening. We really enjoyed the cocktails, try the mojitos the best we have ever drank. There is a free shuttle bus which goes to the centre of Marrakech it takes about 20 minutes. Do take your own beach towels if you can, you can borrow some from the hotel with a deposit however everyone has the same towel so easy to lose. There is a varied activity programme if you want to do activities. Beautiful luscious green grounds. The rooms were very nice and large with balconies. You can purchase tours at reception but I wouldn’t recommend the half day trip to…

This hotel was very nice, the staff was tremendously kind and helpful. It's a bit far from the city, but they have shuttles periodically throughout the day to take you into and out of the town. You can also take a taxi, but it's a bit expensive since it's out of their way a lot. There's not quite enough seating by the pools, so you have to work hard to find a place to sit. Most people will claim a spot in the morning and leave their stuff there all day so they have seats if they return. The food was pretty good overall -- they had a lot of options for all meals. (Their pastries weren't very good, unfortunately.) They have a lot of activities for people to do, and their spa is very nice. The service is really great and they were so welcoming. It was a bit noisy at night, but not…

Fantastic hotel, hotel staff really friendly, air conditioning in the room fab as 42 degrees ! Plenty of activities, evening entertainment really good, would come here again but maybe when temp is a little cooler

This holiday was just what we all needed, the staff are very friendly and can’t do enough for you, this hotel is predominantly set up to cater for the French customers and some staff only speak a little English but would always greet you with a smile. The food was plentiful with lots of choice I’m vegetarian and did find it hard to tell if some dishes contained meat or fish, but there was alway enough choice even for the pickiest of eaters and the desserts were so beautiful and yummy. The family pool was busy but we always managed to get sun beds and even when we visited the Zen pool there would be sun beds available, if not the staff would try and find you one. The rooms are spacious and the maid service is daily and they do an amazing job, the air-con isn’t the best when…

Have to mention bakadi, periss, mouad and the main man and woman in the animation team and Mohamed and barman at the zen pool. The staff really go above and beyond to be friendly and ensure you enjoy yourselves. I usually lie low on holiday but they were so charming. Saw young staff sitting chatting and playing cards with elderly people on their own which was lovely. If you go into Marrakesh ask the man on the bus to get you a guide when you get there as otherwise people approach you. The hotel has three pools - adult only was perfect. Food very good. Hotel and rooms spotlessly clean and modern. Enough sun beds. Lots of activities incl big circus trapeze. Few English tv channels incl sport if you want that. Hotel really makes an effort with guests and little cocktail soirées,…

I had a amazing time here I will come next yemear it was such an amazing experience the staff are so amazing helpfully and kind and I met a girl staff called Katty and mouad they are such kind funny amazingI love this place so much this place is so amazing I came last year and I came this year I will come next year too amazing

Just returned from 2 weeks all inclusive at this hotel. We had an inter connecting double which was perfect for us with 2 teenage daughters. Rooms cleaned every day and included air con which was definitely needed! The food was plentiful and always included Moroccan, pasta, pizza, meat and salad bar. Staff very helpful and attentive, offering to get us drinks even though it’s not in their remit. Younis was particularly brilliant!! We spent our days by the Zen pool which is over 16s only. Lifeguard does enforce the rule and keeps the peace! Ajoub kept our drinks topped up from the Zen bar and he made us laugh a lot!! We missed him on his day off. Entertainment was busy! You were not stuck for choice. Golf, table tennis, trapeze, volleyball are just some of the activities my…

The vibes of the hotel are so amazing the activities the stuff were so friendly and kind they never let feel bored especially katty she’s so kind and hyping girl, everything was so perfect pretty sure this will be my favorite place to visit in marakkesh 😍

Best Resort in Marrakech. Staff, facilities, Room, food & beverage…you can find all you need for a nice holidays. Specials thanks for M.Walid, the maitre Redoune, chef Miguel and the nice reception team with Mohamed y the helpful man: Zakaria. Iberostar Top Hotel in North Africa!

This hotel is amazing! Spotlessly clean and the food is incredible - plenty of variety and very fresh. Pool has lots of activities throughout the day and the night time entertainment is not to be missed. The staff here fantastic and work incredibly hard to ensure you have a pleasant stay. Special mentions go to Abdulmoula on reception and Mohammed, Samir and Imad at the bar. It was our first time at this hotel but it won't be our last - we can't wait to return.

column3: A nice hotel, good food, extremely hot weather, not recommended for English speaking travellers
column4: We just spent a week here as a couple (both 20). We booked with loveholidays which was good as there is a rep in the hotel and a rep waiting for us at the airport so can’t fault anything there. The rooms are nice very clean and absolutely nothing to fault in them. It’s two twin beds pushes together but extremely comfortable, good size fridge, couch, nice bathroom. We didn’t use our balcony at all as there were these large ‘paper wasps’ which were very scary lol. We had a garden view so maybe this is why we had that problem. The food is good in the hotel, definitely something for everyone and a good variety each evening. We had Japanese night with fresh noodles and chicken dishes and sushi, kebab night, roast chicken night, lots of pasta dishes, amazing pizza, fab salads,…

column3: Amazing hotel, great service and fantastic staff!
column4: My experience at the hotel was super lovely - they have a wide range of activities for you to get involved in, three pools, great selection of food from the buffet and each evening they have entertainment for you to join along with. A massive thank you to Ayoub who works at the Zen Bar, who was so friendly, went above and beyond to makes us feel comfortable and made us all constantly laugh! He provided such a great service and was so friendly to all the guests. Yati and Maoud for being such great entertainers and again for making us feel so comfortable. The cleaning staff and catering team who work really hard to make sure everyone is happy and provide really high standard of customer service. Overall my experience at the hotel was great and I'd definitely recommend…

Just returned from our 3 time at this lovely hotel, from start to finish staff cannot do enough for you. They all work very hard from the cleaners, bar staff, entertainment staff and chefs and any others I have left out. A big hello and thank you to the bar staff who always knew what we had to drink and kept our glass full and to the waiter from the food truck (sorry didnt get his name) who kept us topped up in the day. Hotel is spotless. Food always lots of choice and I am a fussy eater but always was something to choose from. You don't need to get up early for sunbeds as there are lots and if you don't get any you only need ask the staff and they will find you some. I have read some reviews complaining about staff but if you are nice to them they are nice to you it works both…

The staff, grounds are amazing. All the staff are fluent in english french moroccan and arabic and as soon as you respond to their bonjour they change tact to suit. The majority of guests when we where there were french which we really didn’t mind as there was a calmness around the place . the rooms are a bit tired in the bathroom areas but they are very clean and kept clean and really can’t fault the room albeit tired. we are here in august so no mozzies.. there is a issue with wasps on everything sweet. not a problem in the hotel but in the town it is a big problem As hygiene in the local cafes leaves something to be desired. i have to say again not in the hotel - the food is good plentiful and varied and the chefs go out of thier way to cater for your needs ( fussy eater with…

I stayed at this hotel for 7 nights with four adults and the hotel is amazing. -Each Staff are welcoming and lovely. A special shout out to Abdul Aziz who looked after us at the restaurent. - Yati is amazing with the kids and always goes that extra mile with entertainment. She got us involved with all the different parties held in the evening. - Maoud was also really lovely and looked after us most evenings. -Ayoub who looked after us by the Adult pool. They always have a smile on their face.. Always the first to say hello and a lovely conversation each time! This hotel is perfect location for family. You have the Adult pool which is quiter and then you have the other pool that plays music and has activities put on by the entertainment team. The evening parties that take…

I really love this place its really beutiful i would love to spend more time here , definitly would come again , the animation team is really cool, especially mouad .....................................

It is difficult to find somewhere to holiday when you have older teenagers, but we found this lovely place and we were not disappointed. The only thing lacking and the only reason it is not a 5 star review is the entertainment of an evening which could do with some live music or variety. The stars are everyone who works so hard to make your holiday. The cleaners who keep the rooms absolutely spotless, the animations team who work flat out to ensure everyone has a good time. The trouble and care you take in interacting with guests is very much appreciated, as are the range of activity such as archery and the trapeze! Last but not least, the reception team, the waiters and waitresses, people behind the bars and serving food and everything. Absolutely brilliant! The hotel…

column3: A fun week with golf tuition a fabulous bonus
column4: An impressive line up of entertainment throughout the day, with opportunities to try a variety of activities including archery, boules, table tennis and trapeze. The best for us was the Golf tuition from PGA professional Hassan every morning at 10.00am, covering full swing into nets and chipping onto a putting green. Great fun, thankyou Hassan, you made our holiday! Dance shows every evening were spectacular. Food was delicious. Staff were so kind and helpful, particularly when I was unwell. Can’t wait to return.

column3: Quite good but improvements can be made
column4: Overall, this was a lovely hotel. Staff, in particular the bar staff, were helpful, efficient and cheerful. Rooms were clean and well looked after by the cleaning team. Food was very good with lots of choice. Activities were varied and appeared well run. The zen pool was a particular highlight, as was the quiet eating areas outdoors which allowed respite from the hideous noise level in the canteen each meal time. A few areas for improvement: We paid extra for an Atlas Mountain view but in fact received a room with no mountain view whatsoever. So definitely worth checking you have received what you paid for. In addition, the air conditioning in our room was very substandard. We did not sleep at all for the first night and had to resort to covering ourselves in wet towels. A…

The hotel is very great. The animation team is very professional and good. Animators are very nice, specially Katy and Mouad, food is tasty and waitors are very likeable (special mention for Ziad). Rooms are clean and well decorated. Shows are diversify such as activities during the all day. i’ll come back for sure and highly recommand this hotel.

column3: Fantastic hotel and amazing entertainment staff
column4: this hotel is one of my favorite stay in Morocco the rooms are very clean, the food are delicious. we enjoyed our stay very much and the entertainment staff were taking good care of us especially the kids.

Having been to Marrakech before we knew the high standards of the hotels and Iberostar certainly lived up to this. Myself and 2 daughters loved this hotel. The welcome was fantastic and yes most of the guests are French but we felt extremely welcomed by all. From the bar staff to the entertainment staff we were very well looked after. The reps were always stopping for a chat or to play a card game with us. The food is of a really high quality and the drinks are plenty too. The evening entertainment is very enjoyable and the girls enjoyed the nightclub. We usually stayed by the Zen pool, lovely and quiet and no trouble getting a sun lounger. Drinks at the bar and the staff always were walking around the pool to pick up the empties. We didn’t want to leave and we hope one…

The best hotel club not only in Marrakech but I believe that it remains among the best hotel clubs in the whole kingdom of Morocco. Delicious cuisine, top entertainment, very efficient reception, warm welcome. I highly recommend.

We have just returned from a 7 day stay at this amazing hotel. We stayed as a family of 4 adults all inclusive. This hotel deserves more than a 10/10 review. Genuinely cannot find a single negative thing to say about the hotel. The staff- the staff MAKE this hotel. The entertainment team is SPECTACULAR. They work SO HARD every day to make sure everyone had an amazing day by the pool, aqua Zumba daily and water polo! Both of which we loved…I special mention to Mouad , Piris, Abdou all of who made our days by the pool special and were ever so approachable to ask questions! Nabil on reception was amazing! Thankyou for constantly sorting my room key and printing our return boarding passes! Keep up the hard work guys!!! 🎉🎉🎉 The cleaning staff- they are a credit to the hotel.…

column3: Was okay but could’ve been better.
column4: This would’ve been possibly a 4/5 star but there was a lot more room for improvement. Majority of staff were brilliant and assertive, but some of them don’t seem too bothered, I understand there is a language barrier as English isn’t a common language for them to speak but the facial expressions from some of staff when you ask for things was disappointing and made you feel uncomfortable to ask. But massive shout out to Abdel Aziz from the main restaurant, always managed to put a smile our face, reserved us a table every night at dinner as we always struggled to find somewhere to sit and always got our drinks + refilled them. It wasn’t only us either, he made sure everyone in his section was looked after and went the extra mile for everyone, even to the point where he took…

We enjoyed everything here. We were placed into a room with a pool view, although this can be a bit noisy in the day it did not effect our evenings/nights. The rooms are pretty basic but do have shower gel, shampoo and conditioner provided. There was also a fridge in the room which we stored our after sun and bottled water from the bar in to keep nice and cold. The staff are very friendly and very helpful. Most staff spoke great English and those that didn’t with a bit of French from our side got our points across. All the activities are made with adults and children in mind - we were very surprised to find for example the 10-11 golf was a full hour golf instruction in a net with full sized clubs and balls. We took advantage of the hotel change up of money however they only…

Had an amazing 2 weeks here in Jun/Jul 2022. The holiday got off to the perfect start when the standard room was upgraded to a suite! Thank you to Zakaria for that. Room was spotless - as were the 2 bathrooms and balcony. And some great views of the mountains in the distance. The best thing about this hotel was the staff. At the main reception Nabil was always a helpful smiling presence. Everyone in the restaurant was amazing but special thanks to Leila and Taki who were just superb (they were missed on any day they weren’t there). The bar staff were equally helpful - Yassine could make the perfect pre-dinner martini and then Mohammed would constantly be on hand to replenish drinks throughout the evening. During the daytime Ayoub in the Zen bar was superb as well! Tried a…

We stayed 10 nights and loved the hotel even though it’s not what we usually go for. We normally like to go for walks around the area which isn’t possible here. The food was wonderful especially for me being veggie I often hav problems finding something other than salad. Lots of choice at all meals. The chief on food truck even made a salad rolls at lunch time as I didn’t want a real meal in restaurant most days. The bar and waiting staff were so helpful and rembered our drinks straight away. Especially Ishmal on the main pool. We tried the zen pool but found it to quiet and to hard to get a drink which wasn’t a problem with ishmal around on the main pool. The dancers and shows were amazing however we found the animation staff were not interested in us as we were English. Even…

We stayed at the Iberostar for a week in June. Approximately 30 minutes from the airport with a free shuttle into Marrkech, the three pools (main, adult and kids) catered for everyone. All the food and all inclusive drinks were good, and there was a lot of entertainment put on during the day with lots of sport, which was great. Special thanks to Bahir (pool/entertainment team) and Leila (restaurant team). Our flight was delayed, and although we didn't want dinner at midnight, we appreciated the hotel's offer of the restaurant cooking something for us with our late arrival. I tried a spa treatment (hammam and massage) and would happily have the hammam again.

The hotel is about a 25 minute drive from the airport. Upon arrival, check-in was efficient and was told to download the app which gave us the information about the hotel, timings for the restaurant, activities and map. This app came very handy when contacting reception regarding requests or complaints. Our room was away from the main building. Upon entrance of the building, the place was saturated in mosquitos. The room was spacious and clean but there were several mosquitoes in the room. We informed reception and they sent someone with a spray to kill them. This was a daily occurrence, mosquitos were let in daily by the cleaner. There are 3 pools (main, Children’s and the Adult only). The main pool had entertainment and music. We opted for the adult only pool which had…

Honestly have no idea how there’s not more 1* reviews, we must have arrived at the wrong hotel!! We stayed here for 5 nights and it was supposed to be a 5 star. We checked in to the below average room, the pictures make it look 100 times better than it is. Firstly the safe didn’t work so we had to hide our valuables. I couldn’t find an iron so I called reception to be told they don’t provide one. I asked why as you’re supposedly a 4 star hotel, they did eventually get me one from housekeeping, only after complaining , however this was severely damaged. The next morning we woke up and thought we would have a coffee. No kettle, or facilities to make tea or coffee. I then decided to go to the ‘gym’ and oh my god it’s a health and safety nightmare!!! Machines broken and just…

The hotel was so clean and staff so incredibly helpful we were so surprised . I sadly had an accident prior to the trip and was on crutches but the hotel couldn’t have been more helpful lending a wheelchair and giving us ground floor accommodation . The food in the self service buffet was plentiful and hygiene was a top priority . There was constant entertainment around one of the pools ( there is a quiet pool as well ) and the staff in bars/ restaurants( Mohammed in restaurant ) /reception were very helpful but Piriss was exceptional - taking time everyday to talk to everyone around the pool in a variety of languages and answering any questions . We will certainly return and can highly recommend this hotel

I stayed here for 4 nights with my daughter and 13 year old granddaughter. From start to finish it was a wonderful break. The hotel and grounds are wonderful and the room was spacious and had everything we needed including a hairdryer and free safe. I must say that the staff and entertainment team are absolutely fantastic, they never stop and the nightly shows we're the best I've seen in any hotel. the champagne/cocktail party on one evening was amazing, unlimited champagne and cocktails as well as canapés and they even had a magician entertaining the guests. The drinks are good and very good measures and I loved the rose wine. Food in the buffet was plentiful and very fresh as was the moroccon restaurant. All the staff made us feel very welcome and from day one they…

column3: BEST HOTEL I HAVE STAYED AT
column4: All the staff members made my stay exceptional. I have travelled many countries and by far this is the best hotel I have been to. Everything was a 10/10 service down to the smallest details. Afew names I would like to mention are Katy, Sukki, Yassine, Mouad, Brahim, Abdou, Bouchra and there are many more! The bar staff and kitchen staff were amazing and so were the cleaners. The management is also outstanding. I will definitely be coming back and recommending to everybody else. The food was amazing and available all day. The drinks were also incredible

column3: amazing holiday i was not expecting
column4: to begin with the check in was extremely smooth, they have a good exchange rate at the hotel which is handy and the staff at reception were very informative. We had a double room (no.1032) which was located just by the big pool. the AC never disappointing us and the room was cleaned thoroughly everyday. the kids pool was very fun for my two boys with all the added water squirting features. the kids room is for 4+ am afraid so did not use that. there are couple of bars pool side with a food truck (free if all inclusive) for daytime snacks. you get the occasional sight of peacocks and turtles roaming the resort and the friendly kittens looking for snacks. Food - was very traditional Moroccan style. i particularly liked the meat/Rib tagine with couscous. not a wide variety…

column3: Amazing week away at this hotel
column4: Girls holiday to somewhere hot, we couldn't have asked for a better place. Walking into the hotel lobby and it says it all. Beautifully decorated with a lovely smell that we wanted to bottle and bring home! The hotel was immaculate, and you would always see people hard at work to keep it that way. The food was varied for all tastes, always fresh and the staff in the dining room were always there to help if needed. Our days were spent around the pool where the snack bar staff and entertainment team would always have a smile on their face and would love a chat. This makes you feel very welcome and nothing was too much trouble. The evening entertainment was a bit repetitive. Different 'title' but generally the same dancers doing a different dance...apart from the karaoke…

Had a lovely stay stay at club palmerie....staff aways friendly and helpful. Lunch and breakfast very canteen like dinner in the evening a bit nicer. Not realy 5 star luxury but for what you pay good value for the money. Our room was small but ok...air con not the best but it kept us just about cool enough. Mini bar empty except for water and no kettle in the room. I would return if I got a good deal in March but probably not in June...it was very hot. Nice morning out in the Medina.... got free transfer from the hotel and a Taxi back 1200 Drm.

column3: Another fantastic visit to my favourite hotel!
column4: I have just returned from yet another amazing holiday at the beautiful Iberostar club palmiere Marrakesh I went to celebrate my birthday and what a brilliant time I had! It’s like my second home. The staff in all areas are fantastic and will do everything to make sure you have a great stay. Big thanks go out to nabil who is great and helped to organise my birthday night. Even right down to getting me up on stage and enjoying my birthday night where the crowd sang happy birthday to me and I think certainly helped cure my stage fright! Thanks nabil..you are a star! Also to everyone else at the hotel Best animation team ever and to kati who is a lovely and welcoming person. Yassin too and all the other wonderful people who’s names I may not have mentioned. But you know who you…

column3: The Vacation I didn't know I needed
column4: I stayed in mid-June for a week. I must say that I had the best vacation I have had in a long time. This location and staff exceeded my expectations by far. My first morning interaction was with Bader. I met him while walking to breakfast and he told me about the facilities and that he was there to make sure I enjoyed myself. He was also the Magician at the resort, so he made time in his schedule for us to teach each other a couple of tips and tricks. There were also a lot of activities throughout the day where I met others from the event staff. Katy was very nice and we got to talk and play Petanque, darts, water polo, and dance around the pool. She was very nice and easy to speak with. Mourad joined us at patanque and was a great teacher at the trapeze and archery. Always…

UK girls stayed at the hotel with adjoining rooms, the room sizes were perfect. Daily maid service and double walldrobes, towels provided and hairdryer. You need to bring an iron. Toiletries are provided. Kids pool, quite pool and larger pool where the entertainment is. The staff work extremely hard to make sure you have the best time at the hotel, if you need anything they would make it their personal buisness to get it for you, drinks, food etc whilst your relaxing around the pool. I was bitten by a mosquito in the face and had an allergic reaction to it which resulted in one of my eyes closing ... just complete bad luck ! the management and staff were so amazing and the personal care i received to get me back to myself i really cannot thank everyone involved enough. Thank you…

I have just returned from 4 fab days at this hotel, I visited with my mum and my 13 year old daughter, from the moment we arrived we were made to feel very special. the rooms were large and bright, food amazing and lots of choice. we ate in the ala carte restaurant one evening and it was delish!! I have to say I have never stayed at a hotel that had so much going on, they have the balance of calm and fun in one hotel off to a tee. The staff are the best part of this hotel with 5* service, and going above and beyond any other hotel I have visited. Would like to thank Ishmal and Samir who looked after us so well supplying us with drinks without having to leave our chairs. The whole entertainments team were absolutely amazing Badar, Abdul, Amie and Katie you were all amazing and…

Just returned from a lovely relaxing break chilling in the hot sun . Rooms spacious , big bathroom really good hot shower. Body wash , creme and shampoo dispensers for use . The grounds are immaculate and there are large grounds for some sporting activities . 3 pools - 2 large pools 1 which is a quiet and 1 for kids all good sizes. Food all inclusive : drinks and beer really good and selection of cocktails which are made really nice,. At dinner help yourself to the wine white/rose/ red and water Good selection at food , all fresh and clean and well replenished. Staff kept the food areas clean They have food truck snacks during the day staff worked super hard always smiling and happy to serve you . Chef at the truck mount assir does a brilliant job. Thank you…

I booked with BA holidays, arrived close to midnight due to the BA flight being delayed. The hotel receptionist spoke very little English, rattled off all the rules and gave me various information leaflets as well as wrist band. Went to the bar, had a drink before it closed. Went to my room, I paid a supplement for a view of the Atlas mountains...told next day that you never see them at this time of year due to the haze. Breakfast was a buffet affair, lots of choice but all the fruit juices were not fresh....made up from a powder ...awful. The hotel is located in the middle of nowhere and has not the slightest Moroccan atmosphere. I decided to book another hotel in the medina, informed the front desk..a delegation of management arrived at my room as I was packing, offering…

2 resturants - one is a buffet, this opens at 7pm but the food is sat there from at least 6:30, the food is all cold. Buffet doesnt sign what the food is, so if you want to know what you are eating try and ask but the chefs dont understand. Buffet serves a lot of fish - if you do not like fish avoid. 2nd resturant was a set Moroccon menu. websites state mini golf - there was no mini golf. nightclub is so hidden you will never find it with no sign posts. If you get a pool view room by the main pool, they play loud music around this pool all day and not very relaxing which you can hear from your room from pool opening to closing. Maids didnt change the beds once in a week, and had to ask for towels on a number of occassions. Maids in rooms cleaning as early as 8am moving the…

Looking for a relaxing holiday in the sun, we settled on the Iberostar Club Palmeraie due to the number of positive reviews and after an initial hiccup on flights being cancelled from the UK (but quickly re-booked), we arrived 7hrs later than planned but were welcomed by our friendly receptionist Abdul who swiftly checked us in and we were shown to our room 2108. Initial impressions were excellent. Spotlessly clean reception including our room and the grounds are beautiful. The next morning we were able to get an idea of where things were. The restaurant is large, airy and can cater for all tastes. Breakfasts were omelettes, eggs, waffles, danish pastries, meats/cheeses, fruits/cereal etc. Lunch & dinner much of the same with a variety of fish or meats being cooked inside…

Lovely stay. Especially because of entertainer Bader. Karaoke was crazy with him. Furthermore we enjoyed the fresh juices at breakfast and the diner in the special restaurant very much. Would love to come back here!

Best hotel .. professional animation team specially abdel and katty crazy girl .. food is amazing .. alot of activities to do during the day you will never get bored .. my favourite destination😘😘😘😘😘😘😘😘

We have just returned from a 4 day break and wanted to share our experience. The hotel has 3 pools, one purely for adult use. The large grounds are kept immaculate and all the staff work very hard. You will jever go hungry as the restaurant had a great choice of food, all freshly prepared. There is also an adjoining Moroccan restaurant which you get the free use of once during your stay. There is a great lunch van which offered burgers etc in the afternoon before dinner. The only down side are the dated rooms which need refurbishing. Try and get a room with a balcony/ pool view if you can. Try and avoid visiting Maraccech if you can, it didnt feel safe and you get constantly bombarded with street sellers who dont take no for an answer....

I’d like the give a massive ‘Thank You’ to all the staff at Iberostar for making mine and my partners stay in Morocco exceptional. I’d like to give a special mention to Bader who does the pool activities and Mohamed from the main bar. Any request I made to either of these men was fulfilled and they went above and beyond. I will definitely be staying at Iberostar again in the future and would recommend anyone to do the same. Again Thank You so much for making my holiday one I’ll never forget.

We had ten very good days in this hotel. The complex was very clean and well maintained, the food delicious and varied and all the staff were very friendly and helpful, whether at the pool bar or in the restaurant.
