Special mention should be made of the animator Bader, who made the stay something very special with his warm and motivating manner. Thank you very much!

I stayed at the Iberostar for 3 months with friends from work and enjoyed every single day here. The staff, environment and commodities exceeded our expectations. I would recommend anyone coming to Marrakech to pay them a visit. I will be coming back in a few months and will definitely book with them again!

Perfect holiday .. Food is great .. the whole staff is helpful specially badr from the animation team. Different activities you will never get bored .. its always a pleasure to spend some quality time in this hotel .. am coming back inchaelah and thats a fact.

Such a wonderful hotel, beautiful scenery and what makes this hotel so pleasurable to stay in - the staff! Never have I been to a resort whereby staff knew and remembered your name and made you feel so welcome! The food was amazing and the wait staff were exemplary! Special shout to Sara from guest services who went above and beyond her duties to make sure we were well catered to! Thank you! Give it 10/10 - don’t hesitate to book this wonderful resort!

We stayed for 1 week in this hotel, our first holiday post pandemic as a couple. The hotel is immaculate, rooms are spacious and very good air conditioning. The weather was hot so this came in handy. The staff are very friendly, and within a few days knew our names and we knew theirs. Special shout out to Bader who made us feel so welcome, and was clearly putting in a lot of effort throughout the entire day to make sure the guests were having fun. The food was outstanding, my partner is a chef and he was very impressed. The restaurant is available to book for one night as part of an all inclusive stay, but I would say the quality matched the buffet which is available throughout your stay - both 10/10. You won’t go hungry at this hotel. We made good use of the facilities.…

We had the best holiday here ! To start with all the staff including the gardeners and the cleaners was absolutely amazing! Some of them made our holiday! The hotel grounds are stunning! Every where was so clean and well looked after! We can end of May (celebrated My birthday here) Unfortunately our flight got cancelled and the next available flight wasn't till 3 days after (oh no ;)) The hotel was so good to us! They said we could stay in the same rooms (thank god as we had a child with us and the amount of stuff we had) One of the lovely luggage assistants helped us with our transfer to the airport as the Love Holidays rep didn't (made us 45 minutes late to airport) but he helped by calling him and got us another one! Been to a few hotels with Buffets and this one is…

My wife, my 2 daughters & I enjoyed our week vacation. ( from June 4 to June 11, 2022). On the 6th day of our stay an incident could have ruined our holiday, though. To begin with, the staff were hospitable, friendly & cheerful namely Badr, Yassine, Eemy & to top it off ABDEL, the entertainer Chef. There is no doubt that the hotel Manager takes on only highly qualified employees. What's more, you can relish your holiday by playing trapeze, basket ball, volleyball, tennis along with other related sports facilities. The 3 swimming pools were clean and well maintained. A lifeguard was ensuring the safety of the swimmers.. On the 6th day, however, my elder daughter was bitten by a cat. All in all, if you are looking for fun, relaxation, spirts & good food, I highly recommend…

Fabulous hotel ,great food and wonderful staff public areas very clean pool and animation are fab , The food truck is superb and the star in this place is ismal he was wonderful always smiling and happy and so so helpful can't thank him enough ,he made our holiday so special. The only negative is the towel situation having to pay 100dirams and we had one stolen and you do not get the money back till.you leave as it is a closed currency it's a problem

Love this place! My wife and I leave the kids at home for this holiday. From the moment we arrive we can feel the stress leaving our bodies… great massages to start the hols then off to the Zen pool for the duration of the day; only food interrupts the lounging around the pool. We were given a small upgrade on our room which was a pleasant surprise. Food was better than I remembered, I’d forgotten how varied it was (covid has interrupted our yearly couples doss holiday). Great staff; great time; can’t wait to get back.

The service on this holiday was excellent, the staff, food ,service, cleanliness, facilities, genuine care and friendliness was above and beyond, Really enjoyed our stay here and would recommend to anyone. The only complaint was we used the free bus to go into the souks in Marrakech. On arrival we were approached by a tourist guide advising us to have a guide accompany us around the souks, As we were unsure of the way in a strange city we decided to have the guide accompany us as the tourist guide there said that we would only have to give him a couple of pounds 'his words'. He took us to the souks right enough but guided us to shops he was obviously known and would probably get a cut of whatever we spent. We felt we were ripped off and he never said anything. When he…

column3: Amazing holiday at iberostar in marakesh
column4: An amazing experience at iberostar. The food was amazing, the room was beautiful and the staff were lovely and enthusiastic. The most amazing and energetic person in the animation team who is always the life of the party, Bader is very friendly and easily approachable and will do everything in order to help you have an amazing experience at iberostar.

column3: So happy with this hotel - book it its lovely.
column4: We went here last week. A really fabulous place. Amazing food, generous all inclusivity and lovely rooms. Really good for families. Relaxed and really enjoyable. Cant recommend it enough. Easy to get to from the airport and a free shuttle bus to the city several times a day.

column3: Great food, Great Staff - Recommended for a cheap break
column4: ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Throughout this trip, I have been sure that this hotel is between 3.5 - 4.5 stars, however can not fault it hence the 5 rating. Not 5 star 🌟 quality rooms, but 5 stars everything else 👍 I write my reviews whilst on the trip as always keen to provide a true view as I experience it. Here's the review - Only couple (very minor) of negatives, so will start with that. NEGATIVES; - The reception staff, in particular a lady call Manal needs to smile more and the welcome was not the best. Often looked to asked others for help (Abdul was great 🙂) as she was grumpy 😤 most of the time and didn't seem to want to help and when asked, very sharp and short with her responses. - Bathroom a little to small, especially with a child. Showers only. Not the hotels fault as every…

My friends and I visited at the end of may for 5 nights and loved it here! The hotel was lovely, clean and staff all super friendly. We had adjoining rooms which was fun too. The food was also really nice, a really big range of options and the chefs were incredibly helpful as one of us was a coeliac (gluten free). Special thanks to Chef Ameen (Amee? Amin? So sorry I can’t remember how he spelt it…) as he personally showed her round every meal for what was safe for her to eat, and had gluten free bread made and dessert brought out to her! Thank you so much to all!!

Hey, want to say I loved this place,The garden, the food is very tasty and the pool is sunny, The servers are very polite, my friend bader too so thank u for everything I am proud to be from Moroccan roots .

Fantastic Hotel for what ever type of holiday you are looking for, this resort has it all and extensive grounds and activities. Ideal for families your kids will be entertained all day, peace and quite head to the Zen pool (child free) .All inclusive amazing value for money with superb food choices both in the restaurant and pool side. There is so much to say about this Hotel. Just read all the 5 star reviews it’s all true. Immaculately clean and staff fluent in English, French and probably many other languages. Big shout out to:- ( apologies if misspelt) Bader Emmy Abdul Abdol Mohammed Rocheda Sarah. Plus many more. And hats off to the management for putting together the most fantastic set of happy, professional, energetic and caring staff who go above and beyond to make…

My partner and I stayed here for one week in May. Everything was amazing from start to finish. The hospitality was amazing in all parts of the hotel. Staff members are so lovely and we particularly enjoyed Samir's company each evening. Our Moroccoan experience was lovely and staying here topped it off. We would definitely return to this hotel!

I came here for my 60th birthday with 19 adults and a baby and it was The most amazing hotel and time we have had A big thank you to the staff and especially the chef A big shout out to one of the entertainment staff Bader he was so kind concerned and made our holiday with his tricks and fun personality

On my final night in the hotel. The place is amazing!!! The food is faultless with an excellent selection. Entertainment was quality throughout the day with our favourite night being the white party. Special mention to 'bader' in the entertainment team his joy is contagious and works endlessly to help you make the most of your holiday 10:10 Also have to mention Moustafa and bouchra in the restaurant, both are amazing!!!

column3: Fantastic holiday…have already decided to return.
column4: A great hotel, well maintained and great standards in all areas. Staff are friendly and attentive but in particular, Bouchra who attends to people on arrival and Bader in the entertainment team are outstanding. Also Chef Miguel ensured our friend’s 60th Birthday celebration was one never to forget. You can get a bus just outside the hotel to the markets and souks and taxis are readily available too, cost is just 100 mad per taxi of 4. Camel riding is a must. What an experience! All in all we had a great holiday and made fantastic memories!

Lovely hotel, a lot to do ,all staff very lovely and bader is the most attentive man,always happy smiling would do anything for us, asking all the time if we needed anything. His actives are always filled with laughter,felt like a good friend on holiday and showing us all his amazing acts tricks getting everyone involved.

We have just left this beautiful hotel The food was amazing The rooms very clean We will come back in a heartbeat The staff were very friendly and cannot do enough we had one problem with one member but the management sorted it within minutes I must say a staff member called Bader Has totally made our holiday 19 of us there he has been amazing

Lovely hotel with wonderful staff who are so attentive, always a smile on their face. A massive thank you to Bader and Ismail who both looked after all the guests around the pool...these guys did not stop, thank you. Also thank you to the guys from the Zen bar. Pools and grounds well maintained and cared for with an extra special guest....the resident peacocks. Sunbeds available all day!!! The only slight let down was the DJ in the nightclub who became a little rude and sharp with you when requesting a song. All in all an excellent hotel/holiday...definitely would return

A family friendly hotel. The entertainment is great and a real strength for choosing this place. They have excellent staff on board - with a few particularly “stand out” members of staff who I feel I should mention! Such as their magician (called Pedro / Bader) who is excellent. Abdul the entertainment manager seems to be on a mission to please everyone - and succeeds! Also Zyad, Ismail and Samir who are part of the wait staff and can’t do enough to help everyone all the time with a smile for all. Also the dancers and childrens’ entertainers are all very good - and it’s certainly a welcoming place. There are multiple events and things to do, you won’t be bored! Tennis, volleyball, trapeze, archery etc etc. Lovely pools and great service. The food buffet has fabulous variety…

Our second visit to this wonderful hotel, the staff and facilities are superb. The Adults only pool is relaxing haven while the main pool is vibrant and more energetic. unfortunately this time we were given a room overlooking the pool and found it a bit noisy on a couple of Evenings. if you are looking for a bit more quiet then i would advise against a room looking over the pool.

Just returned from the palmeraie and I must say it is the most friendliest iberostar we have ever stayed at.A special mention to Ismall who looked after us around the pool and the whole of the food truck team.from the cleaners,waiters and bar staff they all took time to have a chat. The hotel is absolutely spotless and a large variety of food and drink on offer. Thanks again ismall for making this holiday unforgettable.

Holiday is coming to a close now so sitting by the pool I thought it time to leave a review of this hotel. First things first; there are many positives for this hotel but it is the people that makes this hotel what it is. Everybody was incredibly friendly and even though there are too many to name a special mention must go to Bader and Ismail who simply never stop working. The food is really varied and the sports facilities are superb although maybe the basketball hoops need some attention if I am being picky. The entertainment is also of a high standard with some good dance acts although we circumnavigated the karaoke as we cannot sing at all... As for trips out; we got the free hotel bus into the Souks and it was certainly an experience and one not to be missed really. Have…

What a fabulous place with amazing staff, everyone made us feel very welcome and we would like to give an extra big thanks to Bader (entertainment staff) and Ismil and the chef (food truck) for looking after us every day and making us feel special, highly recommended.

My Family and I spent seven nights at the Iberostar club in Marrakesh. I must say that this is one of the best family holidays I and my family have ever had. The hotel is fantastic, the food is amazing and the people that work in this hotel absolutely go out of their way to make you feel welcome and at home. I would particularly like to say a huge thank you to Bader from the entertainments team who made us feel so welcome and his magic show is amazing. I’d also like to thank Ismil and the team at the food truck for keeping us in food and drink every day. We highly recommend this resort.

Very first time visiting Marrakech and I have to say a very good first impression. Staff could not do more to be helpful, attentive and happy. Lots of activities to do throughout the day which the hotel staff actively get involved in and create a great atmosphere. Only couple of negatives would be children's food selection for lunch/dinner is isolated so kids may not eat everything on offer & the restaurant left alot to be desired as our booking was missing and you don't see a menu before you dine. Weather was really nice and plenty of hot weather to get a tan.

We were bumped due to overbooking with less than 24 hours notice from the five star adults only Be Live Resort in Palmeraie to this Iberostar hotel and after we got over the shock and irritation, wow were we impressed. There really isn’t anything negative about this place. The staff are so friendly and go out of their way to help, the food is copious, fresh and ever changing and the facilities were second to none. A special shout out to the great rose wine! We spent our days relaxing by the chill pool where we could watch other guests trying the trapeze - yes they even have experienced instructors for those who want to try this sport. The grounds are huge and actually we commented that we could have done with a map of the facilities when we arrived. The rooms were spotless…

column3: Great family hotel set outside Marrakesh
column4: Club Palmarie is a sprawling low rise hotel set amidst acres of beautifully manicured tropical gardens. Built in traditional style with a real North African flavour, It has a feeling of space and peace against the dusty chaos of Marrakesh’s city streets. Location Club Palmarie is located in the Palmarie area of the city, around 20 -25 minutes from the central Medina area by car. This is probably it’s biggest drawback if you want to hop to the Medina fairly often. There is a complimentary hotel shuttle bus a few times a day and the last bus returns from the medina at 1030pm. A taxi costs 150 MAD. With the further away location though comes space which enables the hotel to have such beautiful grounds and facilities. Food An extensive array of dishes at both breakfast and…

Amazing facilities catering to many needs Special thanks to Zara and Buchara for always assisting us on our stay. All staff at the restaurants were cheerful respectful and helpful Will surely return great entertainment

We have just returned from the Iberostar Club Palmeraie. From beginning to end we had a fab holiday. When I do a review I like to add a few tips to new travellers. I booked us a room with double pool view. We started to unpack (after checking in which was quick and easy, lovely staff) and then went for a walk around the grounds to have a look round. We saw the adults only pool which is where we were going to head now we have adult children! We went back to get ready and realised that the main pool was actually quite noisy. Enquired at reception if any other rooms were available and we were shown a 'garden room' which was at the other end of the complex close to the adults pool. It was peaceful and in beautiful gardens (although the whole hotel is beautifully maintained) so we…

I had a big problem at the hotel, with the animators and especially an animator who called katy (karima) like when I was me and my wife at the swimming pool discussing her coming to disturb us, and we forces to comment on the site that the hotel is incredible but in reality it is the opposite, thank you for your understanding but I think you have to manage the problem with her quickly. thanks.

column3: An amazing stay at this fantastic hotel
column4: Arrived in the dark but was very happy with the welcome at reception and it was not long until we were unpacking. Food - we were impressed with the food on offer at all three meals. Always a great selection. Salads were incredible and very different every day. Hot food stations were good as was the pizza - choices of three - and chips, pasta etc. Plenty of lovely fresh bread. The selection of cakes were brilliant especially loved Moroccan night trying cakes I had never had before. Fresh fruit on offer - one night a chocolare fountain and strawberries. On our final night prawns, smoked salmon and oysters. White, red and Rose wine - help yourself aong with soft drinks and beer. Coffee only on offer at breakfast but a help yourself machine in the main bar and pool bar…

We booked this hotel through BA before Morocco opened its borders again so got a great deal. Did not regret it, from the moment we arrived until we left we had 100% friendly service without exception. Although all inclusive the drinks were to a decent standard and the food at the buffet restaurant was fresh and well presented. We agree with some previous reviews that it can become a bit repetitive but that’s the nature of the beast unless you are paying premium prices. Breakfast, lunch and dinner on most days could provide something different and there was nothing presented that we thought no! We went to the Zen pool rather than the main as this seemed to be adults only and so quiet and peaceful, plus a handy bar! No issues with getting sun loungers. Normally we use hotel gyms…

Thank you Iberostar Club Palmeraie Marrakech for the great experience. Excellent resort. I could say that you have some of the best staff, very friendly, always happy and smiling, very helpful and always there to provide excellent service. When you need something Abdel is there with a great smile and a good joke to make your day :). You would like a drink, Adraoui already has it for you. Me personally, I haven't seen anyone complaining. even when we haven't had the best weather condition, they found something to compensate : cocktail party, cooking contest, the evening activities like "guess the song" competition". Our 7 years daughter says that is the best holiday that she's ever had (big fan of sunny holidays and she's had some in Canaries, Caribbean, Sardinia, Greece,…

it was our first family holiday abroad since COVID. We and our children had an amazing time. it was so good that we decided to extend our stay from 7 to 10 days! the staff is always smiling and will do anything to make your stay better. everything is so clean. the staff work so hard but always with a smile or a friendly word. the food is amazing and abundant. the grounds are beautiful . you can book day trips around Marrakech from the hotel. there are free shuttle to get to Marrakech too. the entertainments during the day and evening is great. i cannot fault a thing and we cannot wait to be back!

Beautiful grounds, facilities and rooms need a bit of an update - tatty round edges and staff a bit of a mixed bag (some brilliant, others unhelpful and reluctant). Food good, with lots for vegetarians, and bus seemed to run well to town. Note that kids pool is cold at start of day, both others seemed warm. I HATED the banging music and activities round the family pool which seemed to go on all day without much of a break.

Excellent hotel - superb staff and great facilities - you can try trapeze (our 7 year old progressed from zero to a mid air catch) - special shout out to the amazing trapeze team! …boules; tennis; golf; gym; spinning; water polo; volleyball: football; archery; swimming etc etc… or just lounging with some great cocktails! … but what makes this place so special is that every day and every time you see a staff member they ask if you are having a good day and if there is anything they can do… the buffet is a really very good buffet - patisserie is amazing (catering for the French!) the weather was great 23 to 35 in April…and if you want to do other things the Souks, snakes, camels etc offer another world on your doorstep (with a free shuttle) - great team - if I owned a hotel I’d…

We’ve just finished a 5 day stay at Iberostar in Marrakech and have loved every minute. There is always so much to do, the rooms are clean and the food is great. The staff were all friendly and attentive and go over and above for all of the guests - particularly Simo and Piriss who bring a real energy to the entertainment and kept us smiling our entire stay. Would recommend to anyone and would come back!!

column3: Great choice for a family holiday
column4: We had a fantastic 7 day holiday at Iberostar Club, Palmeraie in April. The hotel is well set out and we found it very clean and tidy at all times. The hotel gardens are lovely and well worth exploring. Service was excellent , all the staff were friendly, polite and incredibly hard-working ! Our room was comfortable and was a good size with air-con and a good quality TV. We had a garden view room near the Zen Pool area so it was wonderfully peaceful too. There are plenty of activities to keep children and teenagers occupied but also some lovely quiet spots for reading and sunbathing . The pools are clean and safe with lifeguards on duty. Food and drink are of a good standard - plenty to choose from. We became very fond of the Moroccan Rose wine ! All in all , a great…

column3: Very enjoyable stay. Great value for money.
column4: We have just returned from a week stay at Iberostar Marrakesh. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. All the staff were so friendly and helpful. Our daughter enjoyed the kids club and pool. Food was great too. The resort grounds were well kept and pleasant to walk around in. Overall great value for money and would highly recommend for families with young children.

We had a super time at the Iberostar- to be fair, as we were leaving the number of guests was climbing so the lovely peace and quiet we enjoyed might not have remained! But it’s a super hotel in stunning grounds. The staff were simply incredible. There was not one person who didn’t exceed expectations. They literally went out of their way to help you. I hope they are paid well as they deserve it. French is definitely the main language - but while you are always greeted in French they do pivot to English as soon as they realise you’re an English speaker. That said, all the written notes, the quizzes on the PA etc are in French. We deliberately asked for the quietest room and wanted to sit at the quiet pool and didn’t want rowdy. We were recovering from a stressful season -…

Disappointed with my 3rd stay here. Have been here in Nov/Jan times and had no issue with entertainment or the variety of food in the restaurant. This occasion found that there was limited choice in the restaurant with fruit being only in a small quantity of orange/grapefruit with an apple/banana sometimes. The desserts were the same everyday at lunch/dinner. Ice-cream only once at dinner. Quality of food still good and service in the restaurant excellent. Entertainment has never been this bad, you normally get a few nights where acts have been brought in but this was their in house team only and was very poor set up that we only stayed 5 mins on each night then went off to play cards in the bar. Nice pools but limited beds and most mornings by 9:30am all taken with towels but…

Very good all round hotel, upto usual Ibrostar standards. The grounds are immaculate and worth a good walk round, a lot bigger than you might think. Will look even better in the summer with all the flowers out. Service through out was excellent. Cleaners also doing a brilliant job keeping the place spotless. Usual good choice at meal times in the restaurant, with plenty to choose from. Food was served to us at first, but back to normal later in the week when it was busier. There was sometimes a lot of fish, and not a label on to say what it was, difficult if you have an allergy like my partner. Although we did mention it to the management later in the week so may improve. Pool was surprisingly warm, good size for a swim, and plenty of sunbeds around. The hotel customer…

Overall I would rate this a very solid 4* resort. ROOMS Perfectly fine however the least inspiring aspect. Rooms are just good, certainly not super-luxurious however well maintained. Balconies are really small. I was fine with it. GROUNDS Wonderful, easily to a 5* standard. Very large and well layed out for what is a medium sized resort. Great care is taken to keep it looking great. POOLS The Zen pool is a stunner. Quite, relaxed and very appealing. The main pool is terrific also, larger and more suited to families. LANGUAGE I have seen comments suggesting that only French is properly represented. This is an unfair assessment, I feel. Fact is that French is a principle language in Morocco and there are also a great many French visitors. When staff realised I spoke…

Nice hotel with very well kept grounds. The hotel is very clean but probably needs some refurbishment in areas. There’s always a variety at meal times. I wouldn’t recommend the burgers at the outdoor food stand. Plenty of activities. The staff were all pleasant and look after you well. The evening entertainment is fun, especially after a few drinks. Hotel is 30mins from airport which cost 300dirams, 230 on way back. It’s 100dirams deposit for each towel. Only complaint is our bedroom corridor was noisy with people talking and banging on doors. Would definitely return.

column3: Wonderful stay! We will come back!
column4: What we enjoyed the most was the staff, the activities and the food. Special shoutout for two members Abdel at the Food Truck and the manager lady of reception (sorry we did not type the name down). They went over expectations to ensure that we had a good experience. We are definitely coming back next year with family! Things to try Archery and Trapeze definitely! It is also great that there is the option to stay in the "entertained" pool, or you can move to the zen pool where you can relax.

column3: 3 day stay in my Morocco Holiday
column4: I may be a little different to many reviews here the reason, well I have visited Morocco many times. Stayed in multiple all-inclusive, flats and riads in Marrakesh, the Atlas mountain and the coasts. So on we go, with the pandemic and a new daughter I hadn't visited since early 2019 and was desperate to get back. As I was bringing my partner (who hadn't left Europe before) and toddler I wanted the trip to start well and in comfort. We land and as always I pick up the hire car, my partner then has to experience Marrakesh and the driving before we arrive. We arrive at 2 pm fill in the paperwork with a drink then catch the end of lunch as the room is not ready. So let's start with the food, unlike the bigger all-inclusive in Marrakesh the choice is limited. Now saying this I am…

Overall the worst hotel I have been to in my 43 years. I arrived at the hotel on my birthday excited for a break especially as I have vacationed at this chain in Mexico, Jamaica and DR. The reception staff that checked me in was friendly. I was to welcomed with a drink or anything, which was ok but a little disappointing. On my second day after having lunch at the pool (burger) I became ill and resorted to my room for the next few hours. I contacted reception for support as I was travelling alone.The staff was not helpful, they refused to get me some soup to my room feeling me they do not do room service.Staff came in my room and accused me of taking drugs. Two days later I was offered cocaine in the karaoke bar by the bar tender. No only do I feel disrespected, humiliated,…

Overall a fine hotel with very friendly and good service. Nice rooms, clean and fine Food in restaurant is not the best but pasta/pizza is ok - other food was not very impressive. Also the first all inclusive restaurant I ever have seen, that does not have simple Icecream . There where only cakes. It is not allowed to pick up your own food, but you have to wait for employees at the buffet to put something on your plate. Quite slow process - why not just have some gloves that must be used, so guest on their own can pick up their foods. The employees typically only have the covid-19 mask limited on their mouth/nose - so overall waste of effort. Place some plastic gloves at the buffet and let the guest pick their food, much faster

column3: Excellent experience, but room for improvement
column4: Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel to any foreigner visiting Marrakech, and would stay here again. The food is amazing, the rooms are nice, the staff is constantly upkeeping/maintaining/cleaning the property, and there are many activities (archery, acrobatics, tennis, golf, etc.) However, there are 2 areas in which I was not fully satisfied. I stayed in a suite (which was lovely - it had 2 bathrooms, 2 balconies, and plenty of seating). The suites are all located directly above the lobby/foyer, so any noise there (such as wedding receptions or even just conversations) could be heard from our room. Not a huge deal since when we were sleeping it was quiet, but it was annoying during the day - so just a note if you're considering a suite. The staff overall is…

column3: They were our saviour with less than 24 hours notice!
column4: Our original hotel cancelled for part of our planned holiday. This lovely hotel accommodated with less than 24 hours notice. Our agent advised the new hotel were paid however upon arrival this was not the case. However the new hotel still provided 2 beautiful garden view ground floor rooms while things got sorted. The service was excellent, hotel clean and setting was lovely. Would definitely recommend this hotel. We were originally booked adults only but would happily return with our children.

I passed a really good time here is this fascinating hotel, the reception stuff, animation group was really helpful and friendly with everyone, we did a lot of interesting activities and different sport activities as well. Overall, I would recommend this beautiful hotel to anyone who wants to spend a good time and rest with family.

I spend some of the most amazing time in this hotel it was fun and relaxing and refreshing, the animation team was the best they were extreamly fun and very sweet and kined i advice people looking for fun to go that hotel i wanna say thanks to Ayoub,Anas,Kity,Khadija from the animation team

The hotel was perfectly good when it cames to the rooms food and people working there i enjowed my time doing a lots of activity whit animation team they were great and very friendly and cool and the green spaces in the hotel are wonderful and i want to say thanks to each and single one of the animation team Katy,Anas,Ayoub,Khadija,Mehdi

Iberostar Marrakech has become our favorite place and our second home, the great charm is the sympathy of all the staff of this magnificent club, the reception team is endowed with great professionalism and immense kindness, always on the small care, I thank the great chef Mr. Mohamed Ali, Zakaria, Imane and the whole team without exception in the company of the excellent welcome from the magnificent Bouchra and Sarah, well done. The themes are carefully chosen, in line with the calendar of periods. Thank you to Mr. Walid the director always present and listening to you. class restoration, beautiful and professional people like Mr. Karim, Reda, laila and Mohamed thank you very much. Top animation and excellent bravo Abdel, Abdo, Mehdi, Samadi, Amine, kati, Imane, Hassan... and…

Few practical tips. The kids club is from 4 yr olds up and runs from 10 to 1 and from 3 to 5. It's fantastic and the activities are well planned and varied. It is attached to a little playground and beside the kids pool which is very shallow. We have a 4 year old and I wasn't worried about him going under at all. The rooms are nice but basic and the beds are very hard. I would say they're a 3 star but the rest of the resort is like a 4 star. We had a ground floor garden terrace room. All the rooms are the same, no point in upgrading. Balconies looked tiny. There are no kettles in the rooms for doing baby bottles but there are microwaves for sterilizing in the dining room and the wait staff will wash bottles. The veggie food is good and varied. BUT badly labelled. The…

column3: I said I'd be back - and I meant it!
column4: Having had such a great experience in February 2020, I returned with my husband, son and his friend (to keep him amused and off our backs!) for a week over the October half term. This time we stayed in a suite, which is lovely, bright and spacious. It has one full bathroom and one separate toilet and sink - which is handy as men ... well, the least said about that the better... The most outstanding feature of this hotel is its staff. I have read other reviews saying that the French guests are given preferential treatment. That has certainly NOT been my experience at all. Yes, French is much more widely spoken than English but that is the history of the country and French guests are very much in the majority - especially currently when there are no flights from the UK. …

This is my second time at the hotel having already visited in 2019 with my friend I returned with my husband Ali Shah for a well deserved break after working on the front line since the start of the pandemic. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a relaxing break, the staff at the hotel welcome you like family. The hotel is super clean with S.O.P in place throughout the hotel the sun beds and pathways are washed down every night. The General Manager is visual throughout the hotel everyday ensuring the smooth running of the hotel and will go out of his way to speak to the guests ensuring they are enjoying there stay The Entertainment team work extremely hard ensuring there is entertainment during the day and in the evening, a special thank you to Khadija,…

All of the staff in the hotel provided superb service. The entertainment staff are very interactive and entertaining. The bar staff are great and even remember what you like to drink. The restaurant is very clean and the food options are great. There are a lot of activities and space in the resort so its easy to get a sun lounger and have space from others. The rooms are a nice size and clean. I would highly recommend staying in this resort.

column3: Avoid if you don't speak French
column4: Well, this hotel was rather disappointing. The main issue is the inability to speak English from most staff member. Of all staff only 2 people could communicate with us. The remainder staff, entertainment staff included, would ignore us because they did not know English. It was shocking actually experiencing people coming to us speaking in French, ask them to speak English, and actually turning around and go away. I was appalled. The only English speaking member of the entertainment staff was Mydi, who was really nice and good to us and would deserve a 5 star on his own. Aimad was the only staff member at the services, in the Zen pool bar, who could speak an amazing English and would actually talk to us. We had a suite, which was nice and acceptably clean. Most of the food in…

Fantastic holiday hotel over expectations, beautiful areas and great atmosphere something for everyone. The staff are amazing from reception, bar, restaurant, and the entertainment team. My little girl loved the kids club which is a first, the team go over and above to make the holiday comfortable and entertaining for everyone. The entertainment is very professional and the team particular Mydi is always there to help with any queries. Such a relaxing holiday which allowed us to have some very much needed family time. Also the Covid guidance followed everywhere which made you feel the hotel certainly cared for your welfare. Will definitely return…Amazing Team ❤️

This was our second time at the hotel the staff were great the room had a garden view was spacious and clean. The whole hotel and grounds are well maintained. Despite the bar ect shutting at 9pm due to local lockdown the atmosphere Wes relaxed with bar staff bringing the drinks to our table. The pools are clean and easy to access with plenty to do or just relax. The snack wagon has limited snacks available in the daytime and plenty of activities to do if you want to.

column3: One of the best 4* Iberostars I visited
column4: Great hotel for kids. Excellent animation team, lots of activities like a zoo, big kids pool, mini disco etc. Very beautiful grounds. Special compliment to the Chef. Food is really well cooked, and variety is great, my only negative comment about the food offering is the pastry in the morning is so so. Taking into account we r in Morocco (where bread and pastry r somewhat amazing on average) it is close to terrible. Waiters are very prompt and attentive, 5* for their service. The only reason why I didn’t put 5* for the hotel is because I was disappointed with lack of enforcement of mask wearing in the restaurant. The majority of the customers are moroccan, many of them seem to believe they have a superior protection so they don’t bother about the masks, and hotel does nothing to…

We had thuis great holiday at iberostar marrakech thans ri the whole stuff speciale the entertainment team , everything is fin and secured , very good wether full of activities ans fun for Every familie member we Will defintly come back

Great entertainment the entire team was super funny and amusing. like the place a lot and would Definitely come back. Food is amazing there is a lot of variety the room is super clean the service is great

Stayed here for 26 days for business. The best amenities I could have asked for. the food was amazing and always different everyday.The staff are super friendly and helpful. I would bring my family here for a vacation as well.

Second to none! Quality and quantity in abundance in terms of service, amenities, activities, dining, and more. The staff: very friendly, professional, helpful, and are there to ensure your stay is more tha a holiday. Shukran Sara, Iman, Hanssan, Aussie and everyone else. Will def vacation again in the future! Side note: massage = quality!

The Iberostar went above and beyond any expectations I had for our stay. The service was phenomenal and the staff was very friendly. They made me feel like I was family. I highly recommend staying at the Iberostar and I will be staying there again when I revisit Marrakech. Truly a fantastic experience. Thank you Iberostar!

column3: Top Staff and Hotel I’ve stayed at!
column4: The hotel and property are very clean and the service is above and beyond. This is some of the best hotel staff I have ever seen! The entertainers are very friendly and good at what they do, they remember ever persons name here. The food service was extremely friendly and all were so helpful without ever being asked. They all go above a d beyond on, of their own free will.

We pass more than a week and a half in this hôtel ,and it was all good from thé food to thé Rooms and spéciale thé entertainment team whom made our holidyas , Big thanks To thé hôtel stuff for Making it Safe and fuun

We arrive at this hotel in Marrakech , we had a lot of fun during this holidays ,we enjoyed everything in this hotel specially the activities for the children and for us , even during this pindaric they made our holidays safe and fun , Thanx to the entertainment team ...

Excellente hôtel and Excellente entretainmnet team , thé food Was good ,the time Was fun thanx to the team again, and we highly recommanded for families and couples ... the rooms are gréât and confortable

It was a great time here in this hotel , we loved the stuff , everyine is cool and nice , its makes you feel home , the food is so good , The weather everything was perfect , we will defintly comeback

Its our 3rd Time in this hôtel, And every time is différent , we had great time thanx the stuff and spécialy the entertainlent team... it is always good to be here, we highly recommanded... and we shall be back for sure

They did an amazing job catering and helping our 150+ Person Business trip! All you can eat, all you can drink, amazing spa, awesome amenities, staff members that treat you like family, and at a great price for what you get. I have nothing but good things to say. Anytime I’m Marrakech, I will always be staying at the iberostar. I think they have given me one of the best customer service ever. Highly recommend it to anyone staying in Morocco

Everything about my stay was amazing. Events for the guests every day/night for adults and children and the staff always had a smile on their face, ready to help you. I would definitely recommend going.

Me and my family visisted last week and it was a fabulous experience. The view was beautiful and is constructed on a large area of land. It has many activities for all age groups and the staff is very polite, helpful and excellent. From the recpetion desk to the bar to the trainers as well as the chefs. Everybody is really energetic, especially Mehdi, Khalid and Yassine, we will miss you guys. We enjoyed a lot and will be eager to plan the next holidays in iberostar. Best of luck to the management and team of iberostar.

A beautiful property in Marrakesh that is a gem in Morocco. The staff were very professional and provided world class customer service. The highlight of my trip was experiencing an authentic Moroccan meal, which was very delicious.

To be honestly hotel could be 5 stars not only 4 . Big green areas with beautiful animals around (duck.goat.dives.chiken.turkey...) stff are all polite very generously From reception until housekeeping. Foods very testy and night of valentine were so cool even w didn't stay until end I live in Turkey an i have seen plenty 4 starts but this hotel broke the rules to the top I recommend this hotel to all nationalities its really pretty cool Thank you all An woud be nice to come back again Jaouad

A good comforting impression settles since the reception with the warm welcome of the great professional Mr. Mohamed Ali: big thank you Sir. An excellent animation team abdou, hamid, khalid, yassine, imane, mehdi, morad and all the animators, and of course the animation manager the magnificent Abdel big bravo, they are all real professionals and friendly people. Safety standards are respected in the restaurant, the friendliness of the kitchen and catering staff and without limit they do their best to satisfy you. for this club hotel there is no room for boredom, the day is busy and packed with activities. The big advantage as I mentioned is the diversity, for example the duck lake, the nice corner with farm animals, the grassy field for football fans, several and different…

I had a great time with my family at the Iberostar Club Palmeraie Marrakech. The food was nice and varied. Friendly and accommodating staff (special shout-out to Khalid!) Would definitely like to come back!

column3: No customer care at all...stay away
column4: I booked this hotel for next December 13, one week stay, through Agoda. Received from hotel, an automatic message of welcome in my Agoda account, next replied the message to inquire about city shuttle details. Was never answered, therefore using the iberostar customer care plus the direct hotel’s email address, this time for a much more urgent matter. My flight back to Portugal was cancelled and alternative flights needed to show another Covid test , so I needed information where I could go in Marrakesh to do it, and hotel’s assistance for advance booking. Even told them without it I would cancel my stay. Iberostar customer care, first answered and told that forward the case to Iberostar Marrakesh to answer me. No reply at all.... I even insisted again with both to be answered…

column3: Complete luxury, must go again...for longer
column4: Lovely holiday. Third time vsiting Marrakesh. First time staying at the Iberostar. Entertainment and location was varied enough when took a break from the Medina. Love the markets. People friendly and helpful. Highly recommended.

A last minute stay here after our holiday with Thomas Cook was cancelled last year. Beautiful hotel. Great food and so much variety to choose from. Staff very friendly and helpful. I would definitely return here!

Pros : - The staff are very friendly, helpful (The receptionist need to be more smiling) - Too many activities (archery, foot, volley, pinpon, golf...) - Food too varied and gourmet (Tanjia, pastilla very delicious) - The night parties so wonderful - Covid 19 sanity check Cons: - Location so far from the airport & center (for those willing to visit the city) - Rooms a little tight (however the bathroom is too big) - The double bed is only two twin beds covered by a blanket - Quality of some food need more effort to be delicious (shawarma, tajines of meat) (crepes, waffle & jus on the school bar) Can be improved - The opening of water bottles "ain soltan" not practical (otherwise each visitor should get a bottle opener) - Put another place to get water bottles instead of the…

column3: An all-inclusive get-away from the hustle and bustle
column4: We spent most of our 10-day holiday in the Medina or new Marrakesh, but I wanted a few days lazying about doing nothing and decided an all-inclusive club would serve me and my 8-year old well. It's a very nice hotel, with huge comfortable rooms, friendly and helpful staff. I was studying and needed some files printed out, and the receptionist was so obliging I felt really taken care of. The buffet breakfast and dinner were always plentiful with lots of options especially for kids. They also have a selection of local cuisine, which made the dinners more interesting. For lunch we always stayed by the pool and made the most of the food truck that served hot dogs and burgers. I know, but it was just too convenient!

the hotel is located about 30 minutes outside of Marrakech and offers a free shuttle service to the city centre multiple times a day. the rooms are spacious and clean. the hotel resort complex is huge with several pools, palm gardens, a pond and a kids section. animation and several sportive activities are being offered. the all inclusive option is highly recommended as the lunch and dinner buffet is quite amazing with delicious food, especially the local cuisine. the only issue was the weak wireless internet connection.

column3: All you need: high standard relaxing
column4: Every employee works hard to give you the best experience. High standards in this all in resort. Starts with a perfect room: daily spotless cleaning, large bed, sofa, desk, closets and storage room, aircon, safe, tv, wifi, minifridge, balcony with chairs and table. Large bathroom with towels and toiletries (soap, bodylotion, showergel, shampoo and conditioner). Laundry service if you wish. The buffet is amazing. Lots of different food and is constantly replenished. Unfortunately breakfast and lunch did not have many options for a Vegan. You can sit inside or outside. The waiter even remembered what I drank at dinner! Also the bar staff remembers what you drink and arranged soy milk for me. The hotel resort offers all kinds of sports/activities/entertainment. All for free.…

column3: Worst hotel experience ever - zero luxury or customer service. Solo females please avoid!
column4: After staying previously in a Spanish Iberostar which I loved I booked 3 days here solo for a supposedly relaxing break in a 4* hotel. The grounds are beautiful, it’s close to the airport by taxi and I enjoyed the house wine. The positives stopped there for me. - Harassed by several Male members of staff (leered and gawked at continuously plus the lifeguard literally shouting after me ‘your beautiful’ several times like some creep on the street). Insane behaviour at a 4* hotel, I’d never seen unprofessionalism like it. Felt like most staff had just walked in off the street and picked up working! - Most staff do not speak English very well (or at all) and make absolutely no effort to do so as very few guests are English compared to french. Especially bad were the bartenders to…

Just returned having spent 4 nights here. The facilities here are suberb, rooms are nice and of generous in size. No complaints with the food reasonably varied and something to suit everyone's taste. The staff are exceptional how they treat the guests. The entertainment staff do a great job. Especially the two Mr Hamza's and Big thank you to Youssef in the outdoor dinning area, who's made our stay memorable. The pools, grounds and tidyness of the hotel in general are excellent. There's not too in the area, but the Hotel runs a free shuttle bus to and from Marrakech, this takes about 20 minutes approximately. Thank you Iberostar Hotel for creating wonderful memories for my wife and I. 👏

Just returned from an amazing week at the hotel. The whole experience was special. We had a completely relaxing holiday, amazing food, lovely room and the staff are what makes the hotel really special. The are a lovely team who clearly love what they do and spread their joy and enthusiasm on to the guests. We are quite quiet private people but never felt pressured to take part in any activities and our privacy was respected at all times. The staff always tried to communicate to us in English which was really appreciated. The food was outstanding and we never got bored and thoroughly enjoyed every meal. We were sorry leave, although we only just managed to get home before flights were cancelled. Hope all the staff and guests and ok at this testing time. We will be back.

column3: Great hotel, amazing facilities and great staff
column4: We stayed here for 5 nights in February. From check-in to leaving our stay was amazing. The hotel has beautiful grounds and amazing facilities. You can either go full one and partake in all activities or just lounge around the pools (they have three!) We were AI as I believe most of the guest were. Food was good, better if you are a meat eater but we were never disappointed being vegetarian. My only criticism would be food labelling, we had to on a number of occasion ask what the dish was. From Breakfast to dinner there is plenty of choice. The food truck was also very good, my husband said he had one of the best cheese baguettes from there, you will definitively leave a few pounds heavier. The staff are what make this hotel great, they are super friendly and…

Amazing! Such kind staff, falling over themselves in the restaurant to ensure at each meal I was shown food that was safe and non contaminated for me as a coeliac (gluten free) and offers at lunch and dinner to make me special pizza and pasta and nothing was too much trouble - was not made to feel like a nuisance, but a princess!!! The rest of the staff around the whole grounds are so friendly and cheerful and make you feel very welcome and, by jingo, they work long hours but are so full of cheer and kindness Thank you so much

The food was absolutely delicious and we loved the suite we stayed in. The staff doing activities were really friendly and helpful as were all the hotel staff! The all inclusive was really good value and the shuttle bus service was great. A special thanks to the staff on the trapeze who were really nice and encouraging when I was really scared which enabled me to do it. Highly recommended and have already booked to come back in October !

This hotel is amazing, we have spent 7 nights on our honeymoon and have found the hotel clean and spacious, staff super friendly, special mention to Hamza and Mehde they make the entertainment so worth watching and captivate the audience, thank you to Haji the restaurant manager for arranging my husbands birthday surprise it was totally amazing, the staff here go the extra mile with a smile on their faces. I will defo recommend this place without a doubt the best place to stay in marakech, can't wait to be back ❤️

column3: Nice place to golf and relax
column4: Had a great week with my wife (and a golf-group) in this hotel. Rooms are ok, and staff is very friendly. All-inclusive (breakfast-lunch-dinner) is sufficient, and all day long you can have small snacks near the pool. Only grievance is the dinner-room, which is really noisy. So find a place to eat outside, if possible. Nice golfcourses nearby(30-40 minutes) like Amelkis Golf, Palmeirae golf, Palmgolf Ourika and Royal Golf Marrakech.

Amazing place Quality staff Beautiful resort Lovely food You get a lot more than you pay for All the staff are lovely friendly helpful Hamza & Mehde are among the really great team that work here Hamza made my birthday celebration Great We used the free shuttle several times Ask reception for free map and be aware of people trying to guide you as you exit shuttle bus

column3: A great hotel with impeccable staff.
column4: I was last here in 2004 and was again so impressed. I went with a large group of female relations and friends for my 60 my birthday. The food was fantastic and the staff were absolutely brilliant, they couldn’t do enough for you .

Wow the minute we came to the hotel it was 5 star treatment for the next 6 days. Staff very helpful rooms very clean. The restaurant and bar was excellent. This is my second year at this hotel am looking to come back every year one of the reasons is this hotel the catering for everything. They even have a bus going to town every 2 hours for all guests. 16 of us went we all can’t wait to come back next year !

Our stay was comfortable, hotel room was very clean. Staff at reception and bar were extremely friendly and helpful. The all Inclusive food was of a decent standard and plentiful. The WiFi is very poor, we weren't able to use it at all on some days and evenings.. The rooms were exceptionally small with tiny balconies and no drawers for storing away cloths. The bathroom doors are not good and did not open or close smoothly. They did not replenish the water bottles or provide hand and face towels. the hotels is situated around 25-30 mins drive away from the town center which makes it difficult to just pop out as everything has to be planned. the overall experience at this hotel was decent at best. Lucky for us our group of 16 was awesome and we had exceptional time ALL DAY…

Cannot fault the hotel, staff, location and overall experience, as soon as you walk into the main reception you are welcomed with a high level of service. Staff very friendly and helpful, the grounds well maintained and promote a relaxing environment. Love the burger van. The weather was good but chilly in the morning and cold at night obviously because of the time of year. You could change money at the reception for a good rate if you wanted to but they had a cash machine which you could use if you don’t have money to exchange. I stayed for one week, rooms cleaned every day to a very high standard with special touches each day. The food was incredible. So many traditional dishes and each tasted lovely. The desserts were incredible. Often buffet desserts look better than they…

This hotel far exceeds one's expectations of a 4 star resort. As well as the great facilities, the standard of accommodation, cleanliness, food, activities and the entertainment provided, the hotel excels in it's level of service. The staff, who are efficient, caring and enthusiastic, cannot do enough to ensure a wonderful stay. I enjoyed the spa facilities, took advantage of the bus service, currency exchange (decent rate) and luggage storage. The food is varied, fresh and plentiful and includes several local dishes I'd not eaten before. There is a full timetable of sporting activities. If there had been time I would have tried the trapeze, but I'll do that when I return next year. I enjoyed a 5 star experience here. Need I say more?

column3: Worth staying there but room for slight improvement...
column4: Friendly staff who are very attentive. Clean hotel. Good activities outside but could do with a bit more for the late afternoon crowd. We missed out on things like archery which would have been fun but they only had it at 10am when we were out. Shops were also closed too early so we never got a chance to pop in. Rooms were fairly basic as they lacked certain things a budget hotel would have such as face towels, bottled water (only one between 2) Iron was available on request which was good. Food was OK, except if you are an earlier riser breakfast was prepared an hour in advance of opening so was always cold for the first people there. The WiFi was terrible. No WiFi whatsoever in the rooms. Food at lunch and dinner was decent, would be good to get some insight in to what is…

column3: Outstanding Hotel - You WILL Be Back
column4: I had booked this hotel as a 70th birthday treat for my mum, and I could not have chosen better. We arrived several hours before check-in but the porter immediately took our luggage, we were offered a seat to complete the necessary forms, brought cold fruit juices and told someone would be with us shortly. Within 10 minutes a lovely gentleman introduced himself and took us on a tour of the grounds and facilities. This has NEVER been happened at any other hotel I have stayed in and is a lovely touch. As soon as this was completed, to our surprise, our room was ready. The room was spacious and the bathroom generously sized with a huge shower with a wonderful rainfall shower head. They had even went to the trouble of putting petals on my mum's bed wishing her a happy…

Stayed here for five nights during last week of February. The customer service at the front desk, restaurants, bar, amenities and room service were exceptional. The food at the all inclusive buffet during breakfast had variety, good choices, and always had clean tidy tables available. Only had lunch once there so cannot comment much but during dinner it was always great. There was themed area, such as kebab one day, sea food another and Spanish. There was always an area with Morrocan food which was my favourite. The hotel fell short in some areas, such as bidet, decent shampoo and shower gel, face towels, and of course water in the rooms. The bar areas were good but lacked that extra luxury. The hotel is also small comparatively with others in the area. All in all a great…

The time we had while staying at the hotel was excellent. Starting from the room , staff , spa , buffet meals and bar service. We will be returning again for the third time !! The room bathroom shower was the highlight, every member of staff especially the morning staff at the breakfast buffet. Bar staff knew each persons drink preference from the second day. Pool facilities excellent.

column3: Sunny, warm, great pools and with very friendly and helpful staff
column4: We have just returned from a great all inclusive week. A new holiday experience for us so we were slghtly nervous, but pretty much everything exceeded our expectations. The site is very large and well maintained so it is easy to stroll away from the main pool and bar areas if you want a bit of quiet. We swam in the heated Zen pool with no problems - just swim when it opens and you avoid the children which some others have complained about. We also used the table tennis and boules with no problems. There is an extensive choice of food, the tagine could probably could have been more spiced for us but overall we had lovely meals. And the staff were all brilliant - friendly and helpful.

Having gone to Marrakesh a few times we decided we’d try a different hotel this year. 1. The “Zen” Pool - Advertised to be “adults only” on the website, however it is constantly filled with small children being loud and most of all interrupting other’s swimming. This seems to be very randomly policed, which only causes more arguments. 2. Wifi is pretty non-existent and temperamental at that 3. The Traditional Moroccan Restaurant - Offered couscous and pastilla on the website which we received none 4. Room’s are very echoey and housekeeping are often moving beds early in the morning which can be heard 5 doors down! 5. The reception activities are unnecessarily loud, especially for such an echoey place. We found it impossible to be near it and hear each other talking and…

Just got back from holidaying at this hotel and would highly recommend. The staff are very friendly and super attentive especially with drinks - one waiter (unfortunately have forgotten his name!!) always made sure we had drinks and we never had to go to the bar and he always remembered what we drank. The food is great, apart from the 'bacon'at breakfast, although there is lots of choice and the restaurant is beautifully decorated. There is also a food truck outside which is convenient in case you want to lounge by the pool all day and not have to get dressed up to go inside and have lunch in the main restaurant. Our room was cleaned everyday and towels changed everyday. There were of sunbeds around the pools and staff members bringing you drinks/snacks/clean ashtrays at…

My husband and I and our 14 year old son visited for 5 nights in February. After surviving the transfer from the airport( there appears to be no road rules!) we were relieved to reach Iberostar Club Palmeraie Marrakech. The hotel is beautiful with luxurious furnishings and decorations and perfectly manicured gardens. We were immediately seated in the reception area and we had a glass of juice while completing the check in paper work. We then visited the restaurant for lunch before it closed and then went back for our room key. The room was ideally sized with a large spacious bathroom. We had a pool view although we were directly over the outside restaurant seating area which wasn’t particularly attractive! We walked around the grounds which are extensive and noted that there…

column3: Great hotel just needs a few changes !
column4: We stayed for 11 nights in October and had a great time overall. The mini water park was great for our 3 year old as was the swimming pool the female life guard was fantastic with the children and went out of her way to make them happy. Our son loves the zoo also. Food was good although did become repetitive after a few days as most all inclusive do. Drinks were ok. The food truck was infested with wasps though and although our little one loved the idea we were worried of the hygiene of it. Our main complaint was the mini disco. Our son love it but we felt it was way too late for little ones to start at 9pm. We did go but paid the price in tired tantrums after it!

I have just returned for a week in this superb hotel. For February we had fantanstic weather, between 18 - 28 most days, but chilly mornings. The staff are first class, especially the animation team and bar staff. I was so shocked when they remembered my name and what drinks I would like! We really enjoyed the lunches, evening meals and the snack van. Also while lazy by the pool the guys would come round with donuts and crepes, wow! We had a meal in the restaurant and that was made special as it was my friends birthday and they provided a birthday cake, without charge. My only one personal choice I made that I wish I didn't was to go to the spa. The guy who showed us the spa was full of cold that I then caught and still have. I paid 500dm for an hour and they actual treatment…

column3: Beautiful hotel with amazing customer service
column4: Just returned to Ireland after 4 nights with 12 girlfriends in garden view rooms. We found absolutely nothing to complain about. The hotel is spotlessly clean throughout, food great with huge choices, massive drinks selection and great services. The Spa is fantastic, grounds and gardens beautifully kept and the swimming pools are clean and extremely well maintained. What makes this hotel so special is the staff. We didn't have to ask bar staff for drinks, they brought them to us at the pool as and when they felt we needed them, the courtesy, kindness and professionalism from every staff member we encountered was second to none. Cannot wait to return.

Very beautiful hotel, much space around the hotel, the staff is exceptional friendly, and I mean really everyone. A big thanks to Abdel who made every dinner a pleasure. The food is very nice, warm, enough choices. Animation team is also super, they go to everyone, always friendly and don’t push you if you don’t want to join an activity. Hamza & Mehdi thanks for the good care! Rooms are spacy enough, very clean. There is a shuttle bus to the city and back. If you want a taxi, that’s possible to. Nothing is to much to ask here. I enjoyed every moment there!

Starting with the positive - the grounds are great, the pool areas really lovely, didn’t partake in the activities but they seemed pretty interesting. Restaurant not thrilling for an all-in, the special tagine dinner booking was not worth it. Rooms were pretty basic and not 4* but fairly clean, beds uncomfortable and pillows thin. Good for a cheap break but come with lower expectations.

column3: Perfectly wonderful all inclusive in La Palmeraie
column4: We stayed here for four days looking for some warmth away from a UK winter in February. We were amazed at the quality provided and the friendliness of most of the staff. Hotel is well appointed with all the things you need, including bottled water whenever you ask for it. Restaurant is buffet style with SO MUCH choice! All food needs are catered for including gluten free, with the local dishes on offer being plentiful and amazing! Staff in the restaurants are friendly, attentive and once they have seen you a couple of times, like family! Iberostar should be very proud of the team in Club Palmeraie. The entertainments crew are bubbly, attentive and full of the joy of life, all loving their jobs. Only complaints - were main pool was FREEZING! and reception staff were not…

We stayed at this hotel over New Yaer for a relaxing short break. We really enjoyed our stay, the hotel pit on a huge effort for people to have the best time at New Year. Really good grounds and facilities, there is lots to do to keep you entertained at the hotel and regular shuttle busses to take you into Marrakech.

column3: Very friendly staff, very lovely food and a good place to stay.
column4: I have just recently visited this hotel from the 2nd-6th February 2020. Me and my friend were lucky with the weather as it hit 28 degrees pretty much every day. I thought the zen pool was fantastic given that the bigger one hasn't warmed up due to the weather only becoming warm this week. The hotel staff were all very welcoming, fun and friendly. The food I couldn't fault, there was plenty of choice. For an all inclusive I did notice that the pool closed at six and some meals were only available at certain times. The van made it that you could have something always pretty much in the day but unfortunately after nine at night I don't know if there was anything available to eat. I might have just missed that to be fair. The bedroom was lovely and beautiful and clean but there was…

column3: Absolutely Brilliant and we have already booked to come back in October
column4: My wife and I booked this hotel for a week to celebrate our wedding anniversary. What a wonderful week it was! First of all I would like to say big thank you to Muhammad who arranged a big surprise for my wife and kindly arranged for my wife a cake, sparkling wine & a fantastic pair of swans made from towels and rose petals scattered all over the bed. If you want a great holiday then this is the place for you. The hotel is very well managed and the staff/service is 5 star. It is obvious the staff enjoy working here. Always happy, smiling and making sure you’re having a nice time. Reception staff were always helpful and helped us with phone calls on a few occasions. There is loads to do in the hotel and a different show each night. The entertainment team are excellent and…

column3: Fantastic All inclusive Hotel in Marrakech
column4: Spent 11 days at this hotel. We just wanted a chill out winter break with a bit of sun. Set in fabulous gardens about 40 minutes from the airport and a 30 minute complimentary bus ride to Marrakech town centre. Our room was clean and comfortable. The food was good with an excellent choice. The staff were fantastic, they knew our names and couldn't do enough for us. whether in the resaurant, the bar, by the pool, can't praise them highly enough. We just wanted to laze by the heated pool most days soaking up the rays but we were encouraged to take part in several daytime activities. We had a go at archery and petanque but didn't fancy a go on the trapeze although it was fun to watch others. There was a lively show most evenings in the theatre, parties in the vast reception area…

Had a great January mid-winter break in the sun here. Almost everything you can ask for from an inclusive resort... Friendly staff, good food, well-stocked bar, clean spacious accommodation, spa, heated outdoor pool with plenty of sun loungers and a wide range of easy access sports facilities if you're feeling energetic! Our only criticism would be the cats that seem to have the run of the place. Not sure if they were wild but there were loads of them hanging around the outdoor dining area every day and on our 2nd day one jumped up on my lap while I was eating - that was the last time we sat outside for lunch! They were drinking water from one of the outdoor pools and even wandering into the inside toilets - just strange that this was allowed to happen!

BACKGROUND: To start, I am an avid traveller and have stayed at many resorts in Mexico, Cuba and Dominican Republic. For this trip, the purpose was to experience Africa for the first time and enjoy the culture, while experiencing some time to relax at an all-inclusive. I stayed from Jan 26-Jan 31 and travelled with my cousins (2 adults and one 3 year old). We arrived at the resort and the front desk staff was very pleasant. The check-in was smooth and they spoke enough english for us to have all of our needs taken care of. We were 30 mins from airport! ROOM: Our room was close by to the pool (pool-view) and lobby. The rooms were not 'high-end' per say however they were very decent and tidy. The doors to the bathroom were very cool and the window in the room was also very…

After arriving at Marrakesh airport you are treated to a spotlessly clean airport and very quick (as long as you in fill your little white sheet of paper for everyone in your party with every detail it asks) but very secure entry to another part of the airport but before your allowed to leave you again have to put your bags on to another x-ray machine, but after that it’s straight outside to a lot of taxi drivers asking to take you to your hotel but if you pre-booked your transfer just go to where all the boards are and look for your name, give it over then enjoy your ride to your hotel. When you get to the hotel the security guards help you take your bags in to all I can say is a magnificent open reception area with a jaw dropping chandelier, the reception staff are more than…

column3: The Hotel Staff Made the Holiday!!
column4: My husband and I spent 6 nights at the Iberostar in Marrakech for a little break after Christmas. It was all inclusive and relaxing which was just what we were looking for. The reception staff were amazing and couldn’t do enough for us. We got a room upgrade to a suite and it was beautiful. Not one member of staff let them down, they were all so friendly. The bar staff took the time to know what everyone drank and were preparing our drinks as we walked up to the bar! The smiles were infectious. There was a free shuttle bus several times a day in to marrakech and back to the hotel. As with many all inclusive hotels the drinks are limited to house wines, local beers and spirits and cocktails. If you wanted imported drinks or Champagne then there was a surcharge. The food was…

We really enjoyed our stay at Iberostar Palmeraie! Not sure what makes this place special but we enjoyed the whole experience, room was comfortable, food was good, staff were excellent, animation team really friendly, grounds were relaxing. The whole experience was a good one and much better than expected, we have stayed in plusher hotels with more stars, better ratings but this was an excellent overall experience and we would happily return to Club Palmeraie, the balance was perfect!

Just back from a very relaxing and enjoyable week at the Iberostar. We read all previous reviews with anticipation so now our thoughts on this pleasant hotel. The Food is very repetitive but can’t fault it. Something for everyone and plentiful. Lovely breads, salads, tagines etc. The food is good and the wine is lovely both red, white and rose. The quality of alcohol is very good and water, coffees, teas are plentiful and easily accessible all day. The animation team are all very pleasant but do border on a bit annoying after a few days of saying ‘no thanks’ to their persistent attempts to get you to join in. I appreciate its their jobs and they do a good job of said jobs but not everyone wants to play crazy golf or aqua Zumba when instead they’d rather enjoy their book in the…

We had wanted a quick getaway in January, not too far from UK, reasonable weather and good quality hotel. The Iberostar in Marrakech seemed to fit the bill and we have just concluded a six night stay. The hotel was chosen for a number of reasons: - All inclusive ( at extremely good value when comparing to the bed/breakfast option) - Adults only pool - Choice of restaurants I will come back to these shortly. The hotel is half an hour from central Marrakech and is serviced by a free shuttle bus which runs throughout the day. The grounds of the hotel are vast with three pools, an array of activity options including trapeze(!) and children’s club. The staff are most attentive, helpful and multi-lingual. Overall, our experience at Iberostar has been fair to good, but our reasons…

I created this account just to leave this review - the whole place is brilliant, but in particular the food, and even more importantly, the staff. I’ve never felt more looked after, what a great bunch of people from reception to bar to activities staff. I wouldn’t hesitate booking this trip again for that reason alone.

Amazing family holiday filled with everything we needed. Can not fault the hotel, staff, location and overall experience, as soon as you walk into the main reception you are welcomed with a high level of service. We stayed in the main block and had a garden view, rooms cleaned everyday to a very high standard with special touches each day. Food and drinks are lovely and we always found something to eat and drink. We made friends with a lot of staff/ waiters but are favourite was Mo ( Snoppy); he was so attentive with us and especially with our little boy and always brought extra treats and made a special effort. The jewel in the hotel’s crown is the entertainment team, especially James, Mounain, and Firmino (my little boy changed his name as he looked like the LFC footballer…

Stayed here for 6 nights with our 2 teenagers over the New Year period. The hotel is very well managed and the staff/service is 5 star. It is obvious the staff enjoy working here. Always happy, smiling and making sure you’re having a nice time. The NYE gala dinner was amazing. All food and drink in the resort was excellent. Lots of activities if you want to get involved. A visit into Marrakech is a must. It would’ve been nice if the tour company within the hotel had information in English. We did eventually manage to book a tour with them into the Atlas Mountains which I must add was an excellent day out in a 4x4. Overall we had an excellent experience staying at the Iberostar. A fabulous allinclusive 4star hotel with a 5star service. We would definitely recommend…

This was my first visit to Marrakech, the Iberostar was absolutely stunning. Great rooms, delicious food, the grounds were beautiful. The weather was good but cold at night obviously because of the time of year. Beds were lovely & comfy with plenty to do during the day with all sorts of classes & activities going on. We booked a guide to take us around the city to all the focal points of interest! The staff were very helpful and happy to accommodate. I would definitely go back to the Iberostar Palmeraie as it was spotlessly clean. I really enjoying time there!

Stayed here for a week in January. Lots of activities to do during the day: archery, trapeze, boules, table tennis, spinning... plus a small gym, which was suitable for a decent workout. The food was lovely. Yes it was a little repetitive, however there were so many things to choose from- you could eat something different most days. I’m also vegetarian and had a great selection All the staff were fantastic. Reception staff were always helpful and helped us with phone calls on a few occasions. I also used the spa. The hammam was amazing! I loved it and went twice. Meena and Amina were fantastic. The waiters and animation team were also superb A few negatives- a little more info about things going on in the bar would have been good. We missed bingo and games night as we didn’t…

Just returned from 5 days at this hotel and had a fantastic time. The hotel is excellent and service/staff five star.
