It has lotas of facilities as 3 swiming pools 2 restaurants 2 bar 2 gyms disco club... it a big hotel Massive garden with football pitch golf... Loads of enterteiment. Great variety of food / buffet included breakfast lunch and dinner I would recommened the Morocco restaurant amazing food and music The staff are really good. Cleaning all the time make sure you are happy. Really polite The manager was really profesional with us. Welcome us the firts day I had some questuons which he deal amazing with them. Example: the hotel has a iron service not irons in the rooms. I needed to rion a shirt for the firts night and…

Second time we visited this beautiful place. The gardens are so nice and well kept. Most of the guests are French and since Kappa club is present with some entertainers I have the feeling they are forgetting a bit about their other guests. Nobody met us at the reception and cared in a way some people write about. You feel a bit anonymous when you are not part of the big groups and families that are visiting the hotel. For us its's okay we do not have the need to be amused but a little more attention (especially for returning guests could and would be nice). Nevertheless we will return, because a lot of things at this hotel are very nice. Restaurant, bar, rooms, everyone is taking good care of you. It's possible to have a late check out but not easy to get one, you have to…

From the moment I arrived I felt the staff really cared. I’d booked a quick solo break last minute & emailed the hotel asking for a ground floor room near reception due to walking issues. My room was perfect very close to the lobby with a fab view of the gardens. The room was cleaned well daily the only issue I had was the cleaner accidentally throw away my travel face cleanser but the head of housekeeping couldn’t have been more apologetic. The weather was kind very cold & quite wet even for Marrakech apparently meaning most of the guests were inside the hotel during the day. The animation team were there arranging things to do I was never bored. I got to know the bar staff who were lovely & kept me supplied with olives yum!! Always happy & nothing was too much trouble. When…

column3: So glad we chose this hotel
column4: We are so glad we chose to stay outside the medina, so we had the chance to really relax and get away from everything. The location was stunning - and a free shuttle bus into the city meant that we could pop into the city centre when we liked - so we had the best of both worlds. The hotel was spotlessly clean - possibly one of the cleanest hotels I’ve stayed at. The food was very tasty, fresh, well cooked and a huge variety to suit all tastes. We ate something different almost every day. The staff were incredibly friendly, helpful and attentive - every single person made us feel very well looked after. There were plenty of things to do (or not do - if you just wanted to relax). The rooms were large enough, bright, airy and clean. Can’t think of a single bad thing to say…

This is a great hotel. The staff are so helpful and friendly. The gardens and grounds are beautiful. The hotel is clean and well laid out. The pool is clean and big with plenty of sun beds. The rooms are clean with lots of storage, comfy beds and good size bathroom. The food was good with plenty of choice. It is 30 min drive from the centre of Marrakech but the hotel run a shuttle bus and there are taxis just outside the hotel. The hotel has vigilant security. Recommend this hotel.

I had an amazing ten days at this hotel and loved every single second! Despite travelling alone, I was never lacking in company with the incredibly professional and talented animation team keeping me company whenever needed. Youssef, Anass and Mohamad made my time particularly special. The Kappa team were also very friendly and helpful, even though I was not a Kappa customer. The hotel was faultless and all the staff from reception, to the bar and from the maids to the restaurant were superb. The weather being not that great didn't matter. I would recommend this holiday and hotel to anyone and everyone and I can't wait to go back and stay there again, very soon I hope! Katrina.

My room was modern but still in keeping with the Moroccan area. The hotel grounds are extensive and maintained to the very highest standard with three lovely pools which includes a child friendly area. The staff in all areas of the hotel could not do enough for me and they were so friendly and approachable. I had a wonderful holiday and would return tomorrow.

Had a delightful short break at the Palmeraie. The hotel has extensive grounds, which are utilised well. The hotel is welcoming and the staff are in the main exceptional. There is a main dining area and one additional Moroccan themed restaurant, which in my opinion limits your food choices. The range of food offered in the main dining area is good and of good quality but the vegetarian options were limited. Although, the chef is very happy to provide an alternative if requested. There was a large Asian family when we stayed and it appeared that their meals were specifically catered for. The few days we were there did become repetitive for food choices. There was one themed Moroccan night and I would suggest they offer at least two more themed nights each week to vary the dining…

column3: Fab intro to Morocco and to all inclusive.
column4: We really enjoyed our week's stay and I found all the positive reviews to be accurate. It's just like everyone says... the food is great, the staff are really lovely, the gardens are beautiful and the main pool is a bit chilly! There was lots of our children to do, my younger son adored the Star Friends girls! They made lots of friends and we all felt very welcome, relaxed and very safe. I noticed how the animation team would take special care of anyone who seemed on their own and would sit and eat with them. Karima , the excursion lady in the entrance hall, sorted us out with some fabulous trips out, camel riding and a private mountain tour which were highlights of our stay. I'd never visited Morocco, or gone "all-inclusive" before and I wasn't sure what to expect.…

column3: Nice hotel with lots to do
column4: We have just spent 5 nights here. The weather was hit and miss so we managed to try so activities we wouldn’t have otherwise. There are plenty of sporting activities to do during the day and the staff that ran them were really helpful. We really enjoyed archery and then did tennis and table tennis. When it was warm we sunbathed around the main pool because the adults only pool was full of children because it was heated and no one stopped the children from going there. There was plenty of food to choose from at each meal but the staff were unable to keep up with the change over of tables so when we went in at 9 for our evening meal there was rarely a table set and we would have to wait. There is also an al a carte restaurant that you can go to once in your stay. It is a set meal…

We have just returned from a fabulous 10 day stay at this lovely hotel. In our opinion we would rate this hotel a 5*. We were met in reception with a friendly welcome and then shown around the restaurant by Karim who was very helpful and continued to make sure we were having a good time throughout the holiday. The food was of a very high standard with plenty of choice for everyone's taste. We have stayed at many hotels and this one was one of the best. The rooms where spacious, very clean with plenty of storage and decorated to a high standard. We stayed in rooms 1160 & 1162. We were fortunate enough to share the celebration of the 1 year anniversary of the hotel becoming an Iberostar, which was great. Thank you to all the staff for a great cocktail party that evening. The…

column3: Great week in a fantastic hotel
column4: This is a charming hotel that provides a perfect base for a relaxing holiday. We stayed here for 7 nights with our two children (14 and 11) and enjoyed a super holiday. The hotel is just as others have said. It's very good value, spotlessly clean and the staff are very friendly, clearly work very hard and are very efficient. (We had a problem with the flush on our loo when we returned to our room quite late in the evening. Having notified reception, a plumber turned up within 5 minutes and he replaced the flush and made good within 15 minutes - very impressive). It also felt very very safe, with lots of security. I'm a coeliac which can make travel a bit more complicated. The staff were brilliant. On arrival the manager introduced me to the chef and waiters who were always on…

We just got back to England after a 7 day all inclusive holiday from Iberostar. On arrival it was very welcoming and a beautiful hotel - especially for the deal we got. The room was very clean and well kept. However, no kettles and irons provided in the room. A little walk to the van, bar or restaurant and all your needs would be met with a smile. Ironing service is provided at a fee - not a deal breaker but just be prepared for this maybe? Also a towel deposit is required but refunded at end of stay. The money refunded we just spent at the Medina market, about half an hour from the hotel which the hotel provide a complementary bus service throughout the day. The food was really good with a decent choice. Does get a bit repetitive, but great efforts to offer different…

We have just spent 15 nights at the Iberostar as a family of four, with 4 & 6 year old kids. Where to start, we arrived off the later BA flight and didn’t get to the hotel until around 22.30, the gates to the hotel were locked and we had to be let it by the security guard, he wouldn’t however let our minibus in and so we had to grab the kids, our luggage and walk up the drive, granted it’s not far but wasn’t what we were expecting. Unfortunately it didn’t get much better at check-in, I had booked directly on the Iberostar website which I don’t think happens very often so the check-in staff constantly asked me for my ‘voucher’ when I said I don’t have a voucher this seemed to massively confuse them. We finally got our room keys and were off-handedly pointed in the direction of…

column3: Visiting my Iberostar Family in Marrakech
column4: We enjoyed so much, our previous stay, that we returned. Like always, the food available, is super, alot of variety, can satisfy, all kind of persons, even vegan or vegetarians. The rooms are clean and smell good, if need laundry, its available. Zen pool, is heated, during the winter. Also are available, 2 more pools, kids pools and main pool. Kids club, for all ages, starting from 4. The hotel, have now, a little farm, they have ducks, sheeps, turkey, little goat, peacock, chickens and rabbits, you can visit it and feed them, if you like. The hotel is getting better, many aspects are improving. The grass, now have also flowers, which, give more colorfulness, to the areas, near the pools. The Hotel staff, are like Family, super friendly and always available to help, if…

Nice place, first time we tried all inclusive, the buffet was amazing both for breakfast and dinner, we had a nice room. A special thank you for Salah in Bar Zen...he took great care of all the visitors....All in all a nice hotel

Had a week here recently , oh my goodness , spotlessly clean , , The friendliest people working here , they work so hard to make your stay comfortable .The manager was such a lovely friendly man , going out of his way to see we were ok , he saw to it that i had medical attention for my hand and regularly checked i was ok . You wont find a cleaner hotel , food is fine , drinks are fab , animation team are so lovely . Free coach out to the markets or around 12 pounds in a cab , beds , rooms cleaned every day , fresh towels every day etc , just go there its excellent .

We just back from our week-long stay in Morocco and what an amazing experience. The hotel just blew our minds: the staff, the surroundings, the food, the animation team everything was beyond expectations. I had the chance to stay in many hotels around the world and mainly they were 5star ones, but none of them was so good as this one. Special thank you to our restaurant waiter Bouiad Younes, what an amazing guy! He is really going an extra mile with the service, he even sang a happy birthday song for our son on his Birthday dinner. Special thank you to the guys at the bar and the reception team, they all are very welcoming. I and my family would highly recommend this hotel, can't wait to come back one day.

column3: Felt like I was visiting family....
column4: Just back from the wonderful Iberostar and getting withdrawal symptoms. Journey from airport was hassle free, booked transfer via holiday extra and taxi ride took 40 minutes. On arrival was swiftly greeted by reception staff who sat us with fruit punch and took us through the booking process. Relations manager Imad came promptly to welcome us was very friendly and professional. We got to the hotel at 13:00 and check in officially is at 15:00 but our rooms were ready so we got in promptly. Rooms were clean, fitted with TV, a fridge and a safe no iron or hair dryer and no tea coffee facility. Hotel grounds are beautiful , 3 swimming pools, 1 heated zen pool with bar, the other splash pool shallow for all ages, ice cold but good fun with slides etc, and the main pool tranquil…

column3: The best Hotel we have ever been to!!
column4: I stayed at here for 4 nights in the middle of march with my wife and 19 month old son. From the minute we got there to the minute we left the hospitality and customer service were outstanding. We felt very welcome. The grounds, rooms and restaurants are in pristine condition. There are always friendly workers maintaining the hotel and they are the foundation to it being extremely clean. The buffet was very good and had something for all of us (including my son)! My only recommendation would be to have more of a variety for desserts. There are also many activities to do on the grounds; including sports, theatre and lots of lovely areas to lounge about and relax. We also found the free shuttle bus service to the city centre very useful. The rooms are very well maintained…

The staff at this resort is top notch!! They remembered our names wherever we went and went out of their way to be helpful and friendly. The food was okay, drinks were really good. This resort definitely seems to cater to families and older guests; we were the only people in the disco for awhile. We felt very safe, facilities were nice, and the price was good. The spa....was phenomenal!! We got the traditional hamam and a massage. It was an incredible experience and excellently priced!

column3: A hotel who really care about its guests!
column4: We have been Iberostar guests for nine nights early in March and we have been treated extremely well. Whole staff was very polite and careful and did everything they can to offer us a splendid holiday. A special mention for Walid who is General Manager, a man who is very professional, so implicated in his business, kind and ready to help you; Ikram a very young lady from front desk that has excellent customer service skills, ready to help you anytime and always smiling. I foresee a brilliant future as a hospitality manager; And Fatima our room housekeeper who did her best to feel as a VIP. In a few words a very enjoyable holiday. Definitely, we will return in one day!

column3: Lovely hotel, will definitely be back
column4: Have just returned from 4 nights at the Iberostar Club Marrakech for a long weekend stay with my mum. Overall, we had an amazing time and will definitely be back to stay at this hotel again. Positives - staff are very friendly, we had read some reviews about staff not being attentive enough or speaking good english, which we found to be completely the opposite. Everyone we spoke to remembered our name and went out of their way to help us. Hotel is very clean and well kept, entertainment each night is good, drinks included within the inclusive package are fine with a big choice of cocktails included. Food was lovely, a wide selection of all sorts, we never got bored.The manager in particular was lovely, and on our first day when we arrived before check in time, he came and…

This hotel was superb, everything we wanted and needed. What makes it truly special is the staff, they are a wonderful team, nothing is too much trouble they go above and beyond all the time and with such good grace. They are so welcoming and friendly! The rooms are beautiful, interiors exquisite and the gardens, wow beautiful, so well tended. 3 pool area’s, all quite different, whatever you need is there. There is even a small animal park with goats, rabbits, geese,peacocks, really lovely and so unexpected. Particularly look out for Zyad, a great waiter. Forthe best welcome and most beautiful smile ever, look out for Halima in the Bar Arginier and in the restaurant, she makes the most delicious cafe au lait.

Great place to stay, comfortable rooms, beautiful gardens,only small downside is no tea making facilities in the room. Staff attentive, Imad( guest relations manager) and Zyad(pool bar-food truck)were esp helpful and nothing was too much trouble Well done club palmeraie Marrakesh!!

Best hotel iv ever been to .Good excellent infact I felt I had to thank resturant manager .staff are brilliant. Gave zen bar man a tip he looked after us all week. Clearly amazing holiday hoping to go back October. All I can say is thank you ibrostar the best hotel ever x

This resort has lovely well kept gardens, with three swimming pools. The rooms are clean,but lack any tea or coffee making facilities. The staff are friendly and welcoming and provide excellent customer care. The food has various choices and is replenished or cooked fresh as required, buffet style self service with tables kept clean and cleared by lovely staff. Daytime and evening entertainment program is good and there are plenty of sports activities as and keep fit on site. Hotel is situated outside main Marrakech but provides shuttle service into main tourist area. The main languages spoken are Arabic and also French.The currency is close, which means you can only buy currency once you arrive, remember to change back k before you leave! The duty area is priced in Euros so if…

Just got back - wished we hadn't when you come back to snow :(. This i have to say is one of the best hotels i have stayed in. The grounds are beautifully well kept, the rooms are clean and tidy (and the bed was to die for - Super king). The staff are friendly and nothing is too much for them, the food is lovely. I cant fault anything about this place, thoroughly enjoyed our stay here & would definitely come back.

1st time to Marrakech and would we come back to this hotel? Hell yes! Great food! Great accommodation! Great staff! We had a fabulous time, nothing was too much trouble! We came as a party of 14, a pre wedding tan-do, whilst here it was my husbands big birthday too! We were well looked after by Iman, the guest relations manager & Wahid the general manager, it’s a beautiful hotel and the staff were brilliant, happy, keen & quick to serve too. The entertainments team were very good and involved everyone. Even though we had no young children with us the facilities were that good for young children we are thinking of coming back with the grandchildren. Thank you for a fabulous 4 days!

My partner and I have just returned from a week away at this hotel, we had an amazing time and will definitely be returning for another visit! From the moment we arrived the staff were very helpful and friendly and went out of their way to make you feel very welcome. The hotel is a little oasis, it is located in very well kept grounds, very clean and I would like to express a special thanks to our chambermaid, sorry I did not get your name, for making my birthday very special by placing towel art in our room. I would like to express a very special thank you for Imad, the Customer Relations Manager, for helping my partner to organise a very special surprise in our room for my birthday, I returned to roses, champagne, towel art and a cake!! The animation team were great and…

column3: Friendly staff and great standard of a hotel
column4: I stayed there for a week, the food was excellent, three pools (one heated), exercise classes, childrens entertainment (you could leave your children them all day), hotel was a good standard (although the walls are a little on the thin side), cracking view of the Atlas Mountains and the staff are very welcoming. Customer Service Adviser that remembered our names, knew where we'd come from and continued to do so with all guests that stayed in the hotel. It's been a while for me when I stayed in a hotel where one persons sole job was to walk around and talk to guests to find out how there stay is and if he could improve it. The standard of the food was very high, high standard restaurant that you have to book, free bus (also have to book the night before) into Marrakech and…

We had a lovely 4 days in Marrakech, and wished we were staying longer. This hotel is a great base for a combination of luxury/relaxing in a hotel, and visiting Marrakech town - we used the shuttle bus daily (spot on time - don't be late!!) and it dropped you conveniently half way between the old and new town so perfect for exploring both - about 15 mins walk either way. It was then lovely to get back from the hustle and bustle to enjoy a welcoming beer/wine whilst relaxing by the amazing pool. The staff here are brilliant, and everyone is so happy and welcoming. (and I don't have a clue what other travellers wrote about French guests being preferred - we were treated the same as everyone else, in a lovely welcoming manner) The food is good for an All Inclusive, and plenty of…

Visited for a family holiday in March for 4 nights...wish it was longer! Such a beautiful hotel with great facilities and fantastic food. The staff at this hotel are amazing and hard working, they are always smiling and really enjoy being there. Very clean and beautiful location, lovely gardens and pool area. Great for kids and adults. Good varied choice of food and drinks with it being all inclusive. 25 minutes from the airport. Quad biking and camel rides across the road. Nice bar area and nightclub and Moroccan restaurant. Lots of different areas to relax. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Marrakech and would definitely stay here again!

We went for a few days winter sun and ended up having a city break as the sun was missing for the first few days. Having read reviews we chose iberostar even though we always go 5 star. The hotel was lovely, but you only get one chance to make a first impression. We went to our room to await our luggage and immediately noticed twin beds. We called reception and asked to be moved to a room with a double bed only to be told they had no double beds, but would ask housekeeping to remake the bed as one. While waiting I noticed my jacket that I had put down was covered in dust. The furniture was covered in builders dust, I started looking further and found long hairs on the floor, and then other bits of dirt became apparent, the pubic hair on the bathroom floor was the last straw. I…

We are halfway through our holiday in Marrakech. Here is some pros and cons: Pros: - beautiful, clean and well maintained hotel - room good size, tile flooring which is huge plus - staff seem to enjoy their work, they seem happy and creates good atmosphere. - free shuttle bus to the town (doesn’t take straight to the souks, but it’s not far and easy to find) Cons: - when we arrived and were looking around where to find our room, piccolo asked our room number and literally took our suitcases out of our hands and started to walk to the room. We had just exchanged money and had no change to give him( plus we never asked to take our bags). Later the night when we were enjoying ourselves and having wine at the bar he came to us saying our room door was open. I went all to way to…

Just returned from a great week's stay as a couple at this hotel, our first trip to Morroco. Warmly wecolmed with drinks in reception and taken to our room. Room quiet, looking out onto gardens and very clean. The hotel location is about 20mins drive from Marrakech old town and there is a free shuttle bus from the hotel bookable at reception. The hotel grounds are large and beautifully landscaped. The is lots to do -table tennis, boules, tennis, football, volleyball, spinning ,Zumba etc or you can just relax round one of the pools or the bars -the are plenty of quiet areas to laze in. One of the pools was heated and it was delightful to dip into. The food is of very good quantity and never stops! If you have fussy children they might be restricted a little. The all inclusive…

column3: A family stay - positives and negatives
column4: We were very much looking forward to our stay at the Iberostar Marrakesh, after spending a week touring thorough Morocco and staying in smaller Riads. Pros: we arrived a bit early, just before lunch finished and they welcomed us to go have lunch. The buffet varied every day. One heated pool. Trapeze experience for the kids. Kids love playing Ping Pong. The transportation via shuttle to the center was timely and nice. The rooms were modern and clean. Cons: I agree with other guests that the French speakers seemed more attended to. There was quite a long wait at reception to check in. There were guests - both children and their parents who were accosting the geese - chasing them and throwing things at them - mother geese who wanted to protect their nests and their eggs. …

column3: Great stay, lovely staff and surroundings
column4: I went with my friend, spent 4 nights. All inclusive. Greeted well by the staff, although I did find that one particular staff member hovered around for a tip when they took our bags to the room. Generally everyone was very hospitable. The food was varied and good - although I doubt it was authentic morrocan food at the buffet. The restaurant manager kindly managed to get us a table last minute, the food was good - although I felt it was very similar ingredients and drinks to what is served in the buffet and the poor serves seem overwhelmed. The shuttle to town was very useful, although we found out about this 2 days into our visit after over paying for taxis. It's a shame the shuttles doesn't operate later into the evening. The rooms were clean and nicely prepared every time we…

column3: Pleasent family stay at the Iberostar
column4: I was in a party of five adults and this was our first visit to Marrakech. Weather at the end of Feb was warm in the day but I wish I had taken a coat for the evenings as it was a little chilly outside. The hotel was further out than I would usually stay but it made for an interesting trip when you left the hotel. We used the free hotel shuttle to the Souks and this arrived and left on time. Although we did not book with Thomas Cook, we were able to book a very enjoyable and reasonable priced trip to the Atlas mountains, with the helpful Thomas Cook lady who sits in the reception area and she speaks English. The hotel staff do an excellent job at keeping the hotel clean throughout. Rooms were ample size with small balcony/terrace with drying rack provided and free safe. …

We stayed at the Iberostar Club Palmeraie Marrakech for 8 nights in February 2018. I'll start by saying we definitely had a pleasant, relaxing stay, and I would certainly recommend the hotel. That said, there were some issues that could have take the stay from good to great. Pros: The price was very reasonable given the amenities. The buffet was excellent - unlike other all-inclusives I've stayed at, the food was not lots of fried, unhealthy options. There was a substantial salad bar, many vegetable dishes, and the overall predominance of Moroccan food was a nice treat. The various pools had plenty of seating, as did the bar area. The rooms were very comfortable and quiet - some of my companions thought the beds were a bit overly firm, but I thought they were great. …

column3: Wonderful, attentive service. Beautiful surroundings. Great value.
column4: We have just spent a lovely break away with friends at this hotel. We were a party of 8 - 3 couples and 2 toddlers. It was the first time I've been on an 'all inclusive' holiday, and I wasn't sure of what to expect. The hotel is situated about 15 - 20 mins drive away from the centre of Marrakech in the Palmery area to the east of the city. It therefore is away from the bustle of such a lively city, and is a very different option from one of the classic city centre Riads through which Marrakech gets such a wonderful reputation. It is part of an international chain, and as such benefits from many of the facilities familiar to other hotels in this chain, but this also means the place is not completely individual, and thus the character of the place suffers ever so slightly. The…

The hotel itself is great, and the staff do everything they can So clean everywhere - they are always cleaning Large rooms nice to have a part heated pool in February Nice relaxed atmosphere Lots of staff, and always checking you are ok, but without being intrusive Food ok, albeit could maybe look for a bit more variety - we only did 5 days at the hotel, but 2 weeks would have been an issue with the repetitiveness. Also would be useful to have an information book in the room, some things you find out as you go eg towel hire etc Location is out of town, but the shuttle bus works really well - and to be honest for a relaxing break, it is probably a plus that you are not in central Marrakech

A very much French speaking hotel, we felt welcomed and well placed. Check-in was smooth, hotel is clean and grounds prestine! Temperatures were around 21 degrees during the day and cooler in both the mornings and evenings - suggest you layer up. Very friendly entertainment team, keep the clientele engaged, massive thank you to Mido who made the kids holidays. Lots to keep you active from stretching, water aerobics, tennis, archery and spin. Nice gym too. Not over crowded, always had a sunbed, heated pool was lovely - didnt see anyone in the normal pool during our 5 day stay (probably because the weather was not hot enough). There is a deposit of 100 dh (pp) for the towels which is refunded at the end of the stay. Food was excellent and plentiful, caters well for…

I stayed here for a week and had a terrible stay. My room door did not lock but did shut. We were asked to move rooms after 1 night as our room was not ready when we arrived. The shuttle bus does not stop at the market although they told us it did. Next time we will get a taxi. Very annoying. The wifi is terrible either in the rooms or in the hotel. Its basically 5% coverage at best. Just does not work. The cleaner would tidy the room at 4pm each day, so late. Extras such as washing and telephone calls so expensive. The bed sheet had stains. At breakfast food often run out at one point there was no bread, lemon and milk. We waited ages for it to arrive. Im shocked there are so many good reviews on this hotel we were very disappointed.

Visited this hotel from 5th feb-10th feb with my brother and father and I can honestly say this is the Best hotel I've visited. Staff are lovely and the guest/ staff interaction was so special! Big special thank you to Mohamed (Entertainment) and Hajji (Foodhall) for looking after us whilst we visited. Whilst we were visiting the country unfortunately we experienced really bad weather, with heavy rain and it was cold so we spent the majority of our stay in the hotel where we were really looked after! The food was amazing and there is a good selection, the rooms were Nice and clean and nothing beats a nights sleep in the beds and they have loads of sports activities and entertainment throughout the day. I make youtube videos so you can see clips of the hotel in my video I made…

The hotel is just on the outskirts of the city but there are free shuttle buses all day to the center. The hotel itself is amazing. It's spotless inside and out. The rooms are generous and tended 3 times day. The staff are incredibly friendly and can't do enough for you. The food and drink are bountiful and there is something for even the most challenging of eaters! My husband and I went with another couple and were totally spoiled. While there it was our friend's 40th and they made her a cake, sung to her in 3 languages and gave her a bottle of bubbly! The rooms were dressed everyday, beds turned down at night, chocolates, petals, the works. Amazing. I would recommend it to anyone and would definitely go back in a heartbeat. Thankyou for making it so good.

column3: Beautiful vast Moroccan themed hotel - Exceptional Value for Money
column4: Rooms - Spacious, Very Clean, Modern and Huge Bathroom. Food - Good choice and quality. The Valentines themed buffet was the best! The Moroccan restaurant was a nice change and a good opportunity to try some traditional local food. Pools and Complex - VAST Beautiful, well-kept gardens, huge tennis courts, football pitch, trapeze, golf range - great for teenagers. x3 large pools including a special kids one. Two shops on site. Huge function room for the evening entertainment and night club and a TV room for football fans. Kids Club - Good and the staff (Imhrie) worked very hard to keep the kids happy. Evening Entertainment - Good variety of shows, staff work hard to please everyone. Positives: - Secure, safe and stunning hotel - Lovely, clean and modern rooms - Food truck…

I highly recommend this hotel for families or anyone wanting to relax The food is the best buffet food I have ever had Great activities for adults and children including trapeze and spinning with the lovely Ssamadi who is a great fitness instructor Beautiful gardens and heated pool Some other reviews say pool was not heated but there is a huge warm pool that we all enjoyed All the staff are amazingly helpful and friendly I could have stayed another week!

column3: Great hotel, cold pools in February, excellent for families
column4: We booked for February half term and on the basis that one of the pools would be heated. There are no heated pools but there are so many activities it didn't ruin the holiday. The staff are excellent and my children enjoyed all the activities including the trapeze, badminton, tennis, boules, and archery were daily favourties. Even the little ones can have a go as its very safe and lots of fun. The food is good and they have a sushi evening which went down well. They also have a Moroccon restaurant you can book in advance and is a nice change from the buffet. When we were unpacking we realised we hadn't any asthma pumps for my son. Panic! A visit to the medical office and 10 Euros later they had organised one to be delivered within a few hours. I couldn't believe how easy and…

Just got back from a wonderful 4 day break with friends and to celebrate my 40th birthday. From the moment we arrived at the hotel, till the very end Myself, husband and friends could not fought this hotel. The hotel was spotless and was always being cleaned The staff are so friendly and can not do enough for you. There kindness, politeness and hospitality is amazing. Our room was cleaned daily and fresh towels twice a day., and at night they would turn your bed back, put slippers by your bed and leave you a chocolate. The food was excellent and catered for every pallet and never stopped!! The beverages were great and fantastic cocktails. Would definitely recommend all inclusive. There was always entertainment to see. The pools were beautiful I would definitely recommend this…

We loved our stay at the hotel. From the time we arrived to leaving the staff were very supportive and happy to help. All the staff easy to speak to and regularly engaged with the hotel guests without being too intrusive. Food was excellent with varied choices. It is far away from the centre of Marrakech but there is a regular shuttle to the centre. Rooms were lovely and room service had some nice touches in the room which were much appreciated. Special mention to the bar staff, they made my evenings very eventful. I definitely would stay at the hotel again.

column3: Great Hotel and Staff but very average Food
column4: We visited the hotel in early Feb, the hotel was clean, nicely maintained and all staff were lovely and welcoming. Take two stars out because even though the buffet has huge selection none of them was good. Most of the staff didn't know English and I was disappointed with the heated pool/splash pool as it was one of the main reason to book this hotel. It was hardly heated :( so couldn't make use of it.

The Iberostar, where do I start!! What a fabulous holiday it was! This was for my mother’s 60th and it’s certainly one she or I won’t forget. From the moment we arrived at the hotel we were treated like royalty, the first two gentlemen we met with were the managers and they were so polite, welcoming us and offering some drinks while we waited to check in. The reception staff were also very lovely and tried to get the whole process done ASAP. No complaints at all! The first impressions of the reception area were something I’ll never forget – smelling good, looking grand, I could have sat there all day!! Our room was lovely – perfect for the 3 of us with 3 single beds, lovely bathroom with little toiletries and ample space in the wardrobes to hang clothes etc. We were…

We had a lovely stay on the last day in Marrakech with lots of regret why we wasted our time and money in the useless Pullman Hotel with such low standards. Anyway that last day in this beautiful hotel was enough to melt the ice of our bad experience in Pullman Hotel and change our view about Moroccan food and hospitality . The staff are so kind and helpful and friendly specially Mohammad in reception . Food is in abundance and very tasty . Lots of dance and entertainment programs which kept you busy enjoying every moment of your stay . Easy check in and check out . Clean rooms and comfortable beds . I cannot say anything more but " A BIG THANK YOU " to Iberostar . You are the best .

I stayed with my daughter for a short break. Once we had made it through the horrendous slow airport (2 hours) the hotel was an Oasis at the end The room was lovely, all the food that we had great. Even a chocolate fountain one evening The omelette chef made the best for breakfast, do try. I got a lovely surprise for my Birthday from the hotel, cake and fizzy, which was a lovely touch The hotel was so clean too and in lovely grounds, just a pity about the constant rain, but it did not spoil our fun The staff were great and they always had a smile on their faces and the room maid was so helpful All the reviews are correct about how great the hotel and staff are Thanks so much for a lovely relaxing weekend away, including the spa

My family and I stayed in this hotel from Boxing Day into the New Year. What a fabulous experience it was! From arriving at the hotel we were treated like royalty. Every member of staff at this hotel cannot do enough to make your holiday that bit more special. They really do go that extra mile to make you smile! The rooms are very clean and the maid service is daily with clean towels each day. The food is very varied and there is something on the menu to suit everyone. My daughter is quite a fussy eater but managed to find something each evening. The entertainment team are very friendly and welcoming, but if you don't want to join in any of the activities understand that too. There is a regular bus service ran by the hotel into Marrakech which is well worth a visit (no…

This hotel definitely lived up to expectations. We arrived at 11.00, well before the permitted check in time, but we were immediately met by the hotel manager who greeted us warmly and went out of his way to make us feel welcome and to arrange a room for us. The room was really nice - a decent size, with comfortable beds and a great view (we opted for a garden view room). It was spotlessly clean and had a lovely bathroom. All members of staff were extremely friendly and good humoured at all times. The choice of food was really good, and was well cooked. The red wine, of which my glass was regularly recharged by the waiter, was perfectly acceptable. The bar staff soon got to know us and knew immediately what drinks we wanted. The bar area is good, and there is a quieter…

column3: Amazing hotel with good customer attention ! Very good value
column4: Hello. I spent few days at the Iberostar as I know the chain is a well regarded name in Spain. The hotel is situated 15 mins from Jemma el Fna by taxi but the hotel offers their shuttle for free in the mornings and afternoon. I was very impressed by the comfort of the rooms. The hotel has been renovated so all the rooms and bathrooms are nicely done +very comfortable bed. The breakfast was varied with freshly squeezed orange juice, cooked food and continental breakfast too with plenty of fruits salads etc. All freshly made. Dinner were lovely too with different tasty dishes. The staff was very nice and helpful.. The entertainment was very good too. Its a hotel complex with beautiful and well manicured gardens ! Highly recommend

Top service, polite and friendly Staff and Managemet. Clean room, very tasty and good food. Weekly arrangement in the Reception. Two swimmingpools, one heated (did not test them). Would like to come back. 👍

Wow wow to start off with amazing hotel beautiful the grounds are stunning the manager greeting us checking was quick easy, My room perrrfect clean balcony view lovely, the staff Jalil, Halina, Mohamed, Restaurant manager Hajji made me feel special on birthday surprising me with a birthday cake. the entertainment staff funny lovely friendly so much to do each day and night, kids friendly people of all ages and of all colour would definitely going back when a little warm with the family. The food fresh every day grill fish, grill meat, deserts of all kinds something for everyone zumba, table tennis, law tennis, trapeze, volley ball basket ball, this list goes on and on for activities. A place to go a must just to say thank you Iberostar Club Palmeraie Marrakech for making my…

column3: Never again, Poor service. Tons of French Guest & Staff speak very little English.
column4: I visited this hotel going off the positive reviews. This was a mistake. The hotel staff barely speak English. Majority of the staff and guest are French you could count the English guest on one hand and still have spare fingers. This hotel is full of a false images meaning they do NOT carry best customer services. The food is the same food everyday, just moved around or an additional dish or layout. If you're not French or Arabic you don't have much communication with anyone. The manager is pretty nice and speaks English however, We only engaged with him once or twice in passing. Selective staff speak a little English and it isn't helpful. We didn't enjoy having our rooms far away from main building with restaurants' and bars as at the set meal times we had…

I wanted a reasonably priced hotel for a January getaway and chose this hotel based on the constant good reviews and the very reasonable price. I didn't want to stay in the city, I wanted something away from the bustle and noise and the Iberostar was perfect, the hotel sits in beautiful gardens, which you could spend hours in just wondering or sitting, Always plenty of loungers around the three pools, although in January, these were not exactly busy. My room was large and comfortable with a small balcony looking over the pool area and a large very clean bathroom, I particularly liked the settee, great for lounging and reading. The restaurant was always very busy, even at this time of year but I always managed to find a table somewhere, the choice of food was excellent and…

My husband and myself stayed at this beautiful hotel between 9th - 16th January 2018. We want to express our gratitude and a big ‘thank you’ to staff and Management for making our stay such a memorable one! We have never stayed in a hotel where our needs are cared for to the minutest detail. Our discomfort in walking to a long distant room was quickly rectified and we were given a room closer to Reception within minutes! Brahm was very patient with any of our concerns and addressed them promptly. People like Leila in the Dining room and another nice lady in the Bar Lounge really made us feel very special. Chef Abdallas took special interest in our culinary requirements and talked about his experiences working in Oman and Dubai. He went out of his way to make Spinach paneer and…

column3: Great hotel with friendly and helpful staff. News Years 2018 :)
column4: We visited the Iberostar new year as a group of 10 over approx 2 weeks. We have spent new year in Marrakech before so sort of knew the deal with the weather. Nice in the day but chilly at night so I advise taking a couple of jumpers to keep warm in the evening. Some southern Europeans seemed more wrapped up for longer but I found shorts and t-shirt were OK by 10 am, by 12 pm you could get in the pool (relax/quiet pool) as it was heated. We had quite a mix bag of ages in our group from 12 - 67 years and the hotel facilitated well for everyone. Most mornings some would go off with a member of the animation team to some sort of activity. There was never any pressure just a polite request if you would like to join, after a couple of days they would have the measure of most of the…

This hotel has a strong cultural feel of the region matched up with the comfort westerners look for during their holidays. A short drive from the center of Marrakech, this hotel is a bit remote but quite comfortable with excellent buffets in their restaurants for any meal...allowing familiar western meals as well as regional Moroccan cuisine. The Guest Relations Manager, Mr. Elkhaoudari Imad, goes to all extremes to ensure that all the needs of its guests are met. Very enjoyable, pampered stay...recommended for those new to travel in Africa.

Where to start... Lovely hotel, spotlessly clean & upkept: rooms, public areas, dining, bars, pools, gardens. Nice offering of activities (and tours etc as well) but no pushing guests to either participate or to explore away. Staff is out of this world, nothing's too much to ask, extremely helpful & attentive. FOOD? W.O.W. Think they only offer showers but they're huge. Patio or balcony with each room, only ground 1 upstairs floor, lifts. Gym small & not all worked apparently. Loads of spa offerings, reasonable prices compared to Europe, and independently run by other personnel. Very friendly & fun staff, or they leave you to it if you prefer! Nightly shows / dancing apparently. We had the treat of being there for Christmas, and they really made it magnificent,…

column3: Quite possibly one of the greatest All Inclusive hotel in the World!!!!
column4: We stayed at this Iberostar from 20th Dec - 27th Dec 2017. We choose this hotel after reading all the reviews on Tripadvisor, and would say this is one of the best decisions we made. What a little gem of a hotel this is in an amazing city. Everything went perfect from the minute we landed; booked the taxi through the hotel and the taxi was waiting for us on arrival, arrived promptly and check-in was quick, well explained, hotel was brilliant in taking our requests on board, we requested for a double bed (instead of 2 single beds) and an upgrade to room with pool view and both the requests were met. The double bed was more like a UK King Size bed, very comfortable. Room was clean with large bathroom. The best thing about the hotel is the staff, what a credit they are to this…

when we arrived we went straight for our evening meal before checking in after that we went to check in very fast and shown to our room the room was spacious very clean with a large bathroom and two very comfortable beds a great service at the bar everyone very friendly the dining room was very big a great choice of food to pick from a great selection of desserts as well the entertainment team work hard and always had time for you the guest manager introduced himself to us and said if you need anything just ask so him most days and he spoke to us calling us by our names went to the spa for a massage very well priced only downfall was the masseur had a cough everybody was very good to us would I recommend it yes I would and I would go back I would like to see a bit more…

Was a lovely hotel with fantastic staff so friendly good food it did repeat but that’s not a problem was welcomed into the dinner hall very night by wonderful attentive staff. The welcome we got when we arrived get so warm and loving and will Defo go back in summer to enjoy the heat

Stayed at this Hotel from 27th December to 10th Jan - Party of 10 friends all ages. This hotel has a wonderful atmosphere and great staff, the facilities are close to each other and the staff encourage but do not pester. New years eve gala night was wonderful, with cocktails and dancers to start, followed by a fantastic food feast of big prawns, smoked salmon, and wonderful meats. We had 12 days of full sunshine temperatures ranging from 19-24C, the zen pool is heated and we swam everyday. Their is a cocktail party on Monday nights with the staff, other nights included a quiz night and casino night before dinner. After dinner their is entertainment in the Theatre ranging from Bollywood dancing to 90s night, this is then followed by a club/disco until 1am. Imad the Customer…

column3: Couldn't have chosen a better hotel!
column4: We couldn't have chosen a better hotel to spend our holiday in and it's definitely become one of my top 3's for many reasons. I stayed here with my lovely mum and we both really loved it. I travel extensively and have stayed in a variety of 4&5* hotels around the world and Very rarely visit a hotel more than once... but this is one I will return to. The staff are superb! We felt like we were among friends the whole time we were there because everyone was so welcoming, friendly & hospitable and kind. The entertainment team were fantastic and the evening shows were bursting with energy and talent. We didn't need to go out at night because we had such fun in the hotel watching the shows and dancing our socks off. The discotheque (nightclub) after the show was good fun too…

column3: The people really do make this place..
column4: Such a lovely place to start our New Year. It was the perfect location and destination for a cheeky winter sun break with my partner. Four days of pure bliss. When we first arrived (late evening), on first impressions we were a little apprehensive, but by midday the next day we got it, we were totally embraced by the amazing hospitality. If we were to sum up in two words why this resort was nothing short of amazing, it would have simply been ‘the people’, they really did go way above and beyond our expectations.. simply stunning. With a very special mention to HAKIM the wonderful Barman, Mo Mo the incredible pianist and evening entertainer and the fabulous Guest Relations Manager whose name sadly escapes me. Thank you all x

column3: Simply brilliant - excellent staff, amazing food, lovely hotel, great weather!
column4: This is a long review – but in a nutshell: It’s great – go! We have also included some tips on Marrakech which we hope help. We have been to hotels and on holiday around the world but I have never been so well looked-after as at this hotel. We had a lovely room with a massive bed and large shower room. We had a balcony too. There’s aircon/heating if you need – as the nights are cold outside. The staff go out of their way to help. Nothing is too much trouble. It would be impossible to mention everyone and it seems almost unfair to mention a few but here goes: * Imad, customer management – went out of his way to make sure we had a quiet room and when Sarah was poorly, arranged for the nurse (she’s in the hotel from 10am every day I think) to come up with medicine – this was at…

This hotel has received an Iberostar overhaul and is modern, bright and clean in a Moorish style. It is typical of the large all inclusive hotels in the Palmeraie area. All staff were very friendly, caring and enquired regularly about our comfort, happiness and enjoyment. The lady on reception was a really lovely host. We found the food to be good, a variety at all mealtimes and usually well labelled. All alcohol was pleasant and cocktail choice was good. The bar and restaurant staff were smiling and welcoming. There is always something for even fussy plain eaters. The pools are a great set up with an adults only as well as a general pool and a separate large kids pool. There are many activities here to keep you and / kids occupied, even trapeze lessons! All the main areas…

The one factor that stands above anything in summing up this hotel is the staff. I have never come across staff anywhere else who are so dedicated, friendly and helpful. With the exception of one or two individuals I've never met such a smiley bunch. They are extremely hard working and are a credit to the hotel. Overall, the hotel is spotlessly clean and the grounds are very pretty and well kept. The rooms are basic but spacious and perfectly adequate although I did find the beds extremely firm, bordering on rock hard! The bathrooms have a shower - no bathtub. The food is good and caters for all tastes and appetites. All inclusive drinks are ok but one or two of the bar staff need encouragement to serve alcohol! Entertainment - they try very hard. We had a super stay and…

column3: For families only and not for this time of the year
column4: We just came home from this trip. In general this hotel is good and the management as well as all the staff is very friendly and nice (as long as you dont come early for breakfast). BUT: This hotel is focused on Familie guests with Kids which means if you are just a couple and want to have a quiet space to relax or a quiet table at the dining room for a nice dinner (like we expected at the occcasion of a birthday) you have no chance at all. The Dining room is noisy ad crowded like a railway station. BUT: They have no heaters in dining room, bar and lobby. As the outside temperatur in the morning was 4 degrees and we had to eat with our winter coats on. Also we cought a heavy cold including fever and have to stay in bed now.

My husband and myself stayed here from 25th November for 14 nights. From arrival to departure we could not fault anything about this beautiful hotel. Upon our arrival reception staff were extremely pleasant and welcoming and we were checked in very efficiently and although our room wasn't ready (we arrived before normal check in time) we were shown through to the restaurant for lunch and we were greeted by the lovely Youseff who made us feel instantly welcome and from that minute we knew we were going to enjoy our stay at the hotel. After lunch we went to our room and were delighted with its location. Food was excellent and always a wide variety to choose from at all meal times and the deserts were delicious too! The service provided by all staff was exceptional at all…

column3: The perfect Christmas break from cold London
column4: I must say thank you for such a wonderful stay.  All of the staff and management made such a difference to our holiday in their own unique way, from running around relentlessly trying to find a lost phone, to picking up medicine from the pharmacy on their way to work, to spending time getting to know my family and forever making sure we are having the best time possible. Never have I stayed anywhere where all the staff are so caring and cooperative. Management clearly share an ethos which is; to go above and beyond - and this ethos filters right down to the frontline staff. The food is great and so carefully presented. In 9 days I believe the longest I queued for anything was 2 minutes. They do a good job at keeping on top of things so everything runs so seamlessly. Thank you…

column3: Not to be missed! Would definitely go back!
column4: We stayed at Iberostar Palmeraie Marrakech for 9 nights. We had three rooms, which were all in a row, two of them being interconnected, which made the stay even more comfortable. The staff did their upmost to meet our requirement, and they even upgraded our three rooms :). The atmosphere was calm and we rarely experienced any noise from outside our rooms. The garden view was very nice and gave us a refreshing and ideal experience. This hotel is very safe and secure. This hotel is ideal for every kind of break and stay, as it offers a wide range of activities for active kids and adults and also has an ideal environment for relaxation. It has a lovely garden and in addition a large green area with beautifully maintained plants and trees, including lemon-, orange and olive trees…

Stayed here for just under a week. Overall a great time. Staff was friendly and accommodating, rooms were always clean, wide selection of food at every meal. The shuttle was on time to the city and pleasant to use. The only critique was that the wifi in out room was spotty. Overall, great value, glad we chose this place.

My partner and I had a lovely anniversary here, the staff always went above and beyond for us, and the atmosphere was lovely. They even brought us a cake on our anniversary, and we had lovely towel displays left on our beds every night. We would definitely return in the summer, and make more use of amenities, such as the huge pools but it was abit cold this time of year to be expected! We would like to thank the hotel greatly for a lovely trip, and a special thanks to Momo, Amine, and the team :)

We arrived on Friday afternoon and were greeted by the very attentive friendly reception team who made our check in quick and hassle free. Just what's needed after an early morning start. Our room was spotless and very well kept during our stay with daily maid service. Throughout our stay the whole hotel team made our experience a really pleasant and memorable one. A special mention to Imran the manager who greeted us the first day to introduce himself and take the time to chat although very busy and throughout our stay always asked if we were ok and had everything we needed whenever he passed us. There is a wide variety of all inclusive drinks available and always at mealtimes something new to try. Delicious!! Not one single bad point can be said about this hotel and we will…

This hotel is absolutely immaculate. Everywhere we looked there seemed to be somebody cleaning something and there was always a delicate smell of incense in the main hotel areas. We received a very friendly welcome, and after lunch we were shown to our room which was spotless and well prepared with a poolside view. The grounds are extensive and again immaculate with at least six gardeners working at any given time. Several hotel cats and geese freely roam the grounds. The entertainments team are always on the go, gently encouraging guests to join in the activities but they are now way pushy or too 'in your face'. Even when it was raining, they adapted the days program to suit the weather. Mehdi in particular has boundless energy. He remembers everybody's name and always stops…

Stayed here first week in December for 4 nights with my husband and we both loved it, just wished it was for longer. The room was lovely and clean and overlooked the front garden with. The view from the balcony was amazing. We loved going for walks in the lovely garden area and relaxing by the pool listening to music in the background. The main reception area smelled beautiful, there were always activities going on and we loved the themed entertainment every night. The entertainment team were true professionals and very talented. During the day the staff were all cheerful, friendly and always stopped to say hello or chat. Special thanks to Khalil and Laila who joined us for lunch a few times and told us their stories and listened to ours. Also thanks to the other 2…

I visited this club to celebrate the first month of my baby with my husband in May 2017 :) The hotel is clean, the food is delicious and various. Our room was good too. I liked the pools and the activities the staff organise in there. It' s a good place for familily vacation. Especially that its located in the amazing city of marrakech ! I advise it !

column3: Last minute relaxing week away. Cats, geese, and beautiful gardens, even fun when it rained!
column4: I booked this holiday as a last minute relaxing getaway before Christmas and couldn't have been happier with the hotel. The room (garden view) was immaculately kept and I found it very comfortable. The bed was huge and comfortable, the bathroom large and well stocked, no bath but may be available in other rooms but large walk in shower. There was plenty of space to relax in the room if you wish with a sofa, desk, and chairs and table on a small patio/balcony with a view of the beautifully kept green gardens. Facilities included a large pool, smaller 'zen' pool, splash pool for the kids, extensive gardens with their own flock of geese, and plenty of outdoor seating areas. Plenty of activities on offer including boules, exercise area, darts, and even a trapeze! There were shows…

column3: A wonderful break at Club Palmeraie All Inclusive Hotel Marrakech
column4: I spent 5 nights at the hotel with my daughter and loved everything about it. The staff were so kind and attentive and all took time to learn our name providing a very personal touch. As we approached the bar for a tea each afternoon the bar staff welcomed us and already knew our favourite tea, and that we were a bit quirky and liked it in a big glass! The food in the buffet was excellent and the choices were so varied that no one would struggle to find a meal they enjoyed. The Moroccan choices were so tasty but we also made our own pasta dishes on some evenings, selecting what we wanted included and its cooked fresh. There was always a fish dish and pizza option as well. Wonderful salads and a carved meat option! All our drinks etc were included so I think it was…

column3: Excellent value and (when we visited) no kids!!!
column4: This is a great place just outside the city (about 20 mins) that has everything you need except, as we found all over Morocco, you don't get kettles/coffee/ tea in your rooms. The staff are excellent and very friendly and the food lovely with a huge selection. I also recommend the seperate Moroccan restaurant. The local beer is very nice and I suggest Casablanca as the best brand plus the local wines are very nice. The rooms are large and very comfortable and are kept spotlessly clean along with the whole site. There are a selection of sports to partake in like Boules or Archery and, what surprised me, there is a full size trapeze set up like in a circus. Have fun!

column3: Possibly the best hotel in the world
column4: Its difficult to describe how amazing this hotel is. you walk around the grounds you see fresh lime trees growing and olives on the trees. the entertainment teams are fantastic and make sure everyone joins in from all over the world, they are a fantastic team. you have Amine, a mischeivious little one always playing nice little tricks to keep you smiling and on your toes. you have a Kali a great young man who is always smiling and always looks out for you. Mo Mo always on hand to help you with your stay. youssef an inspirational young man who even through bouts of tooth ache was coming into work and looking after myself and my girlfriend youssef is an amazing person who we both have grown close too. the food here is amazing and always changes, the desserts are the best i have…

I visited this hotel with my friends for a birthday vacation. The hotel was able to provide us with all that we needed to the best of their ability. We had such a good time and enjoyed ourselves. The team/people who worked their were all amazing and treated us well. The staff included Salah, Flores and many others, just want to say a big thank you to all of them that made our trip great. The only thing that would need a look into would be the variation in the food menu. Other than that, everything was great. Would definitely go back! 💛

Loved this hotel, staff were great really friendly and helpful. Beautiful pools and grounds kept immaculate. Food was great in the buffet restaurant and the Moroccan restaurant was excellent. Shame you can only go here once. Accommodation was lovely and clean and stayed that way throughout our stay couldn’t fault the cleaning staff. Definitely go back here.

column3: Visited end of Nov to beg Dec
column4: This was our second visit to Marrakech, but this time we wanted a little bit more luxury and away from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. The Iberostar club palmeraie was perfect. Not too far away for the main centre (20 mins) (30 mins to Airport) and the hotel provided a free shuttle bus to the centre and has good times during the day where you can be dropped off and picked up. And not too far from the atlas mountains if you are planning to book an excursion to it. Best to book any excursion through Karima who is a tour operator based in the hotel and is there daily from 9-11:30, (she is part of thomas cook but anyone can book excursions not just thomas cook customers) Karima is excellent and our tour to the mountains which included a lunch was superb! The tour guide kamal…

After a shocking visit to another hotel, arriving at the Iberostar was like a breath of fresh air! We were welcomed personally by the duty manager and other members of staff, and our check-in process was quick and seamless. In hind-site I would recommend that reception discuss the process on how to obtain pool towels. You have to put down the deposit at reception in order to get a card which you then take to the sports building (by the Zen pool) where the card then gets swapped out for towels. This is only minor but would make getting your holiday started a little quicker. The room was incredibly clean with comfy beds, plenty of storage and a sweet balcony. The air con worked well (especially with the heating option which we did need in the evenings as it did get quite chilly…

column3: Incredible value for money and happy, well looked after staff
column4: The hotel is about 30 mins from town by taxi and is in a secluded and peaceful part of Marrakech. The hotel has all the facilities you might need, with excellent food and drink included. The rooms were comfortable, though we could have done with a better view, but didn't complain due to the low price paid. The outstanding feature of this hotel, however, is its staff. Every member of staff is friendly and happy to help. What I liked the most was that you saw the staff eating with guests in the restaurant, so on the surface of things they seem to be well looked after. Well done Iberostar! Cannot recommend highly enough, I hope to be back.

This is a really good hotel. The staff are very friendly and helpful and really can’t do enough for you. There is a very good variety of food on offer and we found the wine offered in the all inclusive package was perfectly acceptable. Our room was clean and spacious and very well kept by our lovely housekeeper. We had a problem with the key card not activating the electricity which was sorted very quickly. The gin and tonics in the bar varied in strength depending on who was serving them and the entertainment team worked really hard to keep everyone occupied. Things that needed improvement are as follows: The toaster available at breakfast was truly awful. It might sound minor but having to queue for ages to be able to make toast was not funny. I eat gluten free bread and it…

The staff really do make this hotel, without them it would not have been the great stay it was. They were amazing with our three year old daughter and they really made her feel welcome and made such an effort with her. She loved the dancers - she thinks they were Princesses and is their number one fan haha! The entertainment staff were fantastic and were somehow still cheerful and helpful even after what seemed to be long working days. They always seemed to be working from early until late! The bar and restaurant staff were lovely an they all gave fantastic service. Even the cleaning staff were great. One even came and cheered my daughter up when she was upset. The rooms were clean and good sized. Although they were quite noisy, on one night we were kept awake by loud music and…

column3: Good hotel for a short stay
column4: Firstly the room was lovely, quiet (apart from some other guests whose coming and going was a little loud - no fault of the hotel), spotlessly clean and very comfortable. The food and restaurant service was good with a great choice. The bar service was generally ok, a little slow on occasions when only one or two members of staff serving. Bar staff generally professional but maybe not as friendly as other areas. We didn't tend to drink the alcohol much (not large drinkers in any case so not really a problem). The cocktails were very sweet and not exciting. The wine was drinkable with a little dilution. Entertainment staff friendly and definitely tried to involve guests. The venue and timings for the entertainment was a little hit and miss whilst we were there. We really…

After a horrific stay at Eden Andalou and a terrible start to our holiday we decided to switch hotels, and it was the best thing we did. From the moment we arrived at the Iberostar the whole experience was excellent, we were greeted by the general manager instantly, served a welcome drink and welcomed by the guest relations manager and other members of staff. First impressions were great. However I would like to stress that these experiences from all members of staff continued for the duration of our trip. To sum it up: Lovely hotel Clean rooms Great choice at the all inclusive buffet Super staff Excellent facilities Love the food cart and recommend the strawberry pancakes Iberostar turned what started as an awful holiday into a great holiday. We relaxed and had a lovely…

I have just returned to the UK from a 4 nights all inclusive deal at the Iberostar Club Palmeraie Marrakech. Let me start by saying how much I loved this hotel. It is clean. The rooms are excellent. The restaurant / canteen which is a self-serve for breakfast, lunch and dinner offers a great variety of choices at every meal time and drinks galore to accompany them. What sets this hotel apart from a lot of hotels I have stayed in at various locations around the world is the staff. They are wonderful. Entertainment is laid on during the day and evenings by a motivated, engaged and friendly team who go out of their way to make you feel welcome. You can go spinning at 10am in the morning if you want to (I did). There are darts competitions, Many people relaxed and played petanque.…

A lovely hotel with amazing grounds, good food, excellent facilities, and made possible by the best, most friendly and accommodating staff that I've ever found in any hotel around the world. Having stayed in everything from bamboo shacks in Asia to 5 star hotels in Europe, Australia and America; Club iberostar staff are the best, they are there when you need them, always doing everything to make you feel relaxed, welcome, and at home. Many hotel make have great service but make you feel like you don't have space to breath, Club Iberostar has hundreds of staff yet you don't feel surrounded and like you can't even wipe your bum without someone sticking their head through the window. It was one of the best holidays I've had and would definitely go back.

Stayed here for a week on an all inclusive basis, The hotel is very clean, the staff are all very friendly and engaging, The food is delicious and plentiful although I would say that they predominantly cater for the French holidaymaker, ( if I see another crepe I might just go mad !) king prawn night was my favourite ! I have to add that the dessert chef needs some serious recognition, they were delicious, little cakes and chocolate mousse to die for .... they really need to make more of that array and not display it down at the back of the restaurant. The Moroccan local cuisine is delicious and very colourful although we didn’t eat in the Moroccan restaurant onsite. Considering it’s all inclusive the alcohol selection could do with a few additions, it really is a very…

column3: Nice resort and worth every penny
column4: A group of three of us (Americans) - two forty year olds and a 13 year old - stay here for three nights at Thanksgiving. We’ve stayed at all-inclusives before in the Caribbean (including an Iberostar) and this in no way compares to that. But, for a little over $35 a day per person, this place can’t be beat for the value. The rooms were very nicely appointed and clean, and the beds were comfortable. Food was (in typical Iberostar fashion) excellent. Drinks were hit and miss. Service was ok. Pools were nice, but not heated and a bit too chilly to enjoy in late November. Lots of activities and sports. Only real downsides were the distance from town (a good 25 minutes by car) and poor WiFi. Fortunately there is a shuttle that leaves to and from the resort to the Medina every hour or…

Hi, I went with a friend for a relaxing holiday this month for some sunshine and it was beautiful there and an absolute delight. Truly lovely staff who are extremely helpful and happy. My expectations were definitely exceeded over the ten days (7th to 17th). The food was very good, a great choice on offer beautifully presented, and as I am vegetarian there were ample dishes. There are relaxing stunning gardens, pools, a big pond, activities if you wish to partake, great shows - the dancing is amazing. It was good to do a bit of dancing during the afternoon at the classes too. The rooms were thoroughly cleaned, and very comfy. It does get a bit cold in the evening in November but rooms can be heated if you use the remote. I have rated my stay excellent because it honestly…

Booked this hotel last minute after seeing all the excellent reviews and we were not disappointed The hotel and grounds are beautiful and the staff are the best Imad you are the most professional, customer focused person we have met in the hotel industry making sure all your clients are happy a great asset to the company and the staff have been trained to an excellent standard as well Thank you for a wonderful time all of you

Great value all inclusive break, team everywhere seem to be on it and extremely helpful and friendly. Place is spotless , plentiful food with a wide range available. So no grumbles and happy to recommend

I've just returned from honeymoon at this wonderful hotel. It's a true oasis in the desert. Set in beautiful gardens about 25 minutes drive from the hussle and bustle of Marrakech, this is a perfect place to come and relax in the sun. I've never been to a hotel so well maintained. The rooms are spotless, and the hotel throughout from the bars, dining room and relaxation areas are all very clean. Even the bins around the grounds seem to be emptied every half hour. And, everywhere smells nice! The food is very good, and there's lots of choice. There's a different theme every night at the cooking station near the main dining room door. A handy tip - check outside for the BBQ, which seems to be every other night. We only found the BBQ by accident as it doesn't seem to be…

Just got back from a weeks honeymoon and it was the perfect place for us The weather was nice and warm the pool was cold tho! All of the staff were really friendly and could not do enough for you especially when they learnt it was our honeymoon... we walked back into our room and the 2 beds had been made into one bed with swan towels n petals, a bottle of bubbly plus lots more goodies- a really nice touch! The food was good and was always something to eat no matter how picky you are. The manager Imad spoke to us daily to ensure we were happy which we always were. The entertainment team were great and got us joining in with them which was good fun - even tho we don’t really speak French they made sure we understood! We also had an Arabic lesson! Would definitely recommend a…

column3: Well worth a visit and also many return visits
column4: Returned from this hotel a couple of weeks ago, having had a fabulous time. The staff and the extensive grounds really made this a great holiday. The entertainment staff are fantastic, really friendly and chatting to you, they remember who you are and ask if they can join you sometimes at mealtimes. We had several chats to Saber who was very entertaining and told us a lot about Morocco. I particularly want to mention the golf pro, Hassan, what a nice guy, and very good at teaching, amazing to be able to get free golf lessons in the sun! I think the hotel needs to buy you some new golf clubs though! He offered to arrange a game for me if I'd wanted to go to a local course but sadly I wasn't equipped this time around but next time I will take him up on the offer, he was very…

Have just returned from one week at this great resort.I have had a few holidays in my time but very few have lived up to this resort. The resort is verging on 4 Star premium luxury with very modern buildings and lush gardens with great facilities such as 3 pools for all ages and always very clean. The restaurant has many choices and changes menus every day the bars have a great selection of drinks. The management and staff were absolutely brilliant always had time to talk to us The guest relations manager Imad made us very welcome always asking if there was any more that could be done to make our stay more enjoyable.Mamado one of the Chefs who always had time to discuss the various Moroccan dishes which were fantastic. And a special thanks to Mohcine who looked after us at the…

I stayed for 3 nights with my mum. There was a quiet “zen” pool where we spent our days and a nice setting to eat and drink in the evenings. Food was mixed, some great some average, but huge choice and variety. Hotel is well catered for kids and has loads of activities for those that want a more active break. Perfect time of year to go in early October as wasn’t too busy. Shuttle bus into the centre of Marrakech was a great plus.

Dear sir/ madam I am writing this review as I feel that the staff that work in the hotel are very customer focused and I can tell that They are all trained to a high standard , Where I have seen the chefs briefing the waiters before service time , The Attention to detail is really good . I work in the hospitality industry as head chef in 5 star hotels back in the U.K. The food is of a very good standard and the variety is vast . All areas of the hotel are really clean , the grounds are well looked after ,the General manager must be applauded as each and every staff member Looks happy in there work and are keen to look after each and every customer. It’s hard to get consistent good comments from paying customers but when you look at the trip Adviser comments it’s pretty…

column3: Splendid hotel near beautiful Marrakech; upcoming star!
column4: Visited Marrakech and la Palmeraie before but this hotel was great. A great value for money and of course some things could be better but the most was absolutely very good.
