Big swimming pools, a lot of activities for everybody. And all the staff is doing their utmost to make you feel welcome. We especially loved Hassan from the golf with some golfclubs and balls he is doing everything to let you improve your play. A very small practice place but a lot of fun. We hope Hassan will have his dreamhole in short term so he can make his lessons even more interesting. Hassan you go for it! Some things that could be better, we think the zen pool could be al little bit more zen, it is a big pool and a lot of children were there because it is a bit warmer than the other pool. People…

What a lovely hotel. Fairly new. Very well maintained. Good sized rooms with decent en suite. Very good food with huge selection to suit all tastes and dietary requirements. The staff are absolutely lovely. Unfailingly polite and friendly. The 2 managers are superb. No request is too much trouble. I can’t recommend this hotel more highly.

Just spent 10 days here and found everything was to our liking, the hotel was spotless and the grounds were well manicured. There was a great selection of food available and drinks were always available. Every member of staff were so helpful and nothing was too much trouble . The weather was wonderful with a average temperature of 32 degrees.. I would certainly recommend the hotel. There was always something going on and again the staff worked so hard to please everyone. Very satisfied couple Pete and Fran

Went as a family of 4 ,all adults for some winter sun. Lovely hotel all staff very friendly especially Imad who I think was the manager. He was very helpful on arrival and always chatted to us if he was passing - an asset to the hotel. Free bus to centre which was about 25 mins away . Somethings to be aware of - when you get off the bus taxi drivers plague you. I made the mistake thinking they were linked to the hotel and once you start talking to them it's hard to shrug them off. Also be careful visiting the tanneries, a lot of people indicating which is the correct way to go and then following you . The place is like a maze and it was quite unsettling. You must however visit the souks an amazing experience and I didn't find the sellers too pushy just great entertaiment. Also…

column3: Class hotel with a highly recommended stay
column4: I checked in on the 31/10, I went with my friend and greeted very well by reception and Mo (concierge)who gave me the low down about the hotel and area, the room was vey quiet which I asked for being a light sleeper, the room was very modern and looked great which was clean and cleaned everyday where you can see the maids work very hard. This hotel has something for everyone I'm talking bowls, spin class, football, golf, stretching class, a gym and a trapeze. This hotel has 2 pools,a quiet pool where you can chill and the the busy pool where you can get Involved with the activity team yusef, jalil, Tariq and Khalid which do a great job, the all inclusive was a great selection breakfast being my favourite by far but plenty of choice for everyone for lunch and dinner( tajine is a…

We arrived on 31st October, 2017 with our 7 year old grandchild. She was so excited to arrive at 8pm and was told there was a Halloween Party at 9pm!! We didn't expect that! We were shown to our room by a lovely man, after a quick check in. Sorry... I've forgot his name. He also waited to show us to the dining room. The dining room was decorated amazingly for Halloween. Staff were in brilliant costumes. Then we went to the party by the pool. An amazing night! We had an amazing nights sleep. The room was spotlessly clean. Beds were so comfortable! We even had dressing gown and slippers provided. The bathroom was very large. Walk in power shower and all toiletries provided. The next day, we awoke to brilliant hot sunshine....not bad for November!! 3 pools. One was a splash pool…

column3: Great holiday, amazing service, incredible sports facilities, great value for money
column4: My teen boys and I stayed here for a week in September and thoroughly enjoyed it! We booked directly with the hotel and paid less than any web price that I could find. A half hour cab ride from the airport (entertaining in itself!), we arrived at the hotel to be very warmly greeted by staff who remembered our names all week and for whom nothing was too much trouble. Rooms were clean and a decent size, with the only downside being something of a sewer smell from the block on a couple of occasions. Food was good and far better than we expected, although compared to some all-inclusives the variety was a little limited - although my teens were always happy! Sports facilities are BRILLIANT and we played football and tennis every day. Group football was not brilliantly organised but…

A short distance from the airport and away from the hustle and bustle of the Medina, this hotel is a quiet and relaxing oasis in Marrakech. The aesthetics of the hotel are quintessentially Moroccan and are very photogenic. The hotel grounds are spotless and the gardens are stunning. The food is spectacular and some of the best we have had in a hotel. The staff seem to really love working there, are so polite and want you to have an amazing stay. For Halloween, the entire hotel was decorated, the food was themed and the staff all dressed up in costumes. The main issue we experienced was trying to sleep with our one year old, as the music from the entertainment could be heard until late. We were also awoken very early by the call to prayer from the nearby mosque on multiple…

We were impressed with this hotel from the outset. On arrival we were greeted with friendly faces, undivided attention and good seamless checking in. We had booked less than 48 hours before travelling and had asked for a double room but when we were shown to our room it had 2 single beds. We told this to the man who had taken our bags up and after briefly speaking to reception our bed was changed to a large double. Every member of staff, every day, from the chamber maid to the manager(s) greeted us with a smile and nothing was ever too much trouble. The room was spotlessly clean and the linen and the towels were changed as and when you requested them to be changed, which for me is a plus as so many hotels waste valuable resources washing linen daily when it isn't always…

We've been staying at the resort on the last week of October. As soon as we arrived at the hotel, all the staff had been very welcoming and especially one of the managers, Imad that has been completely helpful and friendly for all our stay. The resort incredibly clean, well organised and beautiful. Food is very good. Our taxi driver, Tariq that accompanied us to a trip in Essaouira and around the city, has been amazing with us, friendly, very accommodating and honestly, very professional! The journey was very pleasant, fun and with loads of party music in his car that almost seemed to be in a club 😂. Great people, all of them. They made me feel like at home. This resort deserves 5 star!

The hotel is about a 15 minute drive from Marrakech city and occupies well maintained large ground plot. On arrival the hotel staff greet you - they are all excellent and friendly and sort out any problem or difficulty immediately, in particular the guest relations manager Elkhaoudari Imad. The hotel is well maintained with lovely entrance lobby, rooms etc. An example of solving a problem was the low shower pressure in the room on arrival. I reported this to the lobby desk and it was immediately repaired. The hotel has 3 pools - a very large pool for games and exercises etc, a children's pool with a rather fascinating barrel tipping shower and a 'quiet'' pool with a bar. We spent much of our time at the 'quiet' pool sunbathing (in temperatures of up to 37C, high for October)…

When you read reviews sometimes you think the people's personality might bias their review, all the reviews on here currently are true! This hotel is truly fabulous there isn't a single thing that I could complain about. The service from as soon as you arrive is excellent, the customer service advisor for the hotel memorises everyone's names and makes you feel extra welcome. We were quickly shown to our bedroom, it was our anniversary so we had champagne, cake, fruit, and two robes waiting for us (on the house) The cleanliness of the room and hotel couldn't have been any better! There were no worries of hygiene in the restaurants. I would say that spoons needs to be laid out onto the tables and more seating outside provided, this was half term and the hotel wasn't at full…

Amazing hotel, amazing staff and an incredible entertaimments team. Loved our waterpolo and aquafit! Really is something for everyone. Would definitely go back. The weather was great... oh did i mention the amazing entertainment team... 😁

Amazing staff, different options of food everyday, good environment. Animation team is incredible, always making sure that we are enjoying our holidays. Manager is really attentive and made us feel very welcome. Aquagym is a very good option, very funny. Absolutely enjoyed and recommend this hotel, will go back for sure. 🙌

From start to finish amazing! Service great, good quality drinks, shame they provide water in plastic bottles which from an environmental point of view seemed a shame, would prefer water coolers. Food included lobster and prawns! Huge choice! Rooms clean and fresh and cleaned everyday. We were upgraded when arrived and had champagne given to us for a birthday! Wine and beer of a fair quality considering where you are! Free shuttle bus in and out of Marrakesh which is great, please use it as it's such a shame to not experience Marrakesh! Guest relation manager was fab, knew everyone's name and was on hand every day if you had any queries! Didn't use the entertainment team as we were a couple just relaxing! Great pools.

We would normally stay in 5 star hotels when travelling but decided to try here because of the great reviews- therefore we feel we have good experience to compare this with many other hotels across the globe. We should also say that we came here during half term holidays and so it was packed with families! People who had been here the week before told us how much quieter it had been before! Pros: - greeted with cold drink upon arrival - excellent choice of food at mealtime - some freshly cooked as you watch - very clean and well maintained hotel and grounds - helpful and friendly staff - decent entertainment (mainly in French!) - plenty of activities during the day if you want to partake - weather in 30s every day - 3 pools with lots of sun beds Cons: - upon arrival…

The hotel staff are extremely friendly and smiley. The room and hotel was very clean, bed was comfy with nice clean linen. Bathroom and shower were good. Spa treatments were excellent and I would deff recommend the hot stone massage. The food was nice, plenty of choice so you'll find something you like. Drinks were very sweet, I stuck with beer and gin. The on site Moroccan restaurant was disappointing, the food had no flavor.

column3: I shouldn't be telling you this
column4: Just back from one of the best hotels that I have stayed at with my wife and 12 year old daughter , no its not the most plush no its not the most outlandish , hasn't got the biggest facade . But what it has got are - Great staff , Great management which work in harmony to make your stay here the best as it can be. Best advise I can give you is take a deep breath you have arrived and enjoy this oasis in the desert , its far enough away from the city centre so theres no hustle and bustle to worry about , city centre is about 15 - 20 minutes away from this resort , hotel has its own shuttle if you wish to go into marrakech . For a week away its just what the soul needs , there is not a single thing that I can say I didn't like . The rooms are lovely and modern ,flat screen TV…

column3: Wonderful family holiday - perfect in every way!
column4: We stayed for 6 nights during October half term with our children ages 10 and 11. We were given a lovely welcome when we arrived by Imad and were shown to our room but it was clear it wasn't the family room we had booked. Without any fuss, Imad invited us to go for lunch whilst another room was made available for us. Our room was in the main hotel building and perfect! Beautifully clean, spacious, and very comfortable. The bathroom was in great decorative order, spotless and with a powerful shower with no shortage of hot water. The daily housekeeping was excellent. The layout of the grounds is really well thought out. Great main pool (which we used) Zen pool for couples/people without children and a kids pool. The gardens are well tended and everything is clean and tidy. There…

Myself and my partner stayed at the Iberostar for a week in mid-October, and I can honestly say this is the best hotel I've ever stayed in. From the moment we arrived, late at night, we were greeted warmly by Imad, the guest relations manager, with lovely drinks on our arrival. First off, the rooms are beautiful. Tastefully decorated, spacious, and above all SPOTLESS. The whole hotel is absolutely immaculate, from the gardens, pools, lobby areas and the restaurants. Even after a sandstorm, all traces of dust had been cleared away in 10 minutes! The pool areas are lovely, we spent all our time at the main pool, with a great fun atmosphere, but plenty of sunbeds and such a big pool that you never felt crowded. The food was delicious, at every meal, with a great variety of…

Everything about this hotel is amazing. Beautiful grounds, very clean, plenty to do (or not if you prefer). Entertainment team work really hard to make sure you have a good time especially around the main pool, if you prefer it a little more laid back then try the quiet pool which has it's own bar area. Staff are so friendly you feel like you have known them for ages & most speak very good english. Food is good but can get repetitive, however there is so much choice you can always find something to eat. We came here to celebrate our wedding anniversary & Imad the manager kindly arranged some flowers for my wife (which were amazing value at approximately £10 for 36 red roses) and when we arrived back at our room there was a cake, fruit plate, sparkling wine & a fantastic pair of…

We were a family of two adults and two children, we arrived quickly from the airport to the hotel only took about 15 minutes . We were sat down with drinks and filled in arrival forms only to be told they didn't have our booking!! Booked with travel republic and had all the paperwork. Receptionist told me I had to speak to them and rang the number for me. I couldn't sort it and was getting very frustrated as I've never had this problem before. The assistant manager finally took over and said they will sort it for me but had to take £300 deposit until it was sorted and showed us to our room which was amazing. The booking problem was not the hotels fault it was travel republic but was sorted out the next day , the management came to find us the next day to tell us all was now ok.…

Impressed with this hotel from the moment we arrived, greeted by lovely staff who checked us in quickly and we enjoyed a nice drink on our arrival. Our room 2161 was great near to the adults only pool which was ideal for us. the bathroom had a large walk in shower with conventional shower head and rain shower head which was lovely, there was also a good selection of complimentary toiletries. The beds were firm but very comfortable with additional pillows and blankets available. We had a small balcony with comfortable chairs and table and a drying rack which was handy for bathing costumes and towels The air conditioning was very adjustable and we were able to adjust it so it cooled the room without blasting out cold air and without the noise which was nice at night Housekeeping…

Stayed here as a family for 10 days. From the moment we arrived the service was amazing. All the members of staff knew our names and remembered our drinks etc. The rooms are very clean, fresh towels every day. The daily activities are fun, we enjoyed the trapeze and aqua gym/ aqua polo each day. The food was really good and fresh, we enjoyed the BBQ and theme nights. Big shout out to the guys at the food truck, they work hard all day. The girls in the kids club are amazing my daughter wanted to stay! The anination team work so hard and work long hours. The management need to appreciate them and increase their wages as without them the hotel would not be as good!! Special thanks to Momo, Amine, Nazir, Walid, Sali, Sara and Muraud at the trapeze Look forward to seeing…

We spent five days at this hotel and had a brilliant time. As a normally adventurous family, we were quite happy to spend almost all our time in Marrakech in the hotel, and that speaks volumes! The first point that made this such a great experience was all the extremely friendly and welcoming staff, from the team at reception to everyone working in the restaurant to house keeping. We were always greeted warmly and “no” was never an answer. The managers even spent half an hour of their busy day answering my questions on plastic waste! The rooms were clean and beds really comfortable. The hotel itself was maintained really well with great gardens. Wifi was good too. The hotel provides a complimentary shuttle into town, this was really convenient and ran a few times during the…

My partner and our 9 year old daughter Charlotte had a wonderful 9 nights stay at this hotel. I could not fault any aspect of our stay and the staff were really friendly, spotlessly clean rooms and all around the hotel. Comfortable rooms and the free coach to the city was ideal. Above all, the food was tremendous and the only down side being the amount of weight we put on whilst there :). Thank you to everyone who helped make this such a fantastic holiday for our family. I would definitely recommend this hotel for couples and families with young children.

Doing anything great is about doing lots of little things as well as you can and striving for excellence and this hotel has this concept nailed, we loved it! From the moment we arrived we were made to feel welcome and I can honestly say that didn’t change for a single moment in our whole weeks visit. I’ll have to be honest, I’d read a lot of reviews and I’d worried that either the staff would be too in your face or that perhaps some of the reviews were too good to be true, neither of those could be further from the truth. We like to be left to it and the staff respected that but they checked every now and then if we needed anything, perfect for us. You could see other customers who’s needs were greater and the level of personal service available was outstanding. The rooms…

I have been 2 weeks ago at Iberostar Marrakech and just have to say amazing things. The hotel is stunning, good facilities, a good variety of food, the staff just amazing. Really recommend this hotel to everyone. It is not in the city centre but has a free shuttle service. Very good for couples, families, or even single travellers. have to give a big thanks to the animation team, reception and bar team. You guys rock, keep going on the good job.

We decided to book our stay in Marrakech at the Iberostar because of the glowing reviews the hotel has received and it lived up to our expectations, AND MORE!!! We have loved everything about our stay and it is definitely the perfect hotel for couples and families alike! The staff cannot do more for you! They care so much about their jobs and custom more than any other hotel establishment we have ever visited. Big GIANT thank you to all the staff but especially to Imad for checking up on us daily and asking if there is anything else they could do for us. The animation team are fab, Momo, Walid and Amine we’re so welcoming and even changed the show of the evening and put kareoke on again for me to have another sing on our last night! Just lovely. Rooms are cleaned daily to…

I returned yesterday from a fantastic 5 day holiday with dear friends. The hotel was so well kept and beautifully lit up in the evening with terracotta lamps dotted everywhere. The food was amazing and freshly cooked with a brilliant selection for all tastes. The cocktails were yummy especially the Pinacoladas . The staff are very friendly and the rooms are cleaned beautifully every day. We are hoping to return again next year if possible as such a wonderful place to stay for all ages.

column3: Excellent facilities, great staff - an all round great family holiday!
column4: Just back home after a 5 night stay at the Iberostar (family of three). Like the majority of the reviews on this site, we had the most wonderful stay. The hotel grounds and facilities are super, with various activities to keep you entertained throughout your stay (tennis courts, ping-pong tables, a football pitch etc). There are three swimming pools, which include a slightly more quiet one for those wanting to stay away from music and one for the young kinds. In regards to the food, there was ample choice with a slight variety each night - they tried to mix it up some nights with an outside barbecue, while there is also another Moroccan restaurant in the hotel which you can use once during your stay. Mainly though, the reason the hotel is so great and many return is due to the…

Have just had a 5 day break at this hotel. Absolutely loved it. The grounds are beautiful and so well kept. The staff go out of their way to make you feel welcome and nothing is too much trouble. The entertainment team work really hard but they aren't pushy if you don't want to join in. The food is fantastic with regular BBQ's. The welcome party with champagne and canapés was a lovely surprise. Rooms are bright, spacious and clean. Highly recommended.

Just back from short break at this hotel . Echo what most people say about the hotel. The hotel and grounds are spotless . The food in the buffet area is of a good standard but does become quite repetitive when eating afternoon and evening. They do their best to vary it with BBQs etc. We were disappointed with the a la carte restaurant. No menu and no choice of starters only 2 choices for main. We weren’t aware what we were eating and felt the whole experience was rushed. Spent less time in that restaurant than in Buffet one. The hotel is in the middle of no where but okay for a few days break. There is plenty of activities at the hotel for all ages eg archery , trapeze, tennis, the usual volleyball and football. The nighttime entertainment was mixed however when there was a…

Firstly i'll start by saying i'm a frequent traveller and have stayed in a good number of 'all inclusive' hotels across the world and unfortunatly this hotel is at the very bottom of my list. I'll start with the positives, it's clean and lush gardens. Yes that's correct that's it! Now for the reality i'm some would describe as a youg 40 year old and my first impressions when i walked to the poolside on day one was it had the ambience of a retiement home or maybe even a hospice and yes i kid you not. The hotel is in the middle of nowhere and if you want to buy a packet of fags then be prepared to jump in a taxi and pay £20 return for the pleasure to buy a pack of fags or just to visit a local shop for that matter. The wasp and fly problem is horrendous make sure you pack a…

column3: Wonderful holiday with my husband- best hotel ever!!
column4: What can I say that hasn't already been said? This hotel is absolutely wonderful. I went for a week with mu husband and it just wasn't long enough. We sometimes struggle with the food as we are vegetarians, but not here. There was loads of choice. The cocktails and drinks were fab, the bar staff were wonderful, and the animation team were just fantastic. They were so funny and engaging, they made the hotel. All the staff, the domestics, the waiters, the reception staff. Everyone at this hotel is happy, helpful and polite. We loved it so much we have booked to go back in January 2018! This is the best hotel I have ever stayed in, anywhere in the world. One thing- the food can sometimes be a little cold, there is a microwave but its not by a plug, maybe just plug that in. I…

We are a family of 4 (including 2 teenagers). Only had 7 days for this holiday and we chose Iberostar Club after reading wonderful reviews on Tripadvisor especially after the complete renovations of this hotel in March. We were not disappointed at all. We arrived mid afternoon to be greeted by the GR manager very friendly reception staff who took all our details offered us some fresh orange juice and told us all about the hotel, although we were early before their check in time, we had our room ready. The rooms were both very clean, spacious with a big bathroom and sofa to relax on as well as plenty of towels and extra pillows and covers. In all honesty the hotel is a standard 4 star all inclusive with ample activities to keep all ages occupied. The best things about this…

Just spent a week at the hotel staff couldn't do enough for you everything was well looked after and spotlessly clean. The food was great with lots of choice. Will definitely go back again. If you want an activity holiday this is the place as there is always something going on and the sports facilities are really good.

We were greeted by the customer relations manager, who provided us with a drink. Although we had arrived two hours early to check in, the hotel made our room available within the hour, 1pm. The room was large and spotlessly clean with good sized bathroom and good air con, which remained on even when we went out, free safety deposit provide, no tea of coffee provision however. The hotel grounds were spotless and the gardens well manicured. The pools and surrounding sun decks were ample and never seemed that busy. Pool bar, Zen had a good amount of comfy seating some of which was shaded, Bouchra the bar maid was excellent and always served us with a smile. Lots of daytime activities were available from the animation team who all seemed very happy to be working there and did their…

Amazing time,food,staffs all so lovely as well as the surroundings and to go with all the the weather! We didn’t want to leave. Forget about the Spa that it’s not connected to the hotel and a complete waste of money.

First things first, this hotel is wonderful!! We arrived on a tuesday around 12pm via private taxi from the airport (approx 30 min drive away). On arrival we were greeted by the lovely manager with glasses of juice and all the standard paperwork/wrist bands. Check in was not until 3/4pm but we could go straight through to have lunch and go to the pool, out bags where kept in the secure luggage room in reception. Later on our bags were taken to our room which was lovely and had everything we needed, close to the quiet pool. The hotel also has a busy pool with entertainers and music playing and a kids pool with slides. There are quite alot of wasps around the pools trying to get to the drinks but if you keep your drink covered then they tend to leave you alone. We went dune…

column3: Jean H Beautiful Hotel, excellent and extremely helpful staff.
column4: We spent five days here would have liked one weeek as it was so nice. From the moment we arrived and was greeted by Ikram on reception the staff never failed us with politeness and nothing was to much trouble for them, always happy. A special mention also to Youssef on the childrens pool for his kind attention to us, lovely man. Also Rachida in the dining room, had a lovely greeting for us, beautiful smile. Hotel was spotless, food was good, plenty of seating areas for getting out of the sun, did not realise it was still going to be that hot. I also would comment on the small amount of spirits and liqueurs, we even tried to buy them one evening but they were not available. All said and done lovely hotel, had a brillant holiday.

I have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Iberostar Club Palmeraie Marrakech. Four "girls" had a lovely time. Food was good and the hotel itself was lovely and was kept very clean. The highlight was the staff; they all had a smile and an acknowledgement as they passed you. Must give special accolades to: Youssef who was working in the children's pool. As soon as we arrive he did everything to make us comfortable and alway with a big smile - what a star! Also, Rachida on reception who did so much to help us as we were sorting out taxi pick ups and other things. Ikram in the dining room always had a smile and a big kiss and attended us so promptly. Our one gripe was the small range of spirits and liqueurs. Overall though it was a good hotel and we had no other…

We have just returned from a 10 day break at this hotel. We have visited several other Iberostar venues so had a certain level of expectation. I am happy to say we were not disappointed. It is on a fantastic plot of land offering so many options on how to spend your day from the tennis courts to trapeze. It has 3 pools, kids, main pool and quiet pool which was the one we decided on. The Staff are fantastic from the pool bar lady to the manager Mr Waleed, who seemed to be available 24-7. The buffet is first class with a huge variation at every sitting. I thought that they could have made more of the Moroccan a la carte as it was only available on limited nights and only a third full when we visited it. This was the only slight disappointment on an otherwise great holiday.

column3: Couldn't have wished for a better replacement
column4: We were supposed to be going to Cuba but the hurricane put paid to that . We searched and searched and could only find this hotel with any availability . What a find the place was excellent , food was very good and plentiful , and the staff were out of this world very polite and helpful . I could name a few but there would be too many they all made my holiday very enjoyable and made me feel so welcome . Even the managers were out amongst the punters . The entertainment team were fabulous and all the mealtime staff were amazing . Room cleaned every day and fresh towels couldn't have wished for a better replacement holiday . A big thank you to everyone involved and everyone we met while there love you all and see you again soon again thankyou

We arrived on a sunday around lunch time. Our room was not ready and so we were shown to the restaurant for lunch. After finishing, the room was ready and our luggage was taken to the room by a porter who showed us the way also. The room was spotless, well laid out and well maintained although the 'all rooms have a pool, garden or mountain view' was a little bit of a let down as we had 2 trees, a constantly barking dog on land next door and a main road! The food is varied, there's a choice for everyone and I especially loved the specials area which changed each meal time. I would say though that staff should be aware that not everyone wants a 'snotty egg' and flipping it and taking it off the grill doesn't then mean it's cooked. I was huffed at and eyes rolled when I asked for…

column3: The staff make this hotel amazing
column4: We have stayed at many hotels around the world but the staff at this hotel were the friendliest we have ever met. From the cleaners to the bar staff, to the animation crew to the managers they all deserve a big thank u for making our holiday so special. We very rarely return to the same hotel again but I do think we will be back. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the food is varied with a good variety of both non and alcoholic drinks. I would like to say a big thank you to the animation team who were amazingly brilliant and very funny and friendly. Special thanks to Sali, Nazier and Mohammed. This hotel definitely warrants a 5 rating but I would like to point out something that the management should address. On day 2 of our 10 day holiday whilst catching the hotel shuttle bus…

Food - the buffet was great for breakfast, lunch & supper, food was really varied and plenty of choice with different specialties every night. Seafood night was one of the best, along with fantastic paella and fiduea also! The food in the Moroccan restaurant is definitely an experience not to miss out on, so make sure you book this in with reception on arrival to avoid disappointment. The food truck by the pool was great with burgers, sandwiches, waffles & pancakes to keep you going during the day - manned by Mustapa and the team who were amazing! Hotel - plenty of space in the room and they were left spotless every day, super helpful and friendly staff everywhere. The entertainment team had so much energy and constantly running activities around the pool. Tennis, golf,…

My husband and I stayed here for a week and loved every minute! Every aspect of the hotel is spotless. Rooms are good size, well maintained and comfortable. 3 pools, again, all very clean. We spent time at the Zen pool, which is very quiet and relaxing, and at the main pool, which had the fantastic animation team working extremely hard all day! All of the animation team are fantastic, each very kind and friendly, brilliant sense of humour, very good English, but above all, they seemed to enjoy themselves too! The bar staff too, were very friendly, each remembered our drinks order and would carry out to our tables for us. those who struggled slightly with English, quickly apologised and found someone to help them. Food was good, always plenty of choice and enough. I've…

Stayed here the middle of September as a couple,we really could not fault any of the services offered at the hotel. The room was spacious very clean and well appointed, the balcony although quite small was adequate for our requirements, the restaurant was offering a very extensive variety of food and self service drinks although waiter service is available. The quality of alcoholic drinks was good as was the service often drinks ready for you at the bar of brought to your table. There are three pools one activity pool where te animators are based one quiet pool and a children's lagoon type pool with a few water park type amusements all are very well maintained, there were always sunbed availability and virtually no 06.00 am towel reservists which made the whole experience…

We are on our final day here at Iberostar Marrakesh and the hotel is the best that I have ever been to. The value for money is outstanding . We arrived at the hotel at around 11am and we were given an early check in without hesitation. When we arrived we were a little unsure on how to programme the safe so we asked the reception and somebody was at our room in a matter of minutes. The WIFI signal is excellent in the rooms (good enough to stream English television). We actually forgot our plug adaptors and within an hour the lady at reception had managed to get hold of one for us. The beds are very comfortable and the shower is lovely and warm. The hotel is absolutely spotless and the staff are always working very hard to make the hotel look beautiful. Even the room cleaners stop…

The hotel manager was imad and he was excellent in every aspect. The hotel staff are amazing and the rooms are lovely with small balcony but lovely sunset views. The pools are clean and the entertainment is nightly at 10pm with great dancers. Weather was fab at 40oc and the hotel offers a free bus to marrakech. Once again Imad was amazing remembering the customers names we couldn't fault this hotel and it's all the running of imad. Free fridge and free safe.

This hotel was a pleasant surprise, beautifully kept and very clean. The staff really make this hotel, they're very friendly and always happy to help and are a credit to this hotel. The food was better than expected from a mid range all inclusive. I opt for the Tagines and you'll be very happy. The only thing missing for me would be the lack of tea/coffee making facilities in the room.

2nd time staying at this hotel and definitely just as good the second time around :) Arrived at the hotel early before usual check in time and we were able to get to our room almost straight away. All staff are really friendly and welcoming and the rooms and hotel grounds are really clean. Food and drinks are also really good with a nice variety so you don't get bored throughout the stay. Best thing about this hotel has to be its animation team - a special mention for Amine and Momo who were so friendly throughout our stay and encouraged us to join in with lots of activities throughout the day which really made our holiday special so thank you to these 2 amazing members of staff. Iberostar is lucky to have them. Evening shows are also good fun, especially the after show…

Pros: beautiful grounds and clean rooms Some staff is so sweet and friendly Good food Moroccan restaurant that you can go to only one time during your stay is awesome / beautiful BUT you can only go there one time and your only other option is buffet of mad house daily Cons: First room smelled like sewer we had to switch rooms as it was unbearable First day there was a guy who verbally attacked us accusing us of stealing his towel , then attacked person next to us... which gets to next problem our towels were stolen later that day. They charge 100 dirham per towel which apparently makes them gold, kind of ridiculous when you have to watch your towel like something of value... So we problem solved and went to the other pool which is heated but apparently our kids ( who are…

We have been to this hotel 3 times and this is primarily driven by the amazing hotel staff and in particular the animation team. All the staff are friendly and make you feel so welcome its easy to settle quickly into a relaxing holiday. Iberostar have bought the rooms and main restaurant into modern day which was needed and made some great additions like the food truck and childrens pool Special mention goes to our animation friends who we shared so much laughter with - Amine, Fati, Walid, Sali and Nezar (very talented dancer and choreographer) - they are a very special team and Ibersostar are lucky to have them My 2 suggestions for the hotel would be - review check in process to speed it up and suggest Abdel the animation manager learns more English Thanks to all the team for…

We stayed here from 11-18th September 2017. Beautiful hotel which was spotlessly clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful at all times. The animation team were amazing, always happy and polite. Nothing was too much for them. Upon arriving you need to pay your tourist tax. We paid 417 Dirham for 3 people for a 7 night stay (about £11.50 per person for 7 nights) we also paid 100 Dirham to hire a beach towel, this is refunded at the end of the holiday when you return the towel. (You can change the towel for a clean one at any time). Cocktails were ok depending on who made them. Food was varied and in abundance. Lobster, steak, lamb, king prawns & chicken, it was on the menu. Chocolate fountain with fruit kebabs, cakes, ice cream, cheese and crackers for afters. At lunch you…

We stayed at this resort in June this year and had such an amazing holiday. The hotel itself is immaculately clean and beautiful. It is set in expansive grounds with plenty of places to recline with a drink and relax. My partner and I am more likely to sit by the pool and read a book than take part in the daily pool activities; so the 'quiet pool' was our preferred place to lounge. There are ample sun loungers and shaded areas to take a break from the sun. In addition, freshly made juices and drinks are bought around regularly to keep hydration levels up which is an absolute must in the sun. The staff of the hotel are a credit to the establishment and in particular the kind customer relations manager who outstandingly remembered all guests names. The staff were friendly and…

I have just come back from holiday with my dad and little sister. We have had an excellent time at this hotel. Everything was really good. there was lots of things to do from pool games, trapeze, tennis, belly dancing and much more. The people who work at the hotel are amazing, especially Sali! Sali became one of our best friends! She said hello to us every day and taught us belly dancing. She was so kind and made our holiday excellent. We hope one day we can go back to this hotel and see Sali again :)

Amazing hotel and hospitality if your looking for a wonderful holiday sunshine entertainment and relaxation this is the place to visit staff wonderful helpful and friendly yes your not in the centre of Marrakesh but there is a free bus into town really don't want to go home. Animation team star friends are wonderful and the dance team amazing costumes dance music throughly entertained for my 10 day visit. House keeping fantastic food amazing and plentiful come enjoy yourself guaranteed 😍

We stayed at this resort for a week in the last week of August. It was a good experience. Have to say that the staff at this resort works very hard. Kudos to them. We were greeted by Ikram and Imad on arrival and it was a very warm welcome. Imad is very friendly and always in a courteous mood to keep the guests comfortable. If I have to pick something I would state the following. Should not be seen as something against the resort, but more as some areas for improvement. a) The activity program and schedule could be advertised a bit more. Perhaps give a copy or specifically mention it when checking in. b) Food is good and a lot to choose from… but still, after the 4th day, it would become a bit monotonic so some more rotation may help. The decor ninth restaurant can also be…

I would like to start by saying this is by far the BEST hotel I have ever stayed in! Not only was this hotel beautiful the staff here were outstanding! Firstly I would like to say a huge thank you to the manager Imad, you really take the time to get to know your guests and help them with any queries, you go above and beyond to interact with all guests on a personal level and ensure you remember each guest by name. This is truly outstanding and i personally felt very welcome. Imad also moved my hotel room to ensure I was next to family members also staying in the hotel, this just goes to show how much effort these guys put in to ensuring you have the best experience. All of the other staff again were outstanding. Staff here are very helpful and friendly and again take the time…

We went on a group holiday to Iberostar Club Palmerie for one week in September 2017. The hotel staff were friendly and approachable at all times and they could not do enough for you. The hotel manager Imad was very welcoming and was pleased to help with any queries we had throughout the week, he was also very accommodating in arranging rooms nearby the rest of our party. The bar staff (particularly Mohammed and Yassine) were friendly and always smiling and nothing seemed to be too much trouble for them, they really made our time in the bar comfortable. The entertainmet staff were on hand all day and night to ensure we were all having a good time, they arranged activities throughout the day and really worked hard to ensure all the guests were getting involved and having a good…

column3: Amazing experience thanks to the staff and facilities!
column4: The hotel was spotless from top to bottom, the food was varied and all very well cooked and served with a smile! Including the poolside food truck (thanks mustafa!) The pools were clean and had plenty of things to do surrounding it, and if you prefer the quiet life then check out the Zen pool and bar for a more relaxed atmosphere. I need to shout out Imad, the hotel manager who was always around to help with anything you can throw at him! Also the bar staff (mohamed, yassine and all the others!) Were beyond friendly and really made me and my family feel at home. The star friends (animation team) were brilliant all week (shout out to sali, amine and naisar) getting everyone up and involved, answering any questions and making us feel at home once again. The entertainment was out…

This hotel was outstanding from the minute we checked in & provided connecting rooms when we asked. Room/grounds- the grounds are beautiful with huge gardens & 3 pools which cater to every taste. A zen pool with a bar, cabanas, & lots of seating areas. The main pool which was close to the bar, seating areas, food truck, & daily BBQ' s where there were often activities such as polo, aerobics, foam parties, professional dancers etc throughout the day & a kids pool. The gardens are huge & immaculate, they are truly the nicest hotel grounds I have ever seen. The rooms are beautiful and, spacious and are immaculately cleaned each day. The cleaning staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Our air conditioning broke during the night & when we notified reception, it was fixed within…

My family and i visited the Iberostar Club Palmerie Marrakech Hotel from 31st August to 7th September 2017. We read all of the previous reviews and were really happy with all of the positive reviews given. When we arrived late in the evening about 09:45pm the receptionist made sure we went to the restaurant to eat before checking us in as the restaurant stopped serving at 10:00pm. Everyone we met who was employed by the hotel were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble for them. The hotel and all of its amenities were spotlessly clean, from the rooms to the restaurants to the pools, absolutely superb you could not fault it in any way. The food that is served in the restaurant is obviously Moroccan biased, but still very nice with a wide selection at every mealtime,…

Being a travel agent I have to say I am extremely picky with the hotels I visit and a lot of research goes into the holiday before I book. I can only describe this hotel as the BEST of the best hotels we have visited. We arrived around 21.30 at the hotel to be greeted by the friendly reception staff who advised us to go to the restaurant before check in for our evening meal. We were greeted in the restaurant by the staff and also Mr Anas Rahhouti who was the assistant director. He explained about all the different stations of food and I have to say was extremely informative and helpful. FOOD...... Wow where do I start never once during this holiday did we get bored or fed up with the all inclusive food, there was something for everybody even the most picky of eaters and…

I have travelled a fair bit but now think it is proper to write on my experience as other people's reviews have in one way or another assisted our options too. My experience of this hotel could not be described in a few words just as a picture can tell a thousand words. So Kindly allow me to W R I T E...; I have never travelled to Marrakech prior, however I had to attend a family friend's son's wedding and from reading about Club Palmeraie Marrakech - ticked the boxes for me; STARTING POINT/RESERVATION - KNOWLEDGE OF PROPERTY My reservation was easy online and calling them to explain was a walk in the park & then my queries responded with such clarity and attentiveness by ANAS...whom I must salute cause the emails gave an assurance to embark, polite, well mannered,…

I came here with my son for 2 weeks. We arrived at about 2am and after checking in we was offered some food which I thought was really nice, we was taken into the restaurant and we had food prepared for us! Just something light but after traveling for 12 hours was nice! (Never been offered this option at other hotels when arriving late) The room was large and clean and always cleaned daily. The hotel and grounds was kept to a high standard. The gardeners was always working on the grounds in the 48 degree heat! The food was lovely all fresh and tasty! The food truck which my son loved did burgers,hotdogs and sandwiches. They also serve drinks non/alcohol all day. The guys in there I didn't get there names but they work really hard in the heat always smiling and happy! There…

Amazing holidays! Very nice club hotel with great animation round-the-clock until late at night, kid's adored the splash pool and had fun with the mini-club. Food is really tasty and varied, which isn't usually expected in all-inclusive hotels. Decoration is amazing, blend of Moroccan and Andalusian style, definitely the place to stay if you're coming to visit Marrakesh and it's area!!!

column3: An amazing hotel with everything you want and more. Outstanding service from all the staff
column4: We stayed here as a family of 4 for 10 days and couldn't have asked for more. The facilities at the hotel are first class with everyone's needs catered for. Our 2 young girls loved all the entertainment throughout the day especially all the dancing and foam party. The rooms were of a good size and the bathroom had a large walk in shower. The buffet restaurant covered everyone's taste buds and the food cart by the pool was a big bonus, especially the afternoon pancakes. We cannot speak highly enough of all the staff who always stopped to check we were ok and nothing was ever too much trouble. Whilst away it was our daughters birthday and they made a cake especially for her which she absolutely loved. Imad the guest relation manager went out of his way to make sure we had a…

We stayed at the resort as part of a weeks holiday to Marrakech and the Atlas mountains. It's busy but the service by all the staff is just fantastic with the CSM, Imad, setting a very high standard. We had a minor medical emergency on our first day when we needed a trip to a pharmacy and the local taxis were uncooperative. He sorted it for us - no fuss, no drama and he continued with caring enquiries every day until we left. The restaurant, bar and housekeeping teams are just delightful. The food and drink options are very good and the Moroccan restaurant is a must; book your slot ASAP on arrival. Whilst the resort is a little way out of Marrakech itself, there is an efficient and regular free shuttle into town. Be prepared for a 20 min walk each way to/from the Medina…

column3: Lovely, friendly place for a great mix of relaxation and active fun
column4: I stayed here for a week in August with my husband (we’re both 31, no kids, London-based and work full-time). We wanted to combine a lazy pool and bar based holiday with a bit of sightseeing, as well as celebrating our wedding anniversary. I’ve never done an all-inclusive holiday before – or even really a full-blown resort based holiday – and I wasn’t quite sure what to expect. I had two worries in advance – firstly, whether the food and drink would be nice, and secondly, whether on the one hand it might be too hectic and noisy for proper relaxation or on the other, whether we might get a bit bored. I was happy on both counts. We picked this hotel based mostly on the strength of the other reviews here and were definitely not disappointed. I would definitely both come back…

column3: Great place to come with the family
column4: We are on our final day :( of our holiday (2 weeks) but felt compelled to provide a review as we have thoroughly enjoyed. The hotel is good and if you are thinking of it, we can only say do it!! I admit we were unsure before we booked but it has been truly great. Everything on the holiday so far has run like clockwork. The staff here go above and beyond to make your stay a good one. They are the real differentiator for me.... Everyone has been so friendly and helpful. I have come with my two girls and thought we may struggle at times as they could've been board (how wrong we were!!) Kids club, trapeze, archery, belly dancing, kids discos and attending the show each evening have kept us busy.... While your enjoyable stay will be because of a full team effort from all of the…

column3: Great All Inclusive Hotel with outstanding service
column4: Out travel out was via was via Ryanair and probably cannot expect more but with Ryanair these days you don't even get a seatback pocket to temporarily store things in and with just as little leg room as if you had!! Flights were on time. Luton was slow going out but quick on return and very slow inbound to Marrakech (RAK) but much faster outbound although numerous checks were made from Bag drop to boarding aircraft - far more than is normal which I guess is encouraging. Transfer to hotel from RAK was chaotic to say the least and took considerable time. Return journey was much smoother and on time. Fantastic service exemplified by Imad (CRM) through virtually every attendant or bar-person. Very wide selection of food; drinks also great were local varieties but of very…

Fantastic hotel for families, good entertainment for children and adults alike. Staff are warm, welcoming and helpful. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay there. Food is also good. If you are looking for a quiet couples get away though, timing is important, perhaps not on school holidays.

My partner and I had a short five day trip in August. The hotel was full but we were looked after beautifully by all of the friendly and helpful staff. Special mention must go to Immad who went out of his way to look after us (buying us a forgotten adapter and getting it to us the next day) and make us feel individual and special. As a couple we chose to frequent the Zen pool during the day and the outside bar at night - avoiding the loud, busy pool and entertainment. Perfect for us to relax and unwind. The food was excellent in quantity and variety and the Moroccan restaurant outstanding - the soup was out of this world! The complimentary bus into Marrakech was also excellent. Although our room was spacious, well appointed and clean is was VERY close to the outside stage…

column3: It's as good as they say it is.
column4: Everything already said about this hotel is true. The grounds are well kept, the staff can't do enough for you, the activities are different (try the trapeze) and the food is amazing. Head chief needs a pay rise. The evening entertainment wasn't for us but other families loved it. Book a couple of day trips out. I can recommend jumbo tours. The quad bikes through dirt tracks leading to a beautiful lake was exciting bit not for the faint hearted. The historical tour gave us an insight into Marrakech. Special mention to Iman (manager))and babash (lady who worked the zen pool bar) definately stay here!!

Six of us stayed here for 12 nights from the end of July until the first week in August as all inclusive guests. The hotel is lovely and immaculately clean. There was some confusion initially over our rooms (3 of them) not being next to each other, but after asking to see the Manager, Ahmed rectified the situation for us. The rooms were clean and bright and fully met our requirements and the grounds of the hotel were lovely and very well maintained. The majority of the staff were superb, ranging from the Manager to the waiting staff and cleaning ladies, always helpful, friendly and attentive. The lady who works in the Zen pool bar was regularly rude somewhat disappointing when compared to the fantastic service from other staff. The pools were big enough and very clean, there…

We stayed at this hotel in July, and I must say that we will be repeating! The hotel is wonderful, clean, good food, accessible but the most important thing is the attention to detail. All the staff are continuously attentive to your every need. They are constantly asking you if you need anything and making sure everything is as you wish. I would recommend this hotel to anybody wishing to visit Marrakech. It's just about a 15 minute drive to the center, they have their own free shuttle buses or you can take a taxi which are always available from the front door.

Came here from the 11-15th August. I had an amazing stay with my family. The rooms are nice and they get cleaned very well everyday. Hotel in general is really clean and has terrific service and absolutely great customer service. Nice activities for the kids to do with the animation team, they were great with my niece. Jad and Sali in particular looked after my niece very well and she enjoyed it very much. Would really recommend coming here. In addition to this the lifeguards; Karim and hamza look after kids and adults very well and will help you with anything. Will definitely be coming again.

Me and my family stayed at Iberostar for only 5 days but the kids did many activities such as archery, water polo, trapeze and lots more to keep them busy. Jad, who looks after kids from ages 13-17, was great at making my kids time here a blast. He took them to a disco in which they played games etc. The animation team were amazing at keeping the kids occupied and held many activities for them to do. Meanwhile the kids were off doing their activities me and my sisters went to dance with Sali (an entertainer). They had shows on at night after dinner where the little kids have a mini disco and some terrific dance shows. The service here I've found no where else. A great family hotel, delicious food in the buffet and really good customer service. A clean hotel and lovely rooms.…

I think this hotel is a good 'standard' all inclusive, it was excellent value for money for a few days away in August. We had a lovely break and would recommend the hotel to others who want to relax and perhaps do a bit of exploring too. Food - The food in the main buffet restaurant was fine, there was plenty of choice and we always found something that we liked. We went to the Moroccan restaurant (one per stay) and really enjoyed the food there, although it wasn't a menu choice as we'd expected but just a set meal choosing between fish or beef for the main dish (not really catering for vegetarians either). The service in there was fantastic and we were looked after well. The main buffet was extremely busy during peak times and sometimes felt a bit chaotic, it seemed that there…

column3: You will NOT be disappointed.............we weren't !!!
column4: Having just returned last week after spending 6 days in this wonderful hotel, I could not recommend it enough. We travelled with 3 boys (9, 9 & 6) and elderly parents, more so to celebrate our fathers 80th birthday. We were not disappointed from the moment we checked, with speed in which this was done and then off to our clean, spacious and modern garden facing rooms. We had 3, all next to each other which made it easier to ensure all 9 of us were together most of the time. The main buffet restaurant always had an abundant of choice despite that as our mother is a vegetarian one of the main chefs was always to hand to make any particular dish she fancied, which was VERY nice of him/them. You were always greeted by a smile by all, though one was always there to greet us…

column3: Good hotel but words of warning (!)
column4: I came and stayed in this hotel with two friends at the end of June for one week and whilst our experience on the whole was great (the majority of the staff are brilliant, the rooms are clean and the facilities are really well maintained), I did feel the need to write a review, mainly as a lesson learnt that I can share with anyone else who goes here. We used the safes for our valuables the entire trip, until I forgot on our second to last night to put away a diamond necklace that I had been wearing that evening and some cash. When I came back to the room the next day, having spent the day around the pool, I immediately noticed that my necklace and the cash were no longer in the room. Conscious that I didn't want to accuse the hotel staff without looking in the room very…

I stayed here with my sister in June. We arrived in between lunch and dinner, so the restaurant wasn't open " no problem we will open the kitchen and prepare whatever you would like to have". That was the start of what can only be described a truly wonderful experience, nothing was to much, all the staff were friendly, greeting each and everyone with a smile. Our room was spotless and refreshingly cool from the Moroccan heat, and the hotel and grounds were immaculate. The only thing I could have a bit of a niggle about, was that all food and drinks seemed to be sugar based, which is not great for a person like me who doesn't have a sweet tooth at all. If you are going to Marrakech and want to guarantee comfort and cleanliness this is the choice for you!. I'll be back next…

My husband and I stayed here between the 28th July and 4th August this year, after much deliberation on which hotel to stay in, we chose the Iberostar Club Palmeraie following excellent reviews on trip advisor. We were travelling without our children and were looking for something special within our budget. We were not disappointed! After a rocky arrival with regards to our room NOT being ready, and having to wait due to a late check out of the previous occupant! our room was comfortable, spacious and extremely clean as is the whole resort, the management particularly Imad and the rest of the management team are very conscientious and take great pride in their guests comfort, they would check on us daily and remembered our names, went above and beyond to restore my faith in…

Returned yesterday from a 10 day holiday with my husband, The hotel was fantastic and so clean, The food was lovely with so much variety which caters to everyone. The food in the Moroccan restaurant was Delicious, just a shame we couldn't go more than once in the 10 days. The entertainment was brilliant day and night for all ages. The pools were great-1 quiet pool, 1 busy pool with daily activities and 1 children's pool. All the staff were fantastic-Imad, Anas, Abdu, hakim, faissal just to name a few. We would definitely return and recommend this hotel to all.

This resort is beautiful with spotless modern rooms and amazingly kept gardens but what sets this resort apart from the others we have visited is definitely its staff. We would like to give special thanks to Imed, who tended flawlessly to our needs. For him, 'no' was not an option and he worked hard to remember who we were and checked up on us daily. Although I am not a fan of buffet restaurants the staff really worked had to prepare various and delicious dishes. The buffet was continiously restocked and cleaned. Abdel (chef terras exterieur) was fantastic, he always made sure our dinners were very special with his eye for detail and infinitive smile. Chef Mamadou himself brought baby meals to our 10-month old daughter! The highlight of our 5-y daughter was the Star Club,…

Returned yesterday from a 4 day break with friends and children. From start to finish we had a great time. The hotel is flawlessly clean and tidy but what makes this hotel so good are the staff. From the moment we arrived we were welcomed by the manager Imad who constantly ensures guests are enjoying themselves. Everyone was so friendly and couldn't do enough for us, Hassan and Mohammed to name but 2 who contributed to our great holiday. The food is fab with lots of choice to the entertainment team who kept us thoroughly entertained! Will definitely be returning! Thank you for a fab holiday

Hi, we have been to this hotel twice now and it is more enjoyable each time! the staff are very friendly and attentive. only problem we had was the Zen pool. the lifeguard did not bother to ask any of the guests to not use inflatables, shout, dive or anything,he often vanished for long periods of time and i found him in the mens toilets on his mobile!!! had to complain several times to the general manager, who was very good about the issues. would recommend if you want to relax this is a very clean and charming hotel, change the lifeguard and it would be 10/10???

I visited the hotel in July 2017 for one week with my husband, daughter and friend and we were extremely surprised! We arrived around 10PM and were greeted by the very polite and helpful reception staff. The restaurant was open for late arrivals too which was great. The food in the main restaurant was an exceptional buffet with plenty of choice and variation each day. The Moroccan Day/Night was one of our favourite days for the food! Thankyou to Laila and Samedi (morning/afternoon staff) for your excellent service as they went the extra mile for me and my family throughout the whole week. All bar staff are great too and very good at remembering our drinks. There are two pools, the Zen Pool if you want a little peace and quiet and the main pool with music and more…

We are visiting this hotel for one week,and all was top, the service was incredible,always asked and gave you the best advices,they are so nice and professional. The quality of food is excellent, the room always was clean. We travelled every day with the bus of the hotel to Marrakech city and it was puntual and directly to the Medina. For relax in the hotel is the maximum,swimming pool and nice entertainment everyday,the people work like entertainer always smile and professional. If you want to have the best experience ,don't hesitate to visit Iberostar club Palmeraie Marrakech. We will come back!!!

column3: Great hotel. Great staff. excellent service
column4: the hotel is 20-30 minutes from the airport in a quiet location. Lots for the kids to do Archery, tennis, relaxing by the pool. we all had a great time. a variety of food choices on offer . Management staff was excellent, always available for a chat and made a point to come over and talk to us. We spent 1 week and would definitely be going back.

Myself and 2 friends stayed at this hotel between 11th and 18th July 2017 and we were impressed with everything. Upon arrival the bell man loaded our bags until we checked in. The reception staff were very helpful especially advising what to put on our check in forms im relation to entry number etc. One of our friends arrived at the hotel on s different shuttle as we booked separately and upon asking the staff where his room would be located they advised he was close and we ended up with rooms next door to each other. We arrived after 10pm, after Dinner sittings had finished, but reception advised us where we could find some nibbles, which was appreciated. Rooms are lovely. Clean, tidy, decent size and the shower was amazing (which all ladies will appreciate - decent…

Superb hotel. The staff were fantastic, the hotel spotless, the rooms excellent, the facilities and activities well organised, the restaurant exceptional. If you read a review that is anything other than 5 stars then ignore it. This is a quality hotel of the highest standard and well deserves a 5 star rating

First of all, this hotel was a really nice surprise. First impression at reception, went calm and nicely, we sit and had a drink, will the reserve details are being checked Small and easy to understand where are the restaurants, pools and bars. Super clean hotel, nothing to say about it, to see how clean it is, one person clean it up the pool chairs everyday, one by one. 2 pools, 1 for resting, 1 for animation, really good. Kids club available with activities during all day, it seems they are separated by ages. The food is varied, even for vegetarians, easy to find something different to eat during the stay. Animation team always helpful. The Client manager, Imad, amazing person, it suits up for the job, always asking if anything is needed or if something was wrong, even…

I stayed here from the 10th-17th and had an amazing trip! I was actually due to stay in another hotel but due to extremely bad reviews changed over to this hotel and I am so glad I did. The hotel itself is beautiful, lovely open plan grounds, secure and safe and lots of places to explore. There are three pools, a kids pool, a quiet 'zen' pool and the main pool where the daily entertainment and activities take place. The pools are clean and unlike some all inclusive resorts where you have to fight to find a sun lounger, there are plenty around. No chance of being bored with activities such as water polo, volleyball, trapeze swings, archery etc. There's also a free shuttle bus in to the city and an excursion desk for any adventure seekers with trips like quad biking and mountain…

column3: Fantastic hotel, staff and customer service
column4: I stayed with 4 others from 10 to 14 July and would definitely return to the hotel and recommend to others. From the moment we arrived the management and staff were there to ensure our stay was relaxing and enjoyable. Visible management presence across the resort at all times and they checked regularly to ensure there were no issues. Clean rooms and a good variety of food. Good entertainment and activities for all ages, but also accommodates those who prefer quieter holidays. Overall excellent hotel, beautiful well maintained bounds, really helpful and professional management and customer service.

Just back from a fantastic week at iberostar don't know where to start !! Hotel is stunning beautiful grounds and inside and out has been done to a high standard and can't fault anything. Rooms are good size, 3pools one quiet one one lively and a small kids pool with lots of water features. The staff in hotel were some of the nicest people I have meet on a holiday they can not do enough for you from the moment you arrive till you leave and are on hand to help with any issues not that there were any. The animation team were super very talented , who made the holiday they seemed to care about everyone not pushy if you did not want to join in it was fine but there was always things to do they work so hard at making your holiday feel special and I was amazed how hey managed to keep…

I had a wonderful time at Iberostar hotel.The staf were fantastic.It was the attention to detail I loved the most about this hotel. You really felt pampered. My mum and I were on holiday for her birthday. I would like to particularly thank the public relations manager. He always called us my name. He ensured he made himself available to check our stay was going well. We felt listened to and attended to. I was really chuffed when I returned to the hotel room on my mothers birthday to find that the staff had put roses and a heart with a special birthday message for her. they also left two glasses and a chilled champagne bottle which made my mothers day particularly special. The food was great. The staff were always attentive.They always waited on you by making themselves…

column3: Iberostar has worked very hard to turnaround this hotel!
column4: Just returned from this hotel after spending a very relaxing week there. The hotel.......Two storey buildings set amongst beautifully maintained gardens with a childrens' pool, an activity pool and a very quiet zen pool. Lots of different activities around the gardens ie tennis courts, trapeze, exercise bikes, golf and archery to name a few. The hotel is gated and guarded by security, they also patrol around the grounds which is very reassuring. The staff.......Obviously all retrained under the Iberostar flag after the dreadful reviews from the previous owners. The managers set a fine example to their staff being very helpful and courteous at all times. Special mention to Immad who even walked around the pools to introduce himself and offer any assistance or advice. When you…

A brilliant hotel and holiday all round. Fantastic for just anyone from families to couples. Loved the quiet pool the lush garden surroundings and the attentiveness of the staff.. the guest service manager was brilliant, the bar and diner staff were brilliant and could not rate hear enough. The hotel, rooms and surroundings are absolutely stunning and no expense is spared on anything here. The food is top quality and absolutely phenomenal for an all inclusive. I would highly recommend and gladly stay again in this hotel.

column3: Can't recommend highly enough. Some of the best service I've received and in an immaculate hotel.
column4: Seldom do you receive such consistently great service from a resort. Imad in particular made us feel like we had a personal hotel manager. The staff were all lovely and seemed to take real pride in what they do. Can't speak highly enough of them. I don't have a bad word to say about the hotel either; clean, fantastic facilities, fantastic food. Some stuff I didn't realise before I went: There are multiple pools, multiple bars, handy shuttle service to the town and LOADS of stuff to do on site (trapeze, spin classes, archery, entertainment, theatre, spa etc etc). I actually feel the hotel was under sold to me. If you want to visit Marrakech (which you should) and you're looking for somewhere a bit away from the city centre, this is the place.

My girlfriend and I spent a week here in June 2017 and were really impressed. The room was spotless and really comfortable. All of the hotel staff were friendly without being too intrusive and Imad from customer services was exceptional in his level of attentiveness to everybody - he learned our names and checked in with us every time he passed to make sure we were happy, and when he overheard that it was my girlfriend's birthday he arranged for champagne and a freshly made cake to be sent up to our room. It was a really generous gesture and totally made her day. The grounds of the hotel are really well maintained and very attractive to walk around. We visited during Ramadan so the hotel wasn't as busy as it could have been - however, all the staff were so brilliantly attentive…

Stayed here mid June 17, everything at this hotel is very good and would not hesitate to book again, met at reception by Imad from customer services and he is always available if you have any issues, pool excellent, food excellent, drinks excellent, room excellent, animation team very good, had an issue with our return taxi which did not turn up and a member of the management team offered to take us himself to the airport, 10/10

After being transferred from a dreadful hotel this place was paradise! From the moment we arrived we were treated like royalty! Drinks on arrival whilst waiting for our room, cold bottles of water ..very impressed within a few minutes. The room was immaculate, bathroom spotless, towels smelt fresh, fridge fully working with bottles of water could not fault it. 3 pools, one lively with full entertainment programme, chilled out pool and children's pool. Staff brought drinks to sun loungers and towels available for hire. Food was excellent, bright airy restaurant, spotless clean and plenty of choice! Deserts were amazing!! Wine served to table if required. Morrocan restaurant is definitely worth booking into - the food was fabulous and service 5 star. I would like to personally…

column3: Wanted to love it; not amazing but not bad
column4: Reading the rave reviews I was so excited to stay for five night; the hotel was an average all inclusive. My main annoyances at the hotel; No gowns or slippers in the rooms (it's 40c outside yes but in an air conditioned room it's nice to have these) No tea or coffee making facilities in the room No TV listing guide Our toiletries were not replenished on a daily basis; I had to find house keeping one day to ask for more (not really something you should have to do if the hotel really is 4*) So many wasps outside! Some of the pre-prepared meals at the buffet had no ingredients listings Other guests using the incorrect serving implements for meals and causing meat cross contamination (not sure what the vegetarian who stayed here loved about plain pasta but I found the…

Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights at the beginning of July and had the best time. The rooms are really nice spacious. The food is great both in the buffet everyday and at the Moroccan restaurant. One of the girls I was with had a very bad nut allergy and the chef couldn't have been more accommodating. Chef Mammado showed her around the buffet everyday so she knew what she could eat and everyday made her her own cake as she couldn't have desert. All the staff were very accommodating and will help you with whatever you need. There were plenty of activities put on by the entertainment team which were all loads of fun.

Me and some girlfriends have recently got back from a four day stay at this hotel and honestly couldnt fault it. All the staff were so friendly and we were welcomed as soon as we walked through the door. Our trip was made slightly more difficult as one of my friends has a severe nut allergy, this was mentioned at check in and she was immediately taken to meet the chef (Mamado) who advised her of what she could eat at every buffet. He even made her a special dessert at every meal and we all really appreciated his amazing service. During the day there was a lot going on at the hotel and the animation team (Amine, Rasta, Morad, Abdel and Walid) ensured that there was never a dull moment (there is also a quiet pool to relax) and offered a range of activities such as archery,…

We arrived here from staying in an awful hotel in Marrakesh. This hotel saved our holiday. As soon as we walked we were welcomed with a smile and cool drink. The staff are very friendly and can't do enough for you. The rooms are very well looked after spotlessly clean great air con ,tv and fridge also in the room. The hotel has a main activities pool with the entertainment on the go all day there is a quiet pool which has its own bar and a kids pool also. The food was good varied choice everyday. The only small draw back is the location is out of Marrakesh but the hotel put a bus on daily so you can go into town. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone really enjoyed our stay.

Visited this hotel early in June and had an amazing stay. Hotel is really nice - very clean and nice rooms. Food was really good and would definitely recommend a visit to the themed Moroccan restaurant. Both day time and evening entertainment were fab and enjoyable. All the animation team was amazing - especially Amine, Walid who were all so friendly and made our holiday fun and one that we will always remember. Would highly recommend a visit to this hotel.

column3: Perfect first holiday with a baby!
column4: My partner and I spent a wonderful 4 nights at the Iberostar Palmeraie with our 10 month old baby. From the moment we arrived all of the staff were exceptionally friendly and attentive. They went out of their way to make your stay as comfortable as possible. Our room was comfortable and spotlessly clean. They had even given us a travel cot for the baby! All of the steps in the hotel had ramps so it was easy with a buggy. The swimming pools were excellent. Particularly the kids pool which was great for a baby and in parts was shallow enough to crawl in. The food was really good, especially all of the tagines and grilled meats at lunch and dinner. The restaurant has lots of highchairs for all the children and there is plenty of choice for kids whether you have a fussy eater or…

Hotel and staff brilliant! We stayed here for a week room was excellent. Staff very friendly .it was our wedding anniversary and management sent us flowers champagne .food was fantastic everyday hot fresh and different. Pools where clean with plenty of sunbeds .only problem was didn't stay for longer

stayed for 3 nights, it was absolutely amazing! all the staff were so friendly and full of fun! lots of dancing and entertainment! the food was great, lots of choice! the rooms were lovely and clean! lots of activities during the day, get involved in the water polo!!!

Stayed with Husband and Son from 18-28th June 2017. We are not easily impressed but the Iberostar Club Palmeraie Marrakech was far superior to the other 4 star hotels we have stayed at in Marrakech.
