The hotel is architecturally magnificent and we particularly appreciated the quiet Zen pool. Have never seen such happy staff and were treated like honoured guests. Mealtimes were elegant but relaxed with a very good variety of food on offer. We were impressed with the courteous and professional guest relations manager who often walked around the hotel rather than hide in an office. Have finally found the best Marrakech hotel and will return in September for longer.

column3: Just what we needed - thank you. 😊
column4: Booked through Voyage Prive, little bit apprehensive as it was our fist booking through them, but we needent have been nervous. The hotel was lovely. Met on arrival around 11am to a fruity drink and sweets whilst we checked in. Tip - don't forget about the tourist tax around £20 for our five night stay Our room was ready on arrival and a kind porter bought up our bags. Lovely room, massive bathroom with large rain head shower! Cute little balcony and the all important air conditioning! The managers are very visual throughout the hotel Imad especially - making sure to personally welcome you and remember your name!! Food is lovely, catering to the mass market with lots of option, but a little repetitive. The Moroccan restaurant is a must, beautiful food and great atmosphere. …

column3: Great time here - trying really hard and it shows
column4: Stayed here for 3 nights in this week. Booked this very last minute after the reviews at the hotel we had planned to stay at were so bad we cancelled. This hotel is a little way out from the airport and a top tip would be to book a transfer before you get here - the taxis at the airport will rip you off. Arrived at 11am and were greeted with drinks and sweets. Our rooms were ready and we were checked in really quickly after paying the tourist tax. The hotel and grounds are really clean with lots of facilities. Rooms were a good size and beds were very comfy. Shampoo etc in room and a small hairdryer. Plenty of sun beds available on the first day - much busier the other 2 days but we are up early so not a problem for us. So what do they need to work on to get a 5 star review?…

We had a brilliant stay in this hotel. The staff are fantastic, great facilities, very good food. Very clean throughout, good spa facilities. The only negative I can give is there's a lot of ants, don't particularly bother me but they might some people.

Just returned from a three night stay in this hotel with two other females. One who had stayed in two other hotels in marrakech previously. She said this is by far the best hotel she had stayed in. The hotel is beautiful, kept ridiculously clean even the grounds are kept immaculate! Staff are continuously working to keep the place clean and gardeners continuously working out in the heat. Staff are so attentive to your needs and constantly checking you are alright. Food is delicious, usually same sort of food every meal time with fresh stations cooking something different. Entertainment team also good. Can't fault this hotel and already planning our next trip. Would recommend this hotel and such good value for money!

Returned home this week from a lovely holiday , beautiful hotel cannot fault anything , the main restaurant was very clean and plenty of choice for all meals , the staff are all so friendly and helpful from the bar staff to the waiters in the restaurant , rooms were fab cleaned to the highest standard , special thanks to Rachida who served our breakfast and lunch always with a smile and also Imad who was very helpful and friendly who always had time to speak to you everyday , would definately recommend this hotel

I came home last week from this fantastic hotel with my boyfriend and we just want to go back!! The hotel was extremely clean and tidy, with authentic decor. Both the hotel and grounds are beautiful. There was a range of foods on offer each night in the main restaurant with the option to have pasta and meats cooked freshly infront of you. The majority of the food was the same each lunch and dinner time though. We were allowed to book into the Moroccan restaurant for one night. The meal was delicious! The barmen around the resort were great and very friendly, specifically Abdarahim who made us smile every day! The 'Star Friends' had a great impact on our stay and really made the effort to make everybody feel part of the fun. Amine and Jad are great entertainers and noticeably…

column3: Lovely hotel, but loud music all the time
column4: The hotel is really quite nice. My only criticism is the volume of the music. All day at one of the pools blasting out. They have a quiet pool also, which we frequented. At 7 in the evening when you want to have a drink, music blaring out by the bar/restaurant. If you want peace and quiet, this is not the place. A shame really

column3: Amazing, Amazing, Amazing what a fantastic Holiday! We spent 11 days here in June.
column4: Having recently been refurbished we were a little apprehensive but when we arrived and was met by Imad Khoudar, any doubts disappeared immediately. He made us extremely welcome asking our names, which he remembered for our entire stay of 11 days always asking how we were and if he could assist in anything then just ask. All the staff were extremely helpful and accommodating and never once made us feel uneasy.. We would like to say thanks to all the waiters, especially Rashida who served at breakfast and lunch, she was always ready to serve drinks and greeted us like friends every day . Amine and Mimi, in fact all the animation team who were always polite and helpful. Morad on the trapeze…. yes, trapeze, (which we were unaware of beforehand), helped Rose overcome her fear of…

Stayed here for a week in June with my boyfriend. Absolutely beautiful hotel, two pools (one quiet and one with activities and music) and modern, clean rooms with air con included. The staff made this holiday incredible, always friendly and happy and constantly making you feel welcome. If you're looking for a relaxing holiday this hotel is a perfect place to come, and also has sports and day activities and entertainment at night. Free shuttle bus to Marrakech many times throughout the day, only takes around 30 mins. The restaurant has a large variety of food and is what you expect from a four star hotel. Beautiful hotel and not to be missed!!!!

column3: Amazing, You have to stay here!!
column4: Would just like to thank the whole team for the hospitality and welcoming us with open arms, we'd definitely return, couldn't ask for anything better!! My husband arrived on 5th June at about 11am on our honeymoon (we're still here!) and were greeted by the friendliest team of people with a cocktail. After checking in we were told our room was available and it was lovely, light, airy and clean with great air-con! Throughout our stay the staff have been wonderful, encouraging you to join in whenever you want to. The majority of guest on arrival were French speaking made us feel included by translating everything which was lovely. All of the staff tried to remember your names and greeted you at every opportunity. The food is amazing and the buffet always fresh, replenished…

What a great hotel, lovely pools (large 1 lively, normal size 'zen' pool quiet, kids pool 'for kids'! And all away from each other. I used the zen pool because I'm an old git. Food was repetitive as other reviews express, but there is always enough choice so you don't have to eat the same things. Every member of staff I encountered was friendly and helpful as could be with some of them struggling with English, but my Arabic & French is limited so no-ones an expert! My room was nice 1171, multi-lingual TV, aircon, large bathroom with big shower. Well kept grounds. 30-40 minutes from airport depending on who's driving!!! 3 treatments at spa, hammam, massage, foot massage. All nice Only issues below Bar staff have poor knowledge of cocktails being offered even though recipes on…

Here with my parent's for a 4 day mid week break. Lovely clean and tidy hotel woth wonderful friendly staff. We had one minor issue which was immediately sorted and a free bottle of champagne and fruit provided which was a locely surprise. The only negative would be that the entertainment in the hotel was a bit "butlins" ...it was fine but not quote expecting the poolside sing along..ok once we got into it. Would be good if there was a bit more help with trips into Marrakech. The thomson rep who was in reception area (who was responsible for excursions) was absent more than not, and not overly helpful. Food was excellent...we ate far too much 😁😁

column3: Fantastic stay . going back in July
column4: Stayed with 2 friends in May .Lovely and clean only downside is that the food is too samey. Going back with my husband in July. Staff could not do enough for you. Pools are warm and clean. 10 mins by taxi to souks

Recently stayed here with a friend and I've got to say, it's incredible. The hotel is two floors - I mention this because when the sun sets, it takes forever for the shadow to case over the pool so you get extra sun time and my God does it get sunny - the staff at the hotel know this and despite their always being a bar open for you to get drinks at various location, waiters will come round with random ice fruit drinks to keep you refreshed and hydrated meaning you can still just lay around in the sun! There's, as far as I know, 3 pools, 1 for all activity related stuff and swimming, 1 for kids and 1 quiet area for adults, so they really do think about what people may want and cater towards it. The best thing about staying at the hotel, I have to say, it's the staff. Everyone…

We stayed here in May for one week all inclusive and we couldn't have asked for a better hotel. The food was lovely, with a great variety available at good times. All of the staff were extremely helpful, nothing was too much trouble. All staff spoke French and the majority spoke English. There is a Moroccan restaurant you can visit once during your stay, we would highly recommend this. The entertainment was good too, with lots of day time activities including a trapeze which was really good! There are two pools, one where entertainment takes place and another which is quieter without entertainment. Both clean with plenty of sun loungers. Our room was nice and very clean, the shower was really good and we were able to keep it on for a late check out too. The grounds were…

Me and my wife returned from this brilliant resort two days ago. We stayed for four nights. The staff here really made our holiday special. Everyone from the bar and canteen staff were so friendly and professional. The managers regularly came to check that everything was to our liking. We really appreciated everyone's attentiveness. We have stayed at many hotels in the past but have rarely been made to feel so welcome. I must mention our regular waiter Lahsen. He went out of his way to make sure that we were happy. My wife mentioned in passing that it was my birthday and Lahsen ensured that a surprise birthday cake was baked by dinner! This is exceptional service! It is going above and beyond normal service. Thanks again to the canteen staff.. The hotel itself is very well…

My husband and i have returned from a wonderful extra holiday at this extremely clean and impeccably run hotel . I have checked the reviews and there has been no poor review since the hotel has been taken over and completely refurbished . There has been one complaint about tasteless food . I did not try the daily pizza i ate the fresh carverys the Moroccan options the amazing salads and once in the Maroccan restaurant , we always found someting very nice to eat . The front desk are always pleasant and helpful , congratulations to you all . Mamagement are always around , many thanks Imad for your continuous attention .service in the restaurants was impeccable .staff soon regognise ones preferences . M. rahhouti was always around checking standards there are many activities but…

My husband and I booked this hotel last year before iberostar took over , to which we were quite optimistic that all would be well with the hotel. As it only opened last month we thought there might be teething troubles but from our arrival to until our week was over it was definitely worth the visit. When u walk in to reception you get the felling of a Moroccan welcome , very bright in colour. The restaurant is very clean the food great with many choices without being complicated, staff welcoming and helpful. Our room was a pool facing on the ground floor which was clean and the bathroom had had the bath removed with two choices of shower one of which was a rain effect. The air con was excellent and the room was cleaned through out daily with fresh towels, floor washed, the bed…

column3: Absolutely incredible, cannot fault one single thing
column4: We have just returned from a fantastic 5 day break, we had such a great time. The hotel has only been open since the start of April after being taken over by Iberostar. The resort still has a lovely Moroccan feel but is modern and refreshed. Most of the staff spoke great English however the main language spoken was French. The pools are lovely and great to relax by. The food was great, the Moroccan restaurant was very nice. Wifi was strong around the whole hotel, the included drinks were very good quality. There is a free bus to Marrakesh that operates several times a day to a timetable (see photo provided in this review) Honestly cannot fault at all.

Fantastic garden, more activities than you can name. Delicious and varied food. Superb animation team and very friendly staff. Long story short, we loved our holiday. (During our stay the hotel was still in renovation, but this didn't reduce the level of service or beauty of this place)

column3: Outstanding Value for Money, Lovely Staff & Beautiful Grounds!
column4: On the basis of what we paid for our week's holiday we definitely feel the hotel more than deserves 5 stars. We have only been home a few days and we already want to go back! When you consider Iberostar only re-opened this hotel on 1st April 2017 things are already very good. If you pay a high price for a holiday your expectations are obviously much higher - we are basing our review on the amazing value for money this hotel currently offers. The most impressive aspects of this hotel are the outstanding restaurant staff (we will try to give the names of all our favourite staff) and the overall cleanliness and attention to detail of the hotel and grounds. The flowers and gardens are stunning. Everywhere is spotless. It obviously assists greatly that everything is brand new but…

My family of 3 have just spent a week here with friends (another family of 3)and overall had a lovely time although we did have some minor problems the hotel has just re-opened after changing hands and I am confident that those problems will be sorted out. Pools were lovely not sure if they were heated but once you were in it wasn't too cold. Plenty of sun loungers available but hotel was not full. My daughter loved the splash pool and the play area and I loved the zen pool my husband loved the gym. We didn't join in any sport while there as I didn't take any trainers but lots of sports activities available like tennis, basketball, spinning, Bowles, football and lots more. We did not try the trapeze was not brave enough but children were joining in and put us to shame. Our…

We booked this last minute (the day before flying) for a quick weekend away in the sun. We weren't disappointed. Within 5 hours of leaving Bristol we were sat in 25 degree heat. Welcome at reception was excellent and room was lovely. As we arrived late sandwiches were put aside in the restaurant which was a lovely touch. Facilities at the hotel were excellent with staff extremely friendly and going out of their way to help and keeping everything spotlessly clean. Food was excellent-make sure you reserve the Moroccan restaurant whilst you are there. Only thing that stopped this having an excellent review was an unfortunate problem with the room with the air conditioning unit leaking excessively and flooding the tiled floor. Whilst we appreciate problems occur it was…

I wish there were 10 stars to give to this hotel!!! The hotel has been refurbished around 8 months ago so everything is brand new. The staff are incredibly polite and helpful and you can see how they are very well managed and they truly want to make sure no customer is left unhappy. They pay incredible attention to cleanliness!! As I was going for breakfast one morning, I saw the manager asking one of the staff to clean the floor again because there was a small line made by someone's suitcase. At the breakfast/lunch/dinner buffet, there are staff who literally clean all the surfaces as the guests help themselves to the food if there are any drops of sauces or any spots. Our family of three spent three nights here in April, as a base to explore the wonders of Marrakech as well as the surrounding attractions. We have only positive impressions of the friendly and professional reception staff, well kept grounds (always seemed to be multiple workers keeping things clean), pools, numerous activities, relaxing outdoor dining facilities, as well as the food (excellent quality and variety). The only detraction was the high sound level of the musical entertainer who performed in the courtyard until 11 PM, somewhat disturbing early sleepers. I strongly urge you to consider this all-inclusive resort if you need a retreat from the hustle & bustle that is Marrakech.
